peppers.name: ABCHAZSKIJ OSTRUYI
peppers.description: A Russian Cultivar. This plant which can grow upto 3 1/2 ft tall, produces good yields of 4 ¼" long by ¾" wide hot peppers which turn from light green to red upon maturity (85 days). Rare variety.

peppers.name: ABEYTAS
peppers.description: A rare variety from Abeytas, New Mexico, USA (hence the name). This 3ft plant can produce as produce up to thirty 4in pods which look very similar to the more common Hungarian hot wax. Pods mature from green to yellow and then to red upon maturity after approximately 90 days.

peppers.name: AC 635 (PI 185474)
peppers.description: An attractive new variety from Reimer seeds which is registered by the United States Department of Agriculture as PI 185474.  This Plant produce good yields of 2" long by ½" wide hot peppers which grow upright on a sturdy plant. Peppers have good heat and mature from yellow to red in approximately 85 days.

peppers.name: SONEPAT
peppers.description:
A dried yellow/orange chile from India's Punjab, used for imparting a 
yellow colour to curries.

peppers.name: PI 639650 (GRIF 14223)
peppers.description: Plant erect, supported, approximately 80 cm. tall. Branches in zig zag. Fruits pendulous, brilliant red, piquant.

peppers.name: ACE F1
peppers.description: A hybridised F1 bell pepper variety.  These plants are high yielding and have good tolerance to cold weather and blossom drop with nearly every flower producing a pepper. The blocky 3 or 4 lobed medium sized bell peppers mature from green to red in only 50 days. An excellent choice for gardeners who want a heavy crop and have not previously had success growing bell peppers.

peppers.name: ACEITUNO (PI 281443)
peppers.description: A Habanero type hot pepper named after the region in Venezuela where it is grown. This plant produces good yields of 1 ½" long by 1 ¼" wrinkled bell shaped pods which mature from green to orange in approximately 100 days.  United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) registered PI 281443

peppers.name: ACHAR (GRIF 15776)
peppers.description: A Cayenne type pepper from India. Plants produce a multitude of 3 to 4in long by 0.75in wide pods which taper to a point. Pods mature from green to deep red and are mildly pungent. Used in Indian Cuisine.

peppers.name: ACI SIVRI
peppers.description: A Turkish heirloom Cayenne type. Each plant can produce upto fifty 5 to 9 in long shiny crimson pods which are often curled and twisted. The pungency is notoriously inconsistent as pods can range from ildly pungent to burning hot. The pods start pale green before maturing to crimson in 90 days. One for Indian cooking connoisers.

peppers.name: ACONCAGUA
peppers.description: A Cubanelle type named after Mt.Aconcagua in Argentina. These very large fruit can grow upto 12in long and mature from yellow/green to red in approx 75 days. The flesh is medium thick, very sweet to taste and are fantastic for roasting..

peppers.name: ADELE F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: A green to yellow blocky bell pepper type from Enza Zaden B.V. Said to be high yielding and resistant to tobacco mosaic virus (TMV)

peppers.name: ADMIRAL
peppers.description: This broad plant has much foliage to protect the bell pepper type fruits from sunburn. The 4 lobed blocky fruits measure approximately 4 1/2 inches and  mature from green to yellow approximately 70 days after transplanting. Said to produce consistent yields with  good disease resistance.

peppers.name: ADRIATICO F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: A Marconi sweet pepper type from United Genetics.  Adapted to the Italian Adriatical costal region, as an interesting substitution to the local "Pescarese" variety. The 6in elongated fruit mature from green to red and have good disease tollerance to TMV.

peppers.name: AFFINITY
peppers.description: Trialed in the Central Valley of California for the main growing season, this bell pepper variety has demonstrated good fruit quality and high yields of large blocky fruits

peppers.name: AFGHAN LONG
peppers.description: These thin walled peppers grow upright on 2ft tall plants. The peppers are 2 to 3 inch long and look similar to Japanesse Hot Claw in appearance. They are medium hot hot and mature from green to red approximately 75 days after transplanting.

peppers.name: AFGHAN SHORT
peppers.description: These peppers grows 3 to 4in long and are 1/4 in wide. The pods matures from green to red and have a  twisted Cayenne type shape.

peppers.name: AFRICAN BIRDSEYE
peppers.description: Since many wild chiles have the word "bird" in their names, distinguishing among them can be difficult. The African birdseye chile is both wild and domesticated and is also known in English as the African Devil, Monbassa or Zanzibar chile, or in Swahili as pili-pili. Depending on growing conditions, the plants range in height from 1 to 4 feet tall and are usually very bushy. The pods grow erect of the plant and measure between 1/2 and 1 inch long and taper to a blunt point. They mature from green to bright red and are very pungent measuiring around 175,000 Scoville units.

peppers.name: AFRICAN DEVIL
peppers.description: A ripe pod shown here. Description currently unavailable.

peppers.name: AFRICAN SNUB
peppers.description: These chiles are sald to be virtually identical to the Jalapeno. They growto  aproximately 5 cm long by 2.5 cm wide

peppers.name: AGCO HOT
peppers.description: This white flowering plant produces high yields of 5 ½" long by 1 ½" wide hot peppers which mature from green to red in 85 days.

peppers.name: AGNI SIKHA II
peppers.description: An Indian Cayenne type pepper. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: JALAPENO AGRISET 4001
peppers.description: This is the jalapeno pepper hybrid developed by Agriset seeds in the US. It is said to have many beneficial advantages other the standard variety in that it fruits earlier (approx 60 days), does not crack and provides higher yields. The pods  grow to 3 1/2 X 1 1/2 inch and mature from green to red.

peppers.name: AGRONALDO DE ASTI
peppers.description: Glossy chiles from Guatemala. A miniature chilhuacle but with more heat

peppers.name: AGUA BLANCA
peppers.description: An Anahiem/New Mex type pepper. This medium sized plant produces 6 to 8 inches long by 1 to 2 inches pendant shaped pods which mature from green to red. Said to good for roasting and use in Stir Fries.

peppers.name: AJI AMARILLO (PI 152217)
peppers.description: Many peppers are called Aji Amarillo as it simply translates into 'Yellow Pepper' and hence is alternative name, 'Aji Yellow'. These plants can reach 5-6 feet in a single season, with fruits averaging 6-7 inches in length. The fruits start off green maturing to orange, typically 120 days after transplanting. The fruits are quite pungent and are usually dried and powdered for use in many Peruvian and Bolivian dishes. 40,000-50,000 Scoville units places them at the medium/hot pungency end of the heat scale. Llisted as United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) variety PI 152217

peppers.name: AJI ANDEAN
peppers.description: This plant produces high yields of 2 ½" long by 1" wide hot peppers which mature from green, to orange and finally to red approximately 85 days after transplanting. This plant also displays the distictive 'Aji type'  white flowers with greenish-yellow markings around the Corolla.

peppers.name: AJI AYUCULLO
peppers.description: Aji Ayucullo is an original and native name that has no meaning nor translation. This Aji variety is a small, thick-fleshed, oval-shaped Aji. It is a wild capsicum variety found in the Peruvian jungle, central region and the Chanchamayo and Villa Rica valleys. The Aji Ayucullo is not commercially grown but is harvested from wild plants.

peppers.name: AJI BENITO
peppers.description: This attractive plant produces high yields of 1 ½" long by 1" wide peppers that mature from light green to red approximately 90 days after transplanting. The plant has green stems and the distinctive baccatum type white flowers with greenish-yellow spots around the corolla.

peppers.name: BENI MARKET (PI 543205)
peppers.description: This plant produces heavy yields of small diamond shaped hot peppers which mature from light yellowish-green, to orange and then to red approximately 90 days after transplanting. The plants have green stems, green leaves and white flowers. The pods are very flavorsome and aromatic and have a charactertic point.  Listed as United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) variety PI 543205. Also called Aji Bolivia.

peppers.name: AJI BRAZILIAN BONANZA
peppers.description: This rare white flowering Aji variety produces heavy yields of 2 ¼" long by ½" wide hot peppers which grow upright on tall sturdy plants which can grow upto 4ft in height. The peppers mature from green, to orange and then to to red approximately 90 days after transplanting. They are 10 times hotter than most Aji varieties.

peppers.name: AJI BROWN
peppers.description: The Aji Brown also known as 'Aji Panca' is the second most common Aji variety in Peru and is grown mainly near the coast. It is sometimes mistaked for a Baccatum but is actually part of the Chinense species.. The plant is white flowering and can grow up to 3ft in a single season. The pods are large measuring 4 to 6 inches long and 1 to 1 1/2 inches across, have medium thick flesh with a berry flavour and smokey overtones. They mature from green to a deep rich brown in approximately 85 days. Its aromatic taste makes it superb raw in salsas or salads. 1,000-1,500 Scoville units

peppers.name: AJI CABALLERO
peppers.description: This 3 to 4 feet tall plant yields lots of 1in long firey hot peppers which stand upright on the plant. Used extensively in traditional Puerto Rican cooking, particularly to make 'pique'.

peppers.name: AJI CACHUCHA
peppers.description: Aji Cachucha is a small mild, sweet-tasting pepper used in many traditional Cuban dishes. It is also sometimes known (especially in Puerto Rico) as an Aji Dulce.  The pods ripen from a light pale green to a yellow/orange. Don't confuse this pepper with the habanero, which looks very similar and is related, as although it has the Habanero flavour,it has none of the heat.

peppers.name: AJI CENTRO AMERICANOS
peppers.description: This variety is grown by our pod pals Mats & Patricia Pettersson in Sweden and very little infromation is know. These small bullet shaped pods grow erect on the plant and mature from white to red.

peppers.name: AJI CEREZA
peppers.description: The Aji Cereza is similar in shape to a cherry, hence ts name, 'Cereza' which translates into Cherry in Spanish. Found commonly in the Peruvian jungle, these tall sprawling plants produce very pungent small cherry like pods which grow upright on the plant and mature from green to a deep red colour. 70,000 - 80,000 Scoville units

peppers.name: AJI CHARAPA
peppers.description: Aji Charapa is wild variety found in the northern region of the Peruvian jungle, close to the city of Iquitos. In this area, the people are called "Charapas", hence its name. The small tepin like spherical pods measure a maximum of 1/4 in diameter and mature from green to a red and/or yellow. This variety is not grown commercially, but mostly in backyards or is harvested from wild plants. The AjÌ Charapa is eaten fresh with foods or used as an ingredient in preparing all types of dishes

peppers.name: AJI CHIVATO (PI 260550)
peppers.description: This plant is more accurately part of the Capsicum baccatum var. pendulum species and produces good yields of 1" long by ¼" wide peppers which mature from green to orange approximately 85 days after transplanting.|The Plant has green stems, green leaves, and white flowers. United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) number PI 260550

peppers.name: AJI CHOMBO
peppers.description: A Scotch Bonnet type from Panama which is used extensively in South America and the Caribbean for making hot sauces. These very pungent peppers are very hard to get hold of in the UK, but are a must for anyone who likes to make their own 'authentic' sauce.

peppers.name: AJI CHUNCHO (PI 260480)
peppers.description: This relatively tall, bushy plant produces  0.75in long by 0.5in wide pods which grow erect on the plant. They mature from green to red.

peppers.name: AJI CITO
peppers.description: This is the hottest baccatum measured so far by the New Mexico State University (NMSU). This plant produces good yields of 2" long by ½" wide yellow pedant shaped peppers which are similar in appearance to the more common 'Lemon Drop'. There peppers are very pungent and mature from green to yellow approximatly 90 days after transplanting The plant has green stems, green leaves and the characterstic baccatum type white flowers with greenish-yellow markings. Approximately 100000 scoville heat units.

peppers.name: AJI COLORADO
peppers.description: This very prolific, tall variety from the Peruvian Andes produces brilliantly coloured 3 to 5in pendant shaped pods, which are slightly wrinkled. The pods mature from green to a brownish red approximately 75-80 days after transplanting. These tasty peppers are used both fresh and in their dried powdered form.

peppers.name: AJI CRISTAL (PI 281320)
peppers.description: A beautiful variety from Curico in Chile, this 2-3ft tall plant produces good yields of 3 ½" long by 1 ½" wide pendant shaped pods which mature from light green, to pale yellow and then to red approximately 90 days after transplanting. Pods have a citrus like flavour and many say they are best eaten when immature. Excellent for making salsa. United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) variety PI 281320.

peppers.name: AJI DE BOTON (PI 593933)
peppers.description: This 3ft tall plant produces good yields of 1" long by ¾" wide hot peppers which mature from light yellow to orange approximaetly 90 days after transplanting. These peppers are found in farmers markets in Provincia Manabi, Ecuador. United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) number PI 593933

peppers.name: AJI DE MESA (PI  257143)
peppers.description: This wild variety, part of the species Capsicum baccatum var. pendulum produces 2 ¼" long by ½" wide peppers that mature from green to red. The plant has green stems, green leaves, and white flowers. United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) variety number PI 257143

peppers.name: ACOMA PUEBLO CHILE
peppers.description: A large green medium to mild chile pepper. A more deetailed description is  currently unavailable.

peppers.name: AJI DULCE 1
peppers.description: A good choice for those who like the flavour and aroma of Habanero peppers but find them too hot. Aji Dulce has the same shape, size, color and aroma of Habanero, but is sweet, spicy, and delicious, with only a trace of heat. The fruits are highly aromatic and the flavor is unusual and complex, with overtones of black pepper and coriander, and undertones of other spicy flavours. The pods themselves are approximately 1 to 2 inches long by 1 to 1.25 inches wide, tapered and mature from pale green to orange and then to red.

peppers.name: AJI DULCE 2
peppers.description: A 1 to 2 inches long by 1 to 1.25 inches wide; Habanero type pepper which  matures from green to orange and then to  to red. The fllavour and aroma  is similar to the habanero but without the heat.

peppers.name: AJI DULCE 3
peppers.description: A 1 to 2 inches long by 1 to 1.25 inches wide,  Habanero type pepper which  matures from green to orange and then to red. The pods are pendant shaped with a flattened bottom and have a flavor and aroma similar to habanero but without the heat

peppers.name: AJI ESCABECHE (PI 260580)
peppers.description: This tall vigorous variety produces 5" long by 1 ¼" wide pods which mature from green to red approximately 85 days after transplanting. The pods are mildly pungent. United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) number PI 260580.

peppers.name: AJI EXPLODING FIRE
peppers.description: These fiery little pistols grow erect on a medium tall plant. The pods grow approximately  ¾" long and ¼" wide and are very similar to the Bird Ají in flavour, flesh and appearence. The mature from green to orange and then to red in around 90 days but watch out as the birds love 'em.

peppers.name: AJI GUSANITO (PI 543203)
peppers.description: Actually a Frutescens / Chinense cross, this plant is anything but a typical Frutescens in terms of both appearence and flavour. The pods have Chinense characteristics being pungent and wrinkled. They look very much like the similarly named Aribibi Gusano (the Caterpillar pepper). They mature from white to yellow. The seeds are much sort after although very hard to get hold.

peppers.name: AJI HABANERO
peppers.description: 2 to 2.5 inches long by 0.5 to 0.75 inches wide; Andean Aji Type; matures from yellow green to orange; pendant pods; from S. America; Uses: Tall Variety; Long Season;Very interesting taste. Combination of sweet and sour taste. Not too hot, just nice little heat.

peppers.name: AJI ORO
peppers.description: This variety is part of the species Capsicum baccatum var. pendulum Thethin walled  pods are long and slender measuring  8cm long & by 1cm wide. They mature to a lemon yellow. Also known as Aji Amarillo and Penn's Golden.

peppers.name: AJI LEMON DROP (PI 315024)
peppers.description: This terrifically hot, citrus-flavored pepper is a popular seasoning pepper in Peru where it is known as 'Kellu Uchu'. It is also known in the western world as  'Hot lemon' or 'Lemon Drop'. The bright yellow, crinkled, cone-shaped fruits are about 2-1/2" long and 1/2" wide and mature from green to yellow approximately 100 days after transplanting (Long season) have less seeds than the average pepper,  containing than 15 seeds on average. They plant is vine like typically reaching a height of about 3 ft. Like other baccatum species this pepper was practically unknown in the West until the early 1990s, but are now gaining wide scale popularity.

peppers.name: LIMO
peppers.description: 2 to 3 inch long fruit grow on a vine like plant and mature from green to red or yellow (depending on the strain) in approximately 90 days. When dried, this Aji becomes tapered and wrinkled. It is mostly grown and used mainly on the northern coast of Peru.

peppers.name: AJI MIRASOL (PI 290982)
peppers.description: This is a hydridised variety whose name means  "looking at the sun". It is a cross between an Aji Colorado and a Mirasol which has resulted in plant which produces shorter, thin skinned, brown peppers which have apricot overtones.

peppers.name: AJI MONGOL
peppers.description: A relatively small (18 in x 18in) plant which produces drooping apple shaped red fruits. This plant also has stunning flowers and unusual brownish coloured seeds. Rare and very unusual.

peppers.name: AJI NORTENO
peppers.description: The name of the AjÌ Norteno translates to "northern ajÌ" because it is a variety that is only popular in the northern coastal valleys of Peru. The plants are vigourous producing many 3 to 4 inch long pendant pods which mature to yellow, red, and also to  orange colours.  The Vir and Lambayeque valleys in Peru are the main production areas for this variety and it is commonly eaten fresh with seafood. Northern people Peruvian pledge that the AjÌ Norteno has a "better northern taste.

peppers.name: AJI ORANGE
peppers.description:
A very vigorous and productive cold tolerant plant from Peru, the long
pods turn bright orange, are very hot , and have a delicious
distinctive fruity flavour and aroma.

peppers.name: AJI ORCHID (PI 497974)
peppers.description: This variety has many names: Balloon, Pimenta Cambuci, Campane, Peri Peri, Ubatuba Cambuci, Aji Flor, Bishops Crown and Bishops Hat to name a few!! This very unusual pod shaped variety is believed to have been  transfered from South America to Europe by the Portuguese in the 18th century and is actually part of the species Capsicum baccatum var. pendulum.  The plants are quite large growing 3 to 4 ft tall and produce 30 to 50 extremely weird 3 or 4 flat winged, wrinkled almost flying saucer like 1 ½" wide pods. The flesh of each pod is thin athough crisp to taste and they mature from green to red approximately 90-100 days after seedlings have emerged. The body of the pods have some detectable heat, but the wings are sweet and mild.

peppers.name: AJI PANCA
peppers.description: The Aji Panca Chile is the second most common Aji variety in Peru and is grown mainly near the coast. It is also known as AJi Brown. The plant is white flowering and can grow up to 3ft in a single season. The pods are large measuring 4 to 6 inches long and 1 to 1 1/2 inches across, have medium thick flesh with a berry flavour and smokey overtones. They mature from green to a deep rich brown in approximately 85 days.. Its aromatic taste makes it superb raw in salsas or salads. 1,000-1,500 Scoville units

peppers.name: AJI PICANTE (PI 260535)
peppers.description: This tall sprawling wild variety can grow up to 6 feet tall. Leaves are elliptical to lanceolate. Plants continue to flower and set fruits from midsummer until frost, so fruits in all stages of development are on plants at the same time.  This variety is actually part of the species Capsicum baccatum var. pendulum.

peppers.name: AJI PINEAPPLE
peppers.description: Very similar to - if not the same as Lemon drop. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: AJI PUCOMUCHO
peppers.description: AjÌ Pucomucho, a wild ajÌ, has an original and native name that has no meaning nor translation and is found in the Peruvian jungle, central region, and Chanchamayo and Villa Rica valleys. Thie pods are small, thin, elongated and pointed and mature to a bright yellow color. The AjÌ Pucomucho is not commercially grown, but is grown mostly in backyards or harvested from wild plants. This ajÌ can be found only in local farmers' markets and is eaten fresh with foods or used as an ingredient in preparing all types of dishes

peppers.name: AJI RED
peppers.description: Also known as Aji Rojo. Description currently unavailable.

peppers.name: AJI ROJO
peppers.description: An Andean Aji type also known as Puca uchu or Aji Red. These large plants can grow upto 90cm tall by 90cm across and are prolific producers of 4-6in long pendant shaped pods which from mature green to deep orange/red. Quite a rare pepper.Long Season.

peppers.name: AJI SERRANITO
peppers.description: This is a hybridised variety that is common in Peru and is a cross between an Aji Amarillo and Serrano. The pendant shaped 2 to 3in pods mature from green to red and have a mild pungency.

peppers.name: AJI UMBA RED (OJEMMA)
peppers.description: These nice pods have a similar heat, aroma and flavour of the Habanero, but a more 'box-like' appearence. They average about 1 - 1.5 inches in length and ripen from a light lime green to red on a shrub like plant. A nice varieity to use for 'Habanero hot sauces', salsas and for drying and smoking. Also know as Adjuma and Ojemma.

peppers.name: AJI VERDE (PI 290983)
peppers.description: AjÌ Verdi is another ajÌ variety found in the northern coastal valleys of Peru, mainly in Lambayeque and Piura. The name translates to "green chile," however, the mature pods ripen into red and orange colors. The pungent pods are small, elongated and pointed, with medium flesh, measuring 2 to 3 inches long and 1/2 inch across. This variety is not commercially grown, but can be found growing in backyards or on farms cultivating a few plants. It is generally eaten fresh and is also used to make sauces

peppers.name: AJI YELLOW (PI 152234)
peppers.description: Also known as Aji Amarillo.. These tall plants can grow 6-7ft talland are prolific producers of uptp 6iin long (although 4in is more normal) pendant pods which mature from green to yellow. In their green stage the fruits are ideal for pickling and are on the mild side, when mature they have a distictive fruity flavour and are fairly hot. Plants can be over wintered as a perennial.

peppers.name: AJI YUQUITANIA
peppers.description: Also known as Amazon Chile and is beleived to orginate from the  from Cubeo Indians in the Mitu region of Colombia. The pods are approximately 2in long & 1/2 inch, tear shaped and mature from green to a shiny red in approx 100 days. They are reputed to be extremely pungent, some say as hot as a Habanero.  The Flavour is similar to Habanero and most other C. Chinense chile peppers.

peppers.name: AKABARE (GRIF 15868)
peppers.description: Small green to red habanero from Nepal.

peppers.name: AKC-86-39
peppers.description: An indian Cayenne type pepper. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: AKOLA
peppers.description: This is a local variety from Thane near Bombay, India. The pods are small, only 4 cm long by 2 cm wide and are mildly pundent

peppers.name: ALADDIN
peppers.description: This is a F1 hydridised Bell pepper variety. This relatively compact plant produces 5cm by 4cm fruits which ripen from dark green to yellow. Very productive and good disease resistance.

peppers.name: ALBA F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: A hybridised bell pepper variety from Johnnys seeds. This sturdy plant produce medium-large, 4-lobed, blocky, ivory coloured peppers which ripen to scarlet red approximately 85 days after transplanting. Very unusual.

peppers.name: CALATAUCO (GRIF 15525)
peppers.description: A Pimento type chile from Argentina.

peppers.name: ALBERTOS
peppers.description: Named after Patricia Pettersson's uncle who grew them on the farm outside Rio de Janeiro. This plant produces 1in x1 1/2 in fruits which mature from light green to orange-yellow and then to red. Also know as Alberto's Locoto.

peppers.name: ALBINO BULLNOSE PEPPER
peppers.description: A early, sweet bell pepper variety. Dwarf plants produce white-cream coloured 3 to 4 in blocky peppers which ripen approximately 75 days after transplanting.

peppers.name: ALBORADO
peppers.description: New color and taste for gourmet salads. Very early, sweet bell pepper that stays white a long time before turning red. Dwarf bush produces medium-sized fruits with thick walls and good disease resistance. Suitable even for the far North.

peppers.name: ALCALDE
peppers.description: A native New Mexico chile that matured earlier than most chiles (75 -85 days). Mild-medium heat, with a complex, slightly sweet flavor when red. Pods approximately 4" long when mature

peppers.name: ALEPPO PEPPER (PI 181865)
peppers.description: These moderately hot red chilies from Northern Syria are sun-dried, seeded and crushed. They are named after the North Syrian town of Aleppo from where they orginate.  Also known as Halaby pepper, it is the preferred capsicum for adding the gentle edge of authentic Mediterranean flavour and fragrance.

peppers.name: ALLIANCE
peppers.description: Extra large, 3-4 lobed 4½ in/11 cm square fruit have thick walls, smooth skin and multiple disease tolerances to BLS 1, 2, 3, 5, PVY, Pepper Mottle Virus and intermediate tolerances to phytophthora blight

peppers.name: ALMAPAPRIKA
peppers.description: The Hungarian Almapaprika is very similar in shape to the Hungarian 'Klari Cheese' pepper, but is somewhat larger and is very hot to the taste.This great Hungarian pepper variety is also known as 'Hungarian Hot Apple Pepper'. These 2in peppers start out yellow but will turn orange to red as they mature (65 to 75 days). The peppers have a thick fleshed crunchy skin and have an intense flavour which makes them great for roasting or stuffing.

peppers.name: ALPHA
peppers.description: Large mild New Mexican chile. Great for a mld chile relleno

peppers.name: AMA 11
peppers.description: This variety was devloped by the Asian Vegetable Research and Development Center. The plant produces good yields of Plant produces good yields of 1 ¾" long by 1 ¼" wide campanulate shaped peppers which have a smokey tropical fruit aroma but no heat. The pods mature from light green to red in approximately 90 days. The plant grows approximately 1ft tall x 1 1/2 ft wide, has green stems, green leaves, and white flowers.

peppers.name: AMA 6 (GRIF 15855)
peppers.description: This variety was devloped by the Asian Vegetable Research and Development Center. The plant produces good yields of 2 ¾" long by 1 ¼" wide campanulate shaped peppers which have a fruity aroma but no heat. The pods mature from light green to red in approximately 100 days. The plants grow approx 1ft tall x 2ft wide and  has green stems, green leaves, and white flowers.

peppers.name: AMETISTA
peppers.description: A thick fleshed, bright purple ornamental variety which grows up to 1.5 inches long and 1/2 inch wide. The pods have an  earthy deep sweet tones. Commonly pickled and used to decorate salads.

peppers.name: AMAZON
peppers.description: These 2 to 2.5 inches long by 0.75 to 1.25 inch wide pendant shaped, Habanero type peppers matures from green to a bright yellow; Long Season.

peppers.name: AMETHYST (BELL)
peppers.description: A very thick walled classic four lobed bell pepper variety that turns green to purple to red (75 days)

peppers.name: AMIGO
peppers.description: Bell Pepper introduced by D Gilbart 1989

peppers.name: AMMAZZO (PI 592836)
peppers.description: This a small Italian cherry variety where 'Ammazzo' translates as 'small bunch of flowers'. This very unusual, 3ft tall, ornamental pepper bears clusters of 8 to 15 individual fruits which measure 1/2" high x 3/4" wide and resemble small red marbles in a green bowl. The peppers mature from dark green to red (75-90 days) and although they are edible, the plant is best used as an ornamental. This white flowering variety is also known as 'Nosegay' or 'Joes Round'.

peppers.name: ANAHEIM
peppers.description: Also known as California Chile or Chile Verde, this bushy upright plant can grow upto 2ft and is a prolific bearer of  long tapered 2 celled green which mature from green to red (77 days). The pods have a mildly pungency (250 SHU) and a slightly sweet flavour. The pods can be used green or red - hotter when red. Red chiles are sometimes left on the bush until they turning leathery, then dried in the sun to later be ground into powder and sold as Chile Colorado.

peppers.name: DOUX DES LANDES (GRIF 15386)
peppers.description: A Lamuyo, paprika type pepper fromVilmorin, the South of France. Pod length 17-22 cm, width 2 cm. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: ANAHEIM M
peppers.description: These 6 to 8 inches long by 1 to 2 inches wide pendant shaped peppers  matures from green to red. Very tasty and good eaten when stuffed, roasted, or in a Stir Fry

peppers.name: ANAHEIM TMR
peppers.description: Also know as the 'New Mexican Chile', this moderately pungent fruit is deep green, but turns red at full maturity (75 days). The very smooth peppers are 7-1/2 inches long and 2 inches wide and borne on tall, productive plants that offer good foliage cover for the fruit. Tobacco mosaic virus (TMV) resistant. Excellent for canning, roasting or drying. f Approximately 1000-3,000 scoville heat ubits

peppers.name: ANAHEIM TMR 23
peppers.description: A 6 to 8 inches long by 1 to 2 inches wide pendant shaped pepper which  matures from green to red. Mildly pungent registering only 900 to 3500 Schovill heat units (SHU)

peppers.name: ANCHO
peppers.description: This heart shaped pepper is what Mexicans use to make mole and chile rellanos, an intergral part of Mexican Cusine .The peppers are known as 'Ancho' when dried and 'Poblano' when fresh. The peppers are typically 3 to 4inches in length, mild in heat and mature from dark green to reddish brown in approx 80 days.

peppers.name: ANCHO 101
peppers.description: This heart shaped pepper is what Mexicans use to make mole and chile rellanos, an intergral part of Mexican Cusine . The peppers are known as 'Ancho' when dried and 'Poblano' when fresh. The plants are 30-36" tall with a spreading habit. The peppers are 4 to 6 inches long tapering to a blunt point by 2.5 to 3 inches wide. They mature from dark green to a brownish red in 76-80 days and are mildly pungent.

peppers.name: ANCHO 211 HYBRID
peppers.description: This heart shaped pepper is what Mexicans use to make mole and chile rellanos, an intergral part of Mexican Cusine. The peppers are known as 'Ancho' when dried and 'Poblano' when fresh. The thin walled 4 to 6 inches long tapered peppers mature from dark green to red and are mildly pungent..

peppers.name: ANCHO ARRIERO
peppers.description: The peppers are known as 'Ancho' when dried and 'Poblano' when fresh.

peppers.name: ANCHO CHINO
peppers.description: A smaller and more wrinkledversion of the traditional Ancho measuring 10-15 cm long by 7.5 cm wide. It is very dark brown, almost black, in colour, and has an aromatic fruity taste.

peppers.name: ANCHO GIGANTICA
peppers.description: The peppers are known as 'Ancho' when dried and 'Poblano' when fresh. Matures from Green to Brown in 90 days. 1000 to 1500 SHU     5 to 7 inches long by 2.5 to 3 inches wide; Ancho/Poblano Type; matures from green to brown;

peppers.name: ANCHO GRANDE HYBRID
peppers.description: 4 to 6 inches long by 2.5 to 3 inches wide; Ancho/Poblano Type; matures from green to red; pendant pods; called "poblano" when fresh, "ancho" when dried

peppers.name: ANCHO L
peppers.description: 4 to 6 inches long by 2.5 to 3 inches wide; Ancho/Poblano Type; matures from dark green to brown; called "poblano" when fresh, "ancho" when dried

peppers.name: ANCHO MULATO
peppers.description:
This pepper has a slightly smokier flavour than normal Ancho. Pods grow to around 5 inches long and 2 inches wide and mature from dark green to brown.
Very mild, 100-200 scoville units

peppers.name: ANCHO POBLANO
peppers.description: Poblano Chile when fresh or Ancho Chile when dried, these glossy, flattened chiles are a dark shiny green ripening to reddish brown and usable at either stage. They are 100 to 125 mm long and distinctively heart shaped. Poblanos are a relatively mild variety whose mellow aromatic flavor combines well with other ingredients in all types of cuisines to make rich sauces and mild chile powders. They are wonderful stuffed or roasted and added to tomato or egg dishes. Poblanos are easy to dry and hang in the kitchen in long, shiny strings, and you’ll find they will quickly become a staple. Plants grow to 750mm with handsome fruits borne like pendants from the upright branches

peppers.name: ANCHO RANCHERO F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: Tall sturdy plant with very large fruit. 1000 scoville (70 days)

peppers.name: ANCHO ROJO
peppers.description: This pepper grows to around 5 inches long by 3 inches wide. It is a darker green with thicker walls than other Ancho varieties.

peppers.name: ANCHO SAN LUIS
peppers.description: This heart shaped pepper is what Mexicans use to make mole and chile rellanos, an intergral part of Mexican Cusine .The peppers are known as 'Ancho' when dried and 'Poblano' when fresh.This medium sized plant produces 5 to 7 inches long by 2.5 to 3 inches wide mildly pungent peppers which mature from dark green to mahoghany red. Excellent in Salsas or for roasting

peppers.name: ANCHO SAN MARTIN
peppers.description: Introduced by John Bill 1999. The large size, early maturity, and great production of this variety is what make this ancho pepper distinctive.  These thick-fleshed peppers mature to 5-1/2 inches long and 3-1/2 inches wide, making them perfect for stuffing into chiles rellenos, as well as useful for roasting or drying.  75 days.

peppers.name: ANCHO SUPER HYBRID
peppers.description: mild; 5 to 7 inches long by 2.5 to 3.5 inches wide; Ancho/Poblano Type; matures from green to red; called "poblano" when fresh, "ancho" when dried; good flavor;

peppers.name: ANCHO SWEET HYBRID
peppers.description: The pendant shaped peppers of this F1 hybridised variety grow to approximately 5 inches long by 1.25 to 1.75 inches wide. They mature from green to bright red

peppers.name: ANCHO VILLA HYBRID
peppers.description: This hybridised variety produces larger fruits, higher yields and are less pointed  than other Ancho varieties. The 5 to 7in long by 3in wide fruits grow on a tall plant and mature from green to red (80 days). They are only mildly pungent measuring approximately 1000 scoville heat units. They are called 'Poblano' when fresh and 'Ancho' when dried.

peppers.name: ANDREA (BELL)
peppers.description: 3 to 4 inches long by 2 to 3 inches wide; Blocky Type; matures from greenish yellow to orange to red; pendant pods; from E. Europe; Uses: Hungarian Cuisine

peppers.name: ANDY F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: A slender, smooth cayenne type pepper from Johnny's seeds. A medium sized plant bears uniform 3/4" x 7-8" fruit which mature to  green in 60 days and red in 85 days.

peppers.name: ANGKOR SUNRISE
peppers.description:
A variety named by Richard Sterling from seed collected in Cambodia.
The very productive and rather tall bushy variety is a  tabasco relative. The peppers  are approximately 2in long by 0.5in wide and grow erect on the plant.  They ripen from a beautiful yellow to an astonishing red colour. The pods make a delicious chile powder when dried but also have a wonderful fruity taste when eaten fresh.

peppers.name: ANTILLAIS CARIBBEAN
peppers.description: A rare Habanero type pepper thought to originate from the Yucatan peninsular, Mexico. Each plant produces arounf 20 very hot wrinkled fruits approx 6cm long and 4cm diameter (larger than a Scotch Bonnet) mature from lime green through to orange and then to bright red. Very aromatic and a chileheads culinary delight. If you like your food on fire, then this is the one for you!  200,000 SHU

peppers.name: ANTOHI ROMANIAN
peppers.description: This Romanian heirloom is a very tasty East European frying pepper. It is named after Jan Antohi, a touring acrobat who had defected to the US before returned to his native Romania in 1991 with the seeds of this delicious heirloom pepper. The plant is a heavy producer of smooth, 4" long by 2" wide tapered, pointed fruit that mature from pale yellow (53 days) to red (78 days).  Very tasty, very productive and very healthy.

peppers.name: ANTONIO
peppers.description: A bell pepper variety. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: APACHE F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: An attractive dwarf plant that produces excellent yields of small 1-2 inch medium/hot bullet shaped fruits. Indeed one plant can produce well over 100 pods in the right growing conditions, fruiting all summer long. One of the most common varieties available from UK garden centres.

peppers.name: APPLE HEART PIMENTO
peppers.description: see also Almapaprika. Sweet Pepper 3 to 4 inches long by 1.5 to 2 inches wide; Heart-Shaped Type; matures from green to deep red; pendant pods; Uses: Pimento, Compact;

peppers.name: AQUILLE
peppers.description: Believed to be a South African local name. Looks very similar to the Tabasco pepper and has the same heat range. The only difference is that this variety has a much higher yield. The colour, once ripe, is a deep red, as opposed to the slightly orange/red of the Tabasco.

peppers.name: ARDEI GRAS
peppers.description: Fruit ripens yellow to red. Small plant

peppers.name: ARIANE F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: A hybridised F1 bell pepper variety. This is a Dutch variety that yields large harvests ofvery attractive orange fruit. The pods are approximately 3.5 to 4 inches long by 3 to 3.5 inches wide and mature from green to a deep orange around 70 days after transplanting. The plants are resistant to tobacco mosaic virus and have plenty of foliage to protect developing fruit.

peppers.name: ARIBIBI (ARIVIVI) GUSANO
peppers.description: Also known as the 'Caterpillar Pepper' due to the distinctive shape of the peppers. This very unusual variety delivers good yields (up to 30 peppers per plant) of 1 ½" long by ¼" wide hot peppers which have a strong citrus taste. The mature from light green to yellow cream approximately 90 days after seedlings have emerged. Definately one to impress friends and a must in any chileheads collection. ## HIGHLY RECOMMENDED ##

peppers.name: SOCRATES
peppers.description: 72 days Nice blocky, thick walled, square fruit with BLS 1,2 and 3 tolerances.

peppers.name: ARISTOTLE
peppers.description: Multi disease tolerant jumbo dark green to red. Large 4½ x 4½ in./11x11 cm uniform fruit are tolerant to BLS 1,2,3; PVY; TMV; and some tolerance to phytophthora. Fruit are anthrocyaninless. X3R (Uniform ripening).

peppers.name: ARIZONA RED
peppers.description: Pods ripen from black to red

peppers.name: ARLEDGE HOT
peppers.description: A sweetl Pepper introduced by John Bill in 2000. The 2 to 3 inches upright pods mature from green to orange and then to red approximately 80 days after transplanting. A nice pickling variety

peppers.name: ASIAN BEST
peppers.description: These  6in red tapered, pendulous fruits grow on 2ft tall bushy plants.

peppers.name: ASSAM
peppers.description: These thin walled cayenne type pods are 1.5 to 2 inches long by 0.375 to 0.5 inches wide and  mature from green to red. Used in  Indian Cuisine

peppers.name: ASTI GIALLI
peppers.description: This dwarf bushy plant produces 4cm long yellow pods which have medium heat. Plant has very dark green leaves.

peppers.name: ATARODO (C05599)
peppers.description:
This 1 1/2ft tall x 2 1/2ft wide sprawling plant produces 1 1/2 in by 1in wrinkled red fruits which have a strong smokey, tropical fruit aroma but no heat.
Also known as CO5599. 

Note:The CO classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at the Asian Vegetable Research and Development Center, Taiwan

peppers.name: ATOMIC HEART
peppers.description:
If you like chiles that are very large, crisp, meaty and crunchy,
then this is the one for you. The pods have a distinct heart shape
with smooth glossy red skin at maturity, without an overpowering
heat. The mature from green to orange and finally to red. An Ideal variety for making fresh salsas.

peppers.name: ATOMIC TOP END
peppers.description:
This variety comes from Darwin in Austrailia and was developed by Atomic Chillis seeds.  This plant can produce u pto 60 small erect growing fiery pods
per plant, each with a crisp clean taste. They mature fromm a very pale
yellowy green to an orangy red.

peppers.name: AURORA
peppers.description: A colourful ornamental dwarf type with striking purple and green foilage. These small 10-12" plants make an excellent container plant and produce a profussion of 1 1/2in upright fruits which ripen at different times so the little bushes are covered with all different colors from yellow to orange to red to pepper. The peppers can be eaten although not recommended.

peppers.name: AUSTRALIAN LANTERN
peppers.description: This 1 1/2ft x 1 1/2 ft plant is a very nice miniature habanero variety. It produces high yields of 1in long by 0.625in wide diamond shaped fruits which mature from green to orange.

peppers.name: AUTOPICK
peppers.description: This labour saving salsa pepper from Territorial seeds is the result of over 10 years of breeding effort that combines a rich, hot flavor with the ability to leave the stem on the plant when harvested. The 2 1/2 foot tall plant produce dozens of 3 to 4 inch conical shaped peppers that mature red. Ideal for fiery salsas and great on the grill.

peppers.name: AVALON BUTTON
peppers.description: Sweet Pepper introduced by R.D Pearce 1945

peppers.name: AZR
peppers.description: These chiles grow to 3 inches long by 0.5 to 0.75 inches wide and  mature from green to red.  The pendant thin-skinned pods are similar to the standad cayenne pepper and are used in Indian cooking.

peppers.name: BABURA ZELENA
peppers.description: These tall bushy plants produce many small green horn shaped peppers, a little shorter and fatter than the 'Carliston'. A very nice early sweet variety and nice sweet roasted or fried.

peppers.name: BABY BELLE (BELL)
peppers.description: These tasty tiny (2" by 2-1/2) sweet bells will certainly be the hit of any salad bar and are just the extra touch for that special gourmet dish. Easily grown in 5 gallon containers. These mostly 4-lobed, emerald green beauties waste no time in turning bright red at full maturity. Resistant to Tobacco Mosaic Virus. 68 days.

peppers.name: BAHAMIAN
peppers.description: Also known locally as the 'Finger Pepper', this plant has small thin leaves. The pods grow in upright clusters on the plant and are approximately 1.5 to 2.5 inches long by 0.25 to 0.5 inches wide.They mature from green to red and are very pungent measuring between 85,000 to 100,000 scoville heat units

peppers.name: PEANUT
peppers.description: This variety produces heavy sets of 2x3/4" red fruits with slight swelling at tip; fruits initially erect but are horizontal at maturity; plant 3' tall x 3½' wide; fruit somewhat resembles peanut shells (hence the name).

peppers.name: BAKO LOCAL (C05594)
peppers.description: Pendant 5in x 1in tapered, smooth red fruits grow on a 2ft tall x 1 1/2ft wide plant. Also known as CO5594. Note:The CO classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at the Asian Vegetable Research and Development Center, Taiwan

peppers.name: BALADA
peppers.description: 4 -6" medium length tapered pods frow on a 2 to 3ft plant. The pods mature from green to red and are very pungent....produce abundantly.

peppers.name: ABBRACCIO
peppers.description: The Italian translatation 'I embrace' sums up the beauty of this  this stunning ornamental variety. This 1ft tall  plant produces hundreds of ¾" long by ½" wide upright growing edible peppers. The peppers are shaped like small bullets and mature through various shades of purple to yellows, oranges and finally to bright red when ripe. The full rainbow of colours are present at the same time.

peppers.name: BALL CHILLI
peppers.description: Very mild round chilli-pepper. Fleshy fruit. Maturing to red when ripe.

peppers.name: BALLOON (PI 497974)
peppers.description: This variety has many names: Balloon, Pimenta Cambuci, Campane, Peri Peri, Ubatuba Cambuci, Nepalese bell, Aji Flor, Orchid and Bishops Hat to name a few!! This very unusual pod shaped variety is believed to have been  transfered from South America to Europe by the Portuguese in the 18th century and is actually part of the species Capsicum baccatum var. pendulum.  The plants are quite large growing 3 to 4 ft tall and produce 30 to 50 extremely weird 3 or 4 flat winged, wrinkled almost flying saucer like 1 ½" wide pods. The flesh of each pod is thin athough crisp to taste and they mature from green to red approximately 90-100 days after seedlings have emerged. The body of the pods have some detectable heat, but the wings are sweet and mild.

peppers.name: BANANA
peppers.description: Banana is a milder version of its genetic brother the Hungarian Hot Wax. This medium sized plant produces excellent yields of 6 to 8 inches long by 1 to 1.25 inches wide banana shaped fruits (hence the name) which mature from greenish yellow to red.  This is a very easy to grow & a flavoursome variety and a good choice for new chile growers.

peppers.name: BANANA SUPREME
peppers.description: A wax type. This hybridised F1 plant produces good yields of 8 in long by 1.5 to 2 in wide pendant shaped pods which  matures from greenish yellow to red approximately 65-70 days after transplanting. Very similar to 'Hungarian Hot Wax'

peppers.name: BANANA SWEET
peppers.description: An early wax type pepper.  Larger than the standard type, this plant produces good yileds of 8 in long by 2 in wide, tapered fruits which mature from greenish yellow to red approximately 65 days after transplanting. These vigorous plants are medium to large, upright and spreading. The  waxy yellow fruits have a sweet but mild flavour.

peppers.name: BANANARAMA HYBRID
peppers.description: This hybridised wax type pepper avriety produces 6 to 8 in long by 1 to 1.5 in wide pendant shaped pods which  mature from pale yellow to orange and finally to red.

peppers.name: BANGALORE TORPEDO
peppers.description: A Cayenne Type. Plant produces good yields of 5 ¼" long by ¼" wide long peppers which mature from lime green to deep crimson in approximately 90 days

peppers.name: BANOS
peppers.description: This is a compact ornamental  plant loaded with upright 2in fruits which mature from green to yellow and then to red. From Banos, Ecuador, hence the name.

peppers.name: BANTAM
peppers.description: Dwarf cultivar. Plant growth habit is dwarf, the stem length before branching is around 50 mm, the leaves are medium to long and the length/width ratio is 2.8, the flowering is fasciculate type. The flower colour is white and they start to appear continually after 5-6 weeks. The fruit is erect and the size is smallish at 4 cm long and length/diameter ratio is 1.8 and mature after 8-9 weeks. The flesh is thick. The heat value is around 30,000 SHU.

peppers.name: BARBADOS
peppers.description: This plant is a moderate producer of very hot 1.5in x 1in wrinkled fruits with a smokey flavour.

peppers.name: BARNEY
peppers.description: A 5 to 6 in long by 1 to 1.5 in wide Anaheim type pepepper which  matures from green to red.

peppers.name: BARTLETTS BONNET
peppers.description: One for the collector. A 'friar's hat' shaped chilli, somewhat similar to Balloon in looks, but much hotter in taste. Again, moderately late, and needs to be grown under cover.

peppers.name: PIMENTA DE NEYDE
peppers.description:
This variety is apparently a chinense-annuum cross with purple pods!
In Brazil it is called Neyde (after the women who discovered it).Even though the fruits don't resemble chinenses very much, the taste is said to be very chinense-like and the pods are supposed to be very hot. Flowers are white with purple stains and the pods (which measure 2cm to 5cm) remain purple even at maturty. The variety is definately one for the avid pepper collector.

peppers.name: BEAVER DAM
peppers.description: This Hungarian heirloom pepper was brought to Beaver Dam, Wisconsin USA by the Joe Hussli family in 1929. These 5in x 2.5in tapered peppers initially grow erect on the plant before gravity takes in course. they are crunchy in texture and mildly hot to taste, with excellent flavor. The peppers start bright green before maturing to deep red in approx 80 days. They are great when paired with tomatillos in a salsa.

peppers.name: BEDGI (BYADAGI)
peppers.description: From the area west of India's Goa, the Bedgi or Byadagi is wrinkly and red and is often chocolate brown when dried. It is 5-7.5 cm long and 8 mm wide. It is quite aromatic

peppers.name: BEIJING
peppers.description: Plant grows to 10"-18" tall, many flowers and fruit, red when ripe, very productive. 120 days from transplant

peppers.name: BEISWINGERS PEPPER
peppers.description: A bell pepper variety named after Dorothy Beiswenger. These 3in x 4in blocky peppers ripen from a jade green to red. The plants grow approximately 18 in high by 18in wide.

peppers.name: BELECSKAI
peppers.description: A Hungarian sweet pepper. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: BELL CAPTAIN
peppers.description: This excellent variety is reputed to be one of the market leaders for its size, taste, and yield. Plenty of large, 4-lobed, slightly elongated peppers ideal for stuffing or salads. Red at maturity. Large, vigorous plants are disease resistant and hold up well under stress. Superb performer in almost every climate.  72 days.

peppers.name: BELL TOWER HYBRID
peppers.description: Sweet bell hybrid.High yielding, widely adapted hybrid that will perform well under cool conditions.

peppers.name: BELLINGRATH GARDENS
peppers.description: Named in honor of Mobile, Alabama's famous garden. This strikingly beautiful, ornamental pepper plant has purple-green stems and leaves with a satin sheen. Young foliage and growing tips are variegated with colours of green, purple, and creamy-white. Leaves are small (1" to 2-1/2" long), and the undersides are green with purple venation. Plants are sturdy, hardy, and well branched, and may reach a height of 5 feet when well grown. Flowers are purple with greenish-purple stamens. The pendant fruits ripen from greenish-purple to purple-orange to red, and provide a colorful accent to the purple foliage. Fruits are small (3/8" x 7/8"), abundant, hot, and because they separate readily from the plant they are easy to harvest. Compared to 'Royal Black', 'Bellingrath Gardens Purple' is more variegated. Recommended enthusiastically for ornamental gardens. 85 days.

peppers.name: BENDIGO F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: Sweet bell hybrid. An early Enza pepper for the red pick market or processing 66 days

peppers.name: BENI HIGHLANDS
peppers.description: 1.5 to 2 inches long by 0.5 inches wide; matures from green to lemon yellow; tapered pendant pods.

peppers.name: BENNINGTON
peppers.description: Bell Pepper introduced by Mike Sheets 2000

peppers.name: BERBERE
peppers.description: Pronounced 'bear-beret', this rare Ethiopian variety produces lots of 6in long by 0.75in wide pendant shaped pods over a long period. The pods have a slight swelling in the middle and mature from green to a deep red approximately 85 days after transplanting. These chiles have a rich smokey flavour and aroma, and make excellent chile powder when dried and ground.

peppers.name: BESLERS CHERRY
peppers.description: A very beautiful plant loaded with 1/2 in x 1/2 in round peppers. Iillustrated by Basilius Besler in 1613 (hence the name), the very small round fruits have a good level of heat.

peppers.name: BGH 1036 (PI 441539)
peppers.description:
Fruits 2 x 6cm, red. Further information is not available at this time.

Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: BGH 1038 (PI 441541)
peppers.description:
An ornamental variety. Description currently unavailable.

Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: BGH 1612 (PI 441547)
peppers.description:
This variety ylelds small 3cm x 0.5cm pungent fruits which mature to red. No further information is available at this time. 

Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: BGH 1668 (PI 441553)
peppers.description:
Description currently unavailable.

Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: PIMENTA MALAGUETA (PI 441555)
peppers.description:
Also known as BGH 1674. Further information is not available at this time.

Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: BGH 1675 (PI 441556)
peppers.description:
This variety produces round, slightly flattened, 1.5cm x 2cm fruits which mature from green to red.

Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: CHIFRE DE CAPETA (PI 441581)
peppers.description:
Also know as BGH 4172. This variety is more accurately partof the species Capsicum baccatum var. pendulum. further information is not available at this time.

Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: BGH 4176 (PI 441584)
peppers.description:
Also know as BGH 41726 This variety is more accurately part of the species Capsicum baccatum var. pendulum. Further information is not available at this time.

Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: CHIFRE DE CABRITO (PI 441589)
peppers.description:
The literal translation is Goat Horn, an allusin to the pod shape. Also known as BGH 4215. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: BGH 4319 (PI 441594)
peppers.description:
Description currently unavailable.

Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: BGH 66 (PI 441516)
peppers.description:
This large bushy plant (1m tall and wide) bears 2cm x5cm dark green fruits which mature to  red. The local name pimenta sete molhos.

Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: BGH 81(PI 441519)
peppers.description:
The fruits of this variety are round, flattened, grooved between locules, mature to red and have a  strong flavour.

Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: BGH 824 (PI 441532)
peppers.description: This variety produces blocky 5cm x 5cm fruits which mature to red. Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: BGH 1630 (PI 441549)
peppers.description:
This variety produce long (10cm x 1.5cm) fruits which mature to red.

Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: BGH 1673 (PI 441554)
peppers.description:
Description currently unavailable.

Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: BIANCA
peppers.description: A hybridised F1 bell pepper variety. These 3 to 4 lobes ivory coloured bell peppers  retain their characteristic creamy white colour for an extended period before ripening to peach then orange, and finally to light red (70 days). The plants are vigorous with good disease resistance (particularly to TMV) and provide excellent cover as well as attractive fruits.

peppers.name: BI-BELL
peppers.description: Matures to orange-red. Cold resistant.  This tall growing bushy plant often up to 2m tall x 1m wide is a continuous, heavy bearer of bell/ joker's hat shaped pod which mature from orange to red. The outer flesh of the pod has no heat, however the pod is full of a hot placenta. Very similar to (if not the same as Balloon)

peppers.name: BIDO TACANA (PI 543181)
peppers.description: From Carmen Florida, small village on right bank of Rio Beni, 5km upriver from Rurrenabaque, Beni Department, Ballvian Province in Brazil. Local name in Tacana dialect. Shrub to 1.5m tall. Fruits green, then red, 5cm long, somewhat ribbed, irregularly shaped, acuminate near stigma scar. Seeds white.

peppers.name: BIG BERTHA
peppers.description: A hybridised F1 bell pepper variety. This 2 1/2ft Plant produces what is believed to be the largest elongated bell pepper available. The thick walled 3 or 4 lobed peppers can mesaure upto 8" long by 4" wide and  mature from deep green to red in approximately 70 days. TMV resistant.

peppers.name: BIG CHILE F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: A hybridised Anaheim-type chile which is more productive and has 40% larger fruit than other Anaheim varieties. This plant produces a huge crop of 8 to 10-inch long, 4 ounce fleshy peppers over a lengthy harvest period. This is the classic "California green chile" used for roasting, peeling, and including into cooked dishes. Very mild pungency. 68 days.

peppers.name: BIG DIPPER
peppers.description: A bell traditional pepper variety from Burpee seeds. Pods mature from green to red. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: BIG RED
peppers.description: A hybrdised bell pepper variety. These blocky 3-4 lobed bell pepper mature from green to red approximately 75 days after transplanting.

peppers.name: BIG STAR
peppers.description: A bell pepper variety. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: BILLY GOAT
peppers.description: This large 3ft x 3ft plant produces high yields of 2in x 3/4in oval shaped wrinkled pods which have the characteristic smokey tropical fruit aroma of other Chinense varieties. The plant has very unusual purple-blue stems.

peppers.name: BIRD AJI (PI 238061)
peppers.description: This wild variety has a sprawling habit and is very prolific. The pods are very small (0.5in x 0.3in) round and very pungent. Note that the small round pods of the wild species are often refered to as  'bird peppers. The pods are very attractive to  bird species, the  mechanismthrough  which the wild varieties were spread all over South & Central America. More accurately this varieity is part of the species Capsicum baccatum var. baccatum.

peppers.name: BIRDS EYE
peppers.description: This variety is more accurately part of the Capsicum annuum var. glabriusculum species. These peppers are found all over Africa where there are also called congo, Mombassa, Pequin, Uganda or Zanzibar chiles  Hot Chilli Pepper Birdseye  Some state this pepper is even hotter than Habanero and the plant produces small thin walled fruits approximately 2cm in length by 0.5cm wide that ripen from green to red. The seeds are difficult to germinate as it is considered a wild variety. Very pungent registering between 100,000-175,000 scoville units.

peppers.name: BIRGITS LOCOTO
peppers.description: This medium sized 30in x 18in plant yields many 2.5in x 0.5in elliptical fruits with some wrinkles, They mature from light yellow to honey to orange and finally to red. A very attractive variety.

peppers.name: BISCAYNE
peppers.description: A Cubanelle type F1 hybridised variety . These plants are medium to large, well branched, and prolific producers of 2 lobed light yellow-green peppers which reach maturity approximately 65-70 days after transplanting. The peppers are 6-1/2 inches long and 2-1/2 inches wide with a blunt end and are lovely when fried in Olive Oil..

peppers.name: BISHOPS HAT (PI 497974)
peppers.description: This variety has many names: Balloon, Pimenta Cambuci, Campane, Peri Peri, Ubatuba Cambuci, Aji Flor, Orchid, Christmas Bell and Bishops Crown to name a few!! This very unusual pod shaped variety is believed to have been  transfered from South America to Europe by the Portuguese in the 18th century and is actually part of the species Capsicum baccatum var. pendulum.  The plants are quite large growing 3 to 4 ft tall and produce 30 to 50 extremely weird 3 or 4 flat winged, wrinkled almost flying saucer like 1 ½" wide pods. The flesh of each pod is thin athough crisp to taste and they mature from green to red approximately 90-100 days after seedlings have emerged. The body of the pods have some detectable heat, but the wings are sweet and mild.

peppers.name: BLACK BEAUTY
peppers.description: A compact bush with dark green foliage. The chilli-peppers are bottle green maturing to black and bright red when ripe.

peppers.name: BLACK CLUSTER (PI 267730)
peppers.description: A plant with deep purple leaves and round, purple, upright pods which turn bright red when mature.

peppers.name: BLACK CUBAN
peppers.description:
This highly ornamental Chiltepin plant has a tall upright growth habit with
predominantly dark purple leaves, branches, trunk and brilliant purple flowers. The pods grow erect on long stalks starting off glossy black before maturing to bright red.. Like other tepin types, the pods are highly pungent. Very similar - if not the same as Black Cluster.

peppers.name: BLACK DALLAS
peppers.description: long, w/ long stems. 3' tall, sprawling plant. 80 days.

peppers.name: BLACK HUNGARIAN
peppers.description: A rare & colourful hungarian heirloom.  These tall sturdy plants (30in) have green foliage with purple veins and produce beautiful purple flowers. The pods are  about the same size as a Jalapeno and ripen from black to red in approximately 70-70 days. The pods are mildly hot and have a delicious flavour.

peppers.name: CGN 16895
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note: The CGN classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Wageningen, The Netherlands

peppers.name: BLACK NAMAQULAND
peppers.description: This 2ft tall purple ornamental variety has beautiful dark purple stems and purple tinted leaves. The pods ripen from purple to red. Very similar to 'Purple Prince'.

peppers.name: BLACK PLUM
peppers.description: These pods grow 1 1/2 inch long by 3/4 inch wide, are thin walled and grow erect on the plant. Matures from green to black and then to red.

peppers.name: BLACK PRINCE
peppers.description: These small oval shaped pods (0.75in) mature from black to red. Very similar to Purple Prince those pods are more rounded. Also called Black Pearl.

peppers.name: BLACK SCORPION TONGUE
peppers.description: This large plant can grow up to 4ft tall and is a prolific producer of 'tongue' shaped pods which mature from  purple, through to llight cream and finally to a red / orange colour.

peppers.name: BLUSHING BEAUTY
peppers.description: A hybridised F1 bell pepper variety. This attractive variety is never green, first it appears as ivory, then blushes to light red and orange-red, and finally to deep scarlet (approx 72days) with fruit in several colour stages at one time on the plant. The thick walled, heavyweight peppers are large, about 4 inches long and wide, and 4-lobed with a fine  sweet flavor. The plants are relatively compactand have good disease resistance particularly TMV and bacterial leaf spot.

peppers.name: BODE (BODI)
peppers.description: Originally from Recife in the Pernambuco area of Brazil, but now found throughout north and northeast Brazil. This very attractive white flowering 2ft tall bushy plant produces good yields of very small 'Tepin like' round chiles witha slight dimple on one side. They are approximately ½ inch round and mature from light green, to yellow, to orange and then to red around 90 days after transplanting. Despite there searing heat, these chiles have a wonderful smokey fruity flavour. Fantastic for bringing a bland curry to life! . Both yellow and red versions of this varieties are available.

peppers.name: BOLA (CAP1655)
peppers.description: Meaning ball or Marble. See also Casabel.

peppers.name: BOLDOG HUNGARIAN  SPICE
peppers.description: Also know as Hungarian Paprika. These compact early maturing plants produce  5 1/2" x 1 1/2" smooth fruits mature from green (55 days) to an intense crimson colour (80 days). An ideal chile for grinding your own spicy paprika. Lower yielding than Paprika Supreme, but deeper color and richer taste.

peppers.name: AJI BOLIVIAN LONG (PI 260566)
peppers.description: This proflic variety produces a multitude of 4in long by 0.5in wide thin walled fruits which mature from green to yellowish orange and finally to red

peppers.name: BOLIVIAN RAINBOW
peppers.description: Grown for centuries in Bolivia, this stunning ornamental 2-3ft purple flowering plant produces hundreds of ¾" long by ½" wide upright growing edible peppers. The peppers are shaped like small bullets and  mature through various shades of purple to yellows, oranges and finally to bright red when ripe. The full rainbow of colours are present at the same time. Although the fruits are highly ornamental, they are also very pungent so care should be taken when fruits are handled. Probably one of the best choices for those seeking to brighting up the patio or garden. ## HIGHLY RECOMMENDED ##

peppers.name: BOLIVIAN SMALL RED
peppers.description: This wild species is extremely productive produsing hundres of a small 3/4in long x 1/4in wide peppers. The pods when dried, make an extremely good chile powder. For those of you who like a good tasting pepper but don't want it to blow your head off, this variety is a good choice.

peppers.name: BONITA
peppers.description: A sweet bell pepper hybrid.  Large dark green leaves provide protective cover for the fruit, keeping the percentage of usable fruit high even under pressure from the sun. The plant grows strong and can be used for either ground or stake production. Pods mature from green to a deep red and are large and slightly elongatedl with thick walls.

peppers.name: BONNEY
peppers.description: The number one pepper of choice in Barbados. It is the base of the unique mustard-based hot sauces of the country. It is thought to be an eastern Caribbean version of the Scotch bonnet but you rarely see a yellow fruit-- they mature to red. Very hot.

peppers.name: CAP 499
peppers.description: This wild variety produces small elongated Pod size about 5mm x 12mm pods which mature from green to red. Plants are quite delicate and low growing.

peppers.name: BOUNTY
peppers.description: This hybridised  version of the ' Sweet Banana'  lives up to its name in that it puts out an incredible harvest of huge banana peppers that measure nearly a foot long. Peppers are typically 9 to 10 inches long and 2 inches across, and turn from light yellow to orange and finally red approximately 65 days after transplanting. A nice sweet flavor when eaten fresh or cooked.

peppers.name: BOUQUET
peppers.description: A purple flowering ornamental variety. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: BRADLEYS BAHAMIAN
peppers.description: This plant was found growing outside a small cave on the Island of Eleuthera in the Bahamas (hence is other name 'Eleuthera Pepper') and is named in honor of Bill Bradley, the man who discovered it. This plant grows as a bush about 2 feet tall by 3.5 feet wide. The pods range from 1 to 2 inches long and about 1/4 to 3/8 of an inch in diameter and mature to orange or, in a longer season, to red. The pepper is wrinkled with pleats by the sepals.

peppers.name: AJI PEQUANTE (PI 355395)
peppers.description: Typical small "bud" pepper of Ecuador coast. Bush to 80cm with small green flowers, purplish stamens; fruits red.

peppers.name: BRAZILIAN RAINBOW (PI 441641)
peppers.description: This stunning ornamental white flowering plant is very similar to the Bolivian Rainbow, although the plant is a little more compact and the  peppers are smaller and slightly more elongated. These very impressive plant produces hundreds of 1in long by ½ in wide pods which grow erect on the plant. The mature through various shades of purple to yellows, oranges and finally to bright red when ripe. The full rainbow of colours are present at the same time. Although the fruits are highly ornamental, they are also very pungent so care should be taken when fruits are handled. An excellent choice for those seeking to brighting up the patio or garden. ## HIGHLY RECOMMENDED ##

peppers.name: AJI BRAZILIAN STARFISH (PI 439368)
peppers.description: A much sort after and very unusual variety due to its uniquely shaped peppers. This tall plant has a vine like habit and  produces good yields of ¾" long by 1 ¾" wide starfish shaped peppers that are very pungent. The peppers mature from green to red approximately 90 days after transplanting.  The white flowers of this plant are also very attractive with the distinctive Baccatum greenish-yellow markings. ## HIGHLY RECOMMENDED ##

peppers.name: BRIGADIER
peppers.description: A hybridised F1 bell pepper variety. This sturdy upright plant produces high yields of very large, 4 lobed, blocky green peppers that become bright red when fully ripe approximately 72 days after transplanting. The fruits are deeper in colour than 'Sentry' but not as deep as 'Commandant'. This variety also performs well even under stressful growing conditions and peppers stay large without flattening once the weather turns cooler. Resistant to 3 races of bacterial leaf spot and to potato virus.

peppers.name: BROOME CHILE
peppers.description: A rare variety from the northern coast of Western Australia. This bushy plant produces good yields of 2.75 inch long by 1.5 inch wide, almost square shaped pods that mature from green to red, but do so in splotches.

peppers.name: BUDDA HOT
peppers.description: 4.5" long, dark green to red pendant fruits. 60 days.

peppers.name: BUENA MULATA
peppers.description: This 2ft tall by 1ft wide plant bears good yields of 2.5in long x 0.75in wind pendant shaped tapered fruits which  mature from deep eggplant purple to pastel orange and finally to red. This attractive plant has deep purple stems and bears purple-white striped flowers.

peppers.name: BUENOS CARBIDE
peppers.description: Produces pendant fruits that start out light yellow and mature to orange. See Fresno.

peppers.name: BULAMPUT F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: A hybridised cayenne type pepper from Korea introduced in the early 1980s

peppers.name: BULGARIAN CARROT (SHIPKAS)
peppers.description: Also known as 'Shipkas'  this charming heirloom was supposedly smuggled out through the iron curtain 20 years ago. This attractive white flowering 2ft plant produces good yields of 3 to 3.5 inches long by 0.625 to 0.75 inches wide  glossing orange coloured peppers resembling carrots. The peppers are hot and mature from green to yellow and then to orange approximately 65-70 days after transplanting. The peppers are crunchy and are used to make pickles, salsa, jellies and marinades.

peppers.name: BULGARIAN SWEETIE
peppers.description: An extra large sweet banana type. Matures from yellow to red in 65 days

peppers.name: BULL NOSE RED (BELL)
peppers.description: A prolific variety from India that dates back to 1759. This bell pepper is both hot and sweet - the ribs are very pungent, but the thick flesh is mild and sweet.  A very rare and unusual variety. Fruits ripen from Green to Scarlet in approx 60 days

peppers.name: BURAN
peppers.description: This Polish heirloom variety is one of the sweetest you can grow. The plants grow upto 18-24 inch tall and produce lots of 3 lobed peppers that are about 4 inches long by about 3 inches at the shoulder. They peppers mature from green fo red in approx 95 days.

peppers.name: BURNING BUSH
peppers.description: long pencil thin peppers which cover this very productive bush.

peppers.name: BUTAN COMMERCIAL 4
peppers.description: This 1ft tall by 1ft wide plant bears 3-3.5in heavily scalloped, flattened red fruits. More of a tomato type pepper than a bell pepper.

peppers.name: BUTAN COMMERCIAL 8
peppers.description: This plant bears 7-8in long, cayenne type curved fruits. A extremely productive  variety with a great sweet flavour.

peppers.name: CAPSICUM CARDENASII
peppers.description: A wild purple flowering species from Bolivia is thought to be the original progenitor of all Capsicums. Its common name in Ulupica.  The pods are very small (1/2in x 1/8in) and egg shaped and ripen from green to red. Like the Rocoto, Capsicum Cardenasii has purple flowers.

peppers.name: CAPSICUM CHACOENSE
peppers.description: A small white flowering wild species native to Argentina, Bolivia and Paraguay. It is known locally as 'Tova' or 'Covincho' in Paraguay. The Plant has an erect growing habit and is approximately 80 cm tall. The erect pods are elongated, triangular, 2.5 cm long, 0.5 cm wide and mature from green to red. Very scarce

peppers.name: CAPSICUM CILIATUM (GRIF 16136)
peppers.description: A very unusual and scarce wild Capsicum species initially believed to be a sister to Capsicum Tovarii  although after further study by Eshbaugh in 1988, it has since been omitted from Capsicum species list. Native to Southern Mexico & South America, this species  has pubescent stems and leaves and yellow flowers. The tiny red fruits have no heat. Now a synonym for Witheringia ciliata although more recently it has been reclassified (yet again) as Capsicum rhomboideum.

peppers.name: CAPSICUM EXILE
peppers.description: A white flowering wild species not commercially grown, although several Chile enthusiasts have successfully grown the cultivar 'Cobincho'. This plant is very unlike most other capsicums. Plants can grow to over 130 cm tall with small, smooth leaves. Note the yellow anthers on the flowers.

peppers.name: CAPSICUM EXIMIUM
peppers.description:
This is one of the purple flowered species; the others being Capsicum. Pubescens and Capsicum Cardenasii which are thought to have an, as yet to be discovered common ancestor. It has a somewhat sprawly habit and the small red pods are hot. The species originates in Bolivia where it is known as 
Ulupica de Chaco

peppers.name: CAPSICUM FLEXUOSUM
peppers.description: This wild Capsicum variety has been subject to much debate and has been reclassified as a variety of Capsicum Schottianum byA.T. Hunziker.  The seeds  for this variety are believed to be black unlike C. Baccatum var. Flexuosum which are straw coloured.

peppers.name: CAPSICUM GALAPAGOENSE (GRIF 1567)
peppers.description: This white flowering wild species is one of the worlds rarest chiles. It is found only on the small Galapagos Islands of Isabela and Santa Cruz. The pods of this plant are very hot and grow to 0.25 inches long, maturing from dark green to red.

peppers.name: CAPSICUM PRAETERMISSUM (PI 441654)
peppers.description: A rare wild variety orginating from the jungles of Brazil. This plant can grow up to  six feet tall in a single growing season and has thousands of cranberry sized fruit that ripen to red. The plant produces stunning flowers that are totally flat when fully opened, are purple edged with a white inner band and have a greenish yellow centre.  Also known as Capsicum baccatum var. praetermissum and has been designated as a separate Capsicum species since 1983.

peppers.name: CAPSICUM TOVARII
peppers.description: This very rare white flowering Capsicum species is native to the Rio Mantaro basin in south-central Peru. Genetically it is part of taxa including Capsicum pubescens and is known as ' Mukuru'  in Peru. Note the multiple flowers per node.

peppers.name: CAPSICUM BUFORUM
peppers.description: A wild Capsicum species native to Brazil.

peppers.name: CAPSICUM CAMPYLOPODIUM
peppers.description: A wild Capsicum species originating from Brazil

peppers.name: CAPSICUM COCCINEUM
peppers.description: A white flowering wild Capsicum species native to Bolivia and Peru.

peppers.name: CAPSICUM CORNUTUM
peppers.description: A wild Capsicum species native to Southern Brazil.

peppers.name: CAPSICUM DIMORPHUM
peppers.description: A wild Capsicum species originating from Colombia & Ecuador

peppers.name: CAPSICUM DUSENII
peppers.description: A wild Capsicum species native to south-east Brazil.

peppers.name: CAPCISUM GEMINIFOLIUM
peppers.description: A wild Capsicum species originating from Colombia and Ecuador

peppers.name: CAPSICUM HOOKERIANUM
peppers.description: A wild Capsicum species originating from Ecuador

peppers.name: CAPSICUM LANCEOLATUM
peppers.description: A wild Capsicum species originating from Guatemala, Honduras and Mexico

peppers.name: CAPSICUM LEPTOPODUM
peppers.description: A wild Capsicum species originating from Brazil.

peppers.name: CAPSICUM MINUTIFLORUM
peppers.description: A wild Capsicum species originating from Argentina, Bolivia and Paraguay.

peppers.name: CAPSICUM MIRABILE
peppers.description: A wild Capsicum species originating from Southern Brazil

peppers.name: CAPSICUM PARVIFOLIUM
peppers.description:
A wild capsicum species native to north-east Brazil, Bolivia and Venezuela.
In Bolivia it is commonly known as ' Piment de passarinho' which simply means pepper of passarinho
