peppers.name: CAPSICUM SCHOATTIANUM
peppers.description: A wild chile species native to Argentina, south Brazil and south-east Paraguay. These 80-100 cm tall erect plants have many branches which grown in a zig zag pattern. The flowers are white with yellow-green spots at the base of the petals. The tiny pods are pendulous and reddish-orange at maturity.

peppers.name: CAPSICUM SCOLNIKIANUM
peppers.description: A wild Capsicum species originating from Peru

peppers.name: CAPSICUM VILLOSUM
peppers.description: A wild Capsicum species native to southern Brazil.

peppers.name: C01304
peppers.description: A wild species from the central region of South America (Bolivia), these very slender and fast growing plants have very small leaves which and shaped like a stretched heart.

peppers.name: CABAI BURONG
peppers.description: This medium sized plant produces very seedy 1.5-2 inch long by 3/8 inch wide pods. The pods dry well but not especially tasty,with a citrus aftertaste. 'Cabai' means pepper.

peppers.name: CASCADURA
peppers.description: Mildly hot 3-4" Ancho-type pepper with good flavour; very productive. Cascadura translates roughly to 'hard skin'

peppers.name: CACHO DE CABRA
peppers.description: Thought to originate from Santiago in Chile where mapuche indians make powder out of them. Apparently in chilean spanish, the name translates as goat's dick!

peppers.name: CADICE (BELL)
peppers.description: Extra early French Hybrid. 4in bell peppers matute to red in only 55 days

peppers.name: CALCUTTA ROUND (GRIF 15340)
peppers.description: An Indian Cherry type pepper. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: CALIFORNIA WONDER
peppers.description: Introduced in 1828, this bell pepper variety is probably the most popular (and oldest) commercial varieties grown in the United States today.  The dark green peppers are mostly 4-lobed and blocky, about 4 1/2 inches long and 4 inches wide, with crisp, thick walls and sweet taste. Fruit eventually ripens to bright red approximately 75 days after transplanting. The peppers are borne on tall plantswhich produce an abundance of peppers over a very long season.

peppers.name: CALIFORNIA WONDER GOLDEN
peppers.description: Similar to California Wonder pepper, except the fruits ripen to a bright yellow-gold colour. These beautifully coloured 4 inch fruits weigh approximately 6 ounces each and grow on plants that are 24 to 30 inches tall.  Wonderful in salads or in stir-fries.

peppers.name: CALIFORNIA WONDER PURPLE
peppers.description: Similar to California Wonder pepper, except the fruits mature to an unusual dark purple color. The plants grow 24 to 30 inches tall, and bear fruits that are thick walled and weigh about 6 ounces each.  For something a little different, grow some this year!  A real eye catcher in salads!

peppers.name: CALORO
peppers.description: This A vigorous plant with continuous fruiting produces medium-sized 2in x4in, thick-walled, conical shaped pods which look like a smaller (and milder) version of the Hot Banana. The pods ripen from yellow to orange and then to red approximately 80 days after transplanting.  Good cooked or in salads.

peppers.name: CAMELOT
peppers.description: This sturdy, upright plants bear lots of extra large, glossy, dark green 3 to 4 lobed bell peppers tthat measure at least 4-1/2 inches long and nearly as wide. Concentrated sets of fruit make for a heavy first pick.  Resistant to tobacco mosaic virus (TMV) 74 days.

peppers.name: CAMPANE (PI 497974)
peppers.description:
This variety has many other names: Balloon, Pimenta Cambuci, Peri Peri, Ubatuba Cambuci, Aji Flor, Orchid and Bishops Hat to name a few!! This very unusual pod shaped variety is believed to have been  transfered from South America to Europe by the Portuguese in the 18th century and is actually part of the species Capsicum baccatum var. pendulum.  The plants are quite large growing 3 to 4 ft tall and produce 30 to 50 extremely weird 3 or 4 flat winged, wrinkled almost flying saucer like 1 ½" wide pods. The flesh of each pod is thin athough crisp to taste and they mature from green to red approximately 90-100 days after seedlings have emerged. The body of the pods have some detectable heat, but the wings are sweet and mild.
Campane means 'bell' in Italian.

peppers.name: CANAPE F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: A sweet/bell hybrid. Enlongated 2 by 2 1/2" fruits mature from dark green to red in 70 days .A big attraction of this variety is that the fruits set even in cool temperatures.

peppers.name: CANARY
peppers.description: Blocky 5 in./13 cm four lobed fruit. Tolerant to both strains of TMV and are VERY productive. Fruit have very thick walls and mature a real bright yellow. Ripens med green/yellow. 72 days.

peppers.name: CANDLELIGHT
peppers.description: A beautiful dwarf ornamental variety with nice pungent pods that grow upright in clusters. Matures from green through yellow to orange and then red. Excellent for growing in pots!

peppers.name: CANTINA YELLOW
peppers.description: Peppers are yellow-orange in colour and pendant shaped, which grow to about 2.5 inches by 1 inch. The peppers are elongated, ridged, twisted and pinched near the top.

peppers.name: CAP 1004
peppers.description:
See Pasilla Bajio

Note: The CAP classification system for chile varieties orginates from a research institution in Germany.

peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note: The CGN classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Wageningen, The Netherlands

peppers.name: CAP 501
peppers.description: A very rare small white flowering wild species native to Argentina, Bolivia and Paraguay. It is known locally as 'Tova' or 'Covincho' in Paraguay. The Plant has an erect growing habit and is approximately 80 cm tall. The erect pods are elongated, triangular, 2.5 cm long, 0.5 cm wide and mature from green to red.

peppers.name: CAP 503
peppers.description: This is one of the wild purple flowering Capsicum species; the others being Capsicum pubescens and Capsicum cardenasii which are thought to have an as yet to be discovered common ancestor. It has a somewhat sprawly habit and the small red pods are hot.

peppers.name: CAP 539
peppers.description:
Description currently unavailable.

Note: The CAP classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at a research institution in Germany.

peppers.name: CAP 724
peppers.description:
Mature pod shown here. Description currently unavailable.

peppers.name: CAP 964

Note: The CAP classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at a research institution in Germany.

peppers.name: CAPRICORN F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: Red when mature. 2-3 lobes.25cm long. TMV resistant.

peppers.name: HABANERO CARIBBEAN RED
peppers.description: Originating from the Yucutan Peninsula in Mexico, this pepper variety is FEROCIOUSLY HOT and is thought to be the second hottest chile pepper variety on the planet measuring a scorching 445,000 scoville units. This makes it twice as hot as a standard Habanero Chile and over 80 times hotter than an Jalapeno Pepper! The slightly wrinkled chiles are approximately 1 inch wide by 1.5 inches long and are similiar in shape to the Habanero. The chiles ripen from lime green to a brilliant red in 110 days and are produced on very productive plants that reach 30 inches tall. As well as the blistering heat, they have a lovely fruity flavour which makes them an excellent choice for use in salsa's, marinades and of course, in hot sauce. Note: An immature pod is shown here.

peppers.name: CHILE CARIBE GUERO
peppers.description: Guero means pale or blond in Spanish. Mexicans call Anglos "guero". Gueros are used mostly for salsas and salads and are available en escabeche (pickled). They often form the base of a popular southwest Mexican dish, carne adovada.

peppers.name: CARLISTON
peppers.description: A 6in long and thin walled early sweet pepper from Turkey. This pepper has a nice strong 'green pepper' flavour and ripens very early to lime green, then more slowly to red. In Turkey it is dried and ground to make a rich sweet paprika.

peppers.name: CARMAGNOLA ROSSO
peppers.description: A bell pepper variety. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: CASADOS NATIVE
peppers.description: A  medium sized pepper from Casado Farms in El Guique, New Mexico although its origins can be traced to Spain

peppers.name: CASCABEL
peppers.description: Also called 'Jingle Bell' or 'Rattle' an allusion to the seeds rattling in the pods of this oval shaped chile when dried. These 3cm chiles resemble small cherrys and are called 'bola' in there fresh form and 'Guajones' or 'Coras'  when dried. They are most commonly used when dried. hese moderately hot chilies are mostly available dried. In their fresh state, they are green or red and shaped like a small tomato. Dried, their skin turns a brownish red and becomes translucent.

peppers.name: CASCABELLA
peppers.description:
Cascabella is an open pollinated Hungarian Wax type hot pepper that reaches maturity approximately 72-75 days. Long thin peppers  Similar to Santa Fe Grande, but smaller. Yellowish fruit turns red at maturity, interesting flavor.
(This is not Cascabel)

peppers.name: CAT YELLOW
peppers.description: Pods have a citrus flavour. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: CATERINA
peppers.description: A chile from the Mexican state of Aguascalientes, it is 1-2 inches long by 1/2 inch wide, and the seeds rattle in the pods.

peppers.name: CAY VEIT
peppers.description: A chili from Vietnam. Produces 1 1/2"3" fruits which go from green to bright red

peppers.name: CAYENNE
peppers.description: Pre-Columbian in origin and named after the Cayenne River in French Guyana, it owes it spread around the world to Portugal whose traders acrried it around the world in the 15th & 16th centuries. The long thin red fruits (in most cases) are probably what most non chileheads think all Chile Peppers look like. There are now a multitude of varieties available with differing fruit lengths, thicknesses and heat levels. Most grows 4 to 6 inches long, are thin fleshed and can be eaten green or red. They attain maximum heat however if they are left to ripen on the bush. Can be used in hot sauces or powdered to make cayenne pepper. 30000-50000 Scoville Units.

peppers.name: CAYENNE BUIST'S YELLOW
peppers.description: Conforms to the description of Victorian era Buist's catalogue. Popular among nineteenth century gardeners, dating back to 1840's or 50's, probably came in with the Demerara Sugar trade. This is a beautiful, yellow, tasty, good yielding, mildly hot pepper

peppers.name: CAYENNE CAROLINA
peppers.description: An nice varietyr for pickling or eating fresh, the pods grow approximately 4in long and mature from green to red.. This variety also has good resistance to root knot nematode.

peppers.name: CAYENNE GOLDEN
peppers.description: A more interesting and hotter version of the standard cayene pepper.  The golden cayenne is larger, more uniform and has smooth rather than  the characteristic rippled skin of some cayenne varieties.

peppers.name: CAYENNE INDONESIAN
peppers.description: This Cayenne type variety from Indonesia produces 4 to 5 in long by 0.25in wide slender peppers which mature from green to red. The pods are often curled and snake-like.

peppers.name: CAYENNE JOES LONG
peppers.description: A Cayenne type Joe's Long is definitely long, it keeps growing just like Pinocchio's nose, reaching up to 8 to 10in in length, tapering down to a point. The pods from green to a bright red with a good heat content and flavour. Believed to originate from Calabria, Italy. Also known as Whippets Tail.

peppers.name: CAYENNE LARGE RED THICK
peppers.description: A new variety developed by the USDA and is believed to be the hottest Cayenne type. The pods are long and wrinkled, averaging 6-7inches in length. Pods ripen from green to red in approximately 70 days.

peppers.name: CAYENNE LONG THICK RED
peppers.description: Wrinkled peppers are 6 inches long and skinny. Fiery hot and excellent for drying. An attractive plant.  (70 days)

peppers.name: CAYENNE LONG SLIM
peppers.description: According to one anonymous writer, this variety was first documented in 1493 by Christopher Columbus and that one of his passengers, a man named de Cuneo, described how Native Americans ate peppers like one would eat an apple. Cayenne peppers are used fresh in hot sauces, dried or ground for cayeene pepper or pepper flakes or threaded onto a string as an attractive 'Rista' craft decoration. These attractive plants are covered with long, thin peppers which mature from emerald green to a scarlet red in approximately 68 days. This variety is said to be particularly high in vitamins C and A.

peppers.name: CAYENNE ORANGE F1
peppers.description: New Hybrid Chilli Pepper Orange Cayenne variety with attractive glossy orange fruits at maturity. Fruits are pendant setting and a little more rounded at the base than Golden Cayenne. 35,000 Scoville approx

peppers.name: CAYENNE PASSION
peppers.description: 8in long slender fruits have a slight purple hue.

peppers.name: CAYENNE VIOLET
peppers.description:
This exceptionally edible ornamental pepper is probably the most beautiful of the many Cayenne varieties. The plants grow 2 to 3 feet tall and are  are covered with dozens of delicate white/purple flowers which turn into dark violet coloured  thin peppers about 3" long, a bit smaller that a regular cayenne.
A stunning plant. ## HIGHLY RECOMMENDED ##

peppers.name: CAYENNE RING OF FIRE
peppers.description: Smaller and smoother than a cayenne pepper, but with more fiery heat! These  pencil-thin Cayenne-type peppers are about 4 inches long and mature from green to red approximately 60 days after transplanting. The plants are relatively short but yield heavy, concentrated sets of these fiery peppers. A good choice for short season gardeners.

peppers.name: CAYENNE THOMAS JEFFERSON
peppers.description: Thomas Jefferson first planted this pepper at Shadwell, his birthplace, in 1767, just before his twenty-fourth birthday.A medium hot prolific pepper which is very easy to grow.

peppers.name: CAYENNE YELLOW
peppers.description:
A traditional cayenne type, except that the green pods mature to bright yellow.
20-40.000 Scoville units

peppers.name: CENTENNIAL RAINBOW
peppers.description: A compact green leafed plant with white pods turning to purple when slightly sunburnt. A good choice for container growing.

peppers.name: CGN 21569
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. This variety ois more accurately part of the specie Annuum var aviculare

There is much debate as to the true species of this very unusual pepper. From the documentation & studies undertaken by  Jukka Kilpinen it appears it most likely to be part of the species Capsicum Eximium.

peppers.name: YELLOW BOUQUET (PI 315025)
peppers.description: Pendent 4x3/4" red fruits on 2½'x2½' plants. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.  Also listed as CGN 22181

peppers.name: CGN 22208
peppers.description: This wild variety is one of the worlds rarest peppers, found only in the Galapagos Islands. The plant is slender with distinctive hairy leaves (like Pubescent). The pods are small, round and mature from green to red.

peppers.name: CGN 22876 (PI 606708)
peppers.description: Tovarii is a wild species and this slender plant has peculiar, bell-shaped and whitish flowers. The pods are extremely small and turn from green to red.

peppers.name: CHAMBORATE
peppers.description: A hot, green to orange/red pepper that grows to 3-4 inches long.

peppers.name: CHAPEU DE FRADE (PI 497974)
peppers.description: This variety has many names: Balloon, Pimenta Cambuci, Campane, Peri Peri, Ubatuba Cambuci, Aji Flor, Orchid and Bishops Hat to name a few!! This very unusual pod shaped variety is believed to have been  transfered from South America to Europe by the Portuguese in the 18th century and is actually part of the species Capsicum baccatum var. pendulum.  The plants are quite large growing 3 to 4 ft tall and produce 30 to 50 extremely weird 3 or 4 flat winged, wrinkled almost flying saucer like 1 ½" wide pods. The flesh of each pod is thin athough crisp to taste and they mature from green to red approximately 90-100 days after seedlings have emerged. The body of the pods have some detectable heat, but the wings are sweet and mild.

peppers.name: CHARAPITA (PI 260498)
peppers.description: This bushy plant produces hundreds of hot small round 'Tepin like' peppers. Also known as 'Charapilla' and 'Yellow Fire', it is also  very similar (if not the same as) 'Cumani' and 'Tettinas de Monk'' and Yellow 'Jellybean'.

peppers.name: CHARLESTON BELLE PEPPER
peppers.description: The Charleston Belle pepper was developed by the USDA Agricultural Research Service (ARS) for its high resistance to rot knot nematodes. Matures from green to red, has a medium size pod and matures in 67 days

peppers.name: CHARLESTON HOT
peppers.description: developed by the USDA at Clemson University in South Carolina Cayenne type matures from light green to orange in72 days. Thin fruit. 70000 to 100000 SHU It is straight to slightly curved because it is a Cayenne, (but much hotter) and 4 to 5 inches long and 3/4 inch across. It matures from green to yellow to reddish orange. Plants are 18 inches tall.  It is reported to contain 100,000 Scoville heat units, which is more than a typical Cayenne and about 1/3rd of the heat of a Habanero so is great for cooking with. A very hot, wild, miniature chili pepper usually harvested in the; wild in the southwestern U.S. Most homes in the southwest: have a plant or two growing in their garden.

peppers.name: CHAWA
peppers.description: Pale to medium yellow. Up to 5 inches long. Curved and tapering to a point. From Yucatan and Caribbean coastal area of Mexico

peppers.name: CHAYUSA RUSO
peppers.description: A small pointed ornamental pepper that starts out white and ripens to red.  Very similar to Aji Omnicolor

peppers.name: CHEESE PIMENTO
peppers.description: A strange looking pepper variety! The fruits are squash shaped, being fairly flat, but around 3" wide. The thick fleshed pods mature from milky green to yellow and finally to orange and are very sweet tasting.

peppers.name: CHEONGHONG F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: A hybridised cayenne type pepper from Korea introduced in the early 1980s

peppers.name: CHEIRO (PI 497978)
peppers.description: Cheiro' means smell in Portuguese. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: CHERRY CHOCOLATE
peppers.description: A 1.5 to 2 inches long by 1.5 to 2 inches wide, Cherry Type which  matures from green to dark brown.

peppers.name: CHERRAPENO
peppers.description: A cross between a Cherry and a Jalapeno

peppers.name: CHERRY
peppers.description: Introduced into England from the West Indies in 1759 (although thought to originate from America), this variety takes its name after the appearance of its pods. Many hybridised varieties have since been developed. So named for their resemblance to the familiar fruit, cherry peppers are round and red. They range in pungency from mild to moderately hot. Cherry peppers are sold fresh, and also are commonly pickled and sold in jars. Scoville units: 0-3,500.

peppers.name: CHERRY BOMB F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: A hybridsed semi compact plant from PETO which produces high yields of 2.5in by 1.5in cherry like globular fruit. The peppers have a thick wall which makes them ideal for pickling and ripen from green to bright red approximately 65-70 days after transplanting. Heat rating of 2,500-5,000 Scoville

peppers.name: CHERRY PICK
peppers.description: This is the first F1 hybrid sweet cherry pepper, offering earlier maturity and more uniform size and shape than open-pollinated cherry peppers. Plants average 2ft in height and produce heavy yields of 1 1/4-inch round fruit that mature from dark green to bright red. A good pickling variety.

peppers.name: PI 560943
peppers.description: Fruits vaguely spheroid with flattened tops, 5cm diam., somewhat ribbed, inverted apex. Colour deep red. Pedicel insertion slightly depressed. Fruit walls firm and thick, moderately piquant. Placenta red. Seeds light yellow

peppers.name: LARGE RED CHERRY
peppers.description: These  round cherry peppers matures from green to bright red approximately 70-75 days after transplanting.  Popular for pickling and preserving, they are also delicious when stuffed with cheese. Approximately 3500 scoville heat units.

peppers.name: CGN 20497
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note: The CGN classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Wageningen, The Netherlands

peppers.name: CHERVENA CHUJSKA
peppers.description: This sweet and crunchy Bulgarian heirloom is a fantastic pepper for roasting, but can also be eaten fresh.  The tapered fruits measure 2" at the shoulder by 6" long and ripen from green to brown and then to mahogany then red approximately 85 days after transplanting

peppers.name: CHEYENNE
peppers.description: This variety is often found in UK garden centres and market gardens and its heavy fruiting compact nature makes it ideal for growing on the windowsill, in the greenhouse or on a sheltered patio. The plant can grow upto 18 inches in the right conditions and produces a good crop of orange medium sized fruits which are fantastic in Chile Con Carne. Very tasty and highly recommended..

peppers.name: JALAPENO CHICHIMECA
peppers.description: A large Jalapeno variety from Liberty seeds who say pods average 10 x 4 cm in size, weighing 36 g. 70 days to maturity.  This is quite a prodctive variety, with medium hot peppers of quite uniform size.

peppers.name: CHI CHIEN
peppers.description: This is a hot pepper from the Chinese subcontinent. Chi-Chien produces thin-skinned red peppers that can be used fresh for cooking or dried for storage and future use. The medium size peppers are popular for cooking in many hot spicy Chinese foods. This variety is also an ideal ornamental plant in the gardens due to its striking and brightly coloured pepper pods. 70,000 Scoville Units

peppers.name: CHILACA
peppers.description: The pods are long, slender and undulated. Some reach up to 30 cm. and they grow in a semi-circle. It is dark green in its tender state but becomes a dark brown when ripe. When dried, the Chilaca is called "Pasilla" chile and it becomes a very dark red. Its is also called 'Cuernillos', 'Chile Negro' or' Big Horns'. About 3 thousand acres are planted in the Mexican states of Aguascalientes, Jalisco, Guanajuato, Zacatecas and Michoacan.

peppers.name: CHILCOSTLE
peppers.description: An elongated 5in tapered pepper which matures from deep orange to red. In its dried form it is  used in mole in Mexican cookery. Also spelt Chilcoxle or Chilcoxtle .

peppers.name: CHILE DE AGUA
peppers.description: Chile de Agua’ apparently means ‘irrigated or water chile," and the 4 inch long x 1inch wide pods grow erect on the plant. However like other chiles which cross polibate easily, their is much pod variation in this variety. Cross Country Nurseries offer a variety of the same name although, the pods are pendant and measured 2 ½ inches long and one inch wide.

peppers.name: CHILE DE COMIDA
peppers.description: A large chile which turns a rich rustic red

peppers.name: CHILE DE CUSCUTLAN
peppers.description: This very old (pre-Columbian) variety from Honduras grows to 2.5ft tall and can reach 1.5ft wide and bears lots of pendant shaped 1.5in x 0.3in tapered orange fruits.

peppers.name: ROCOTO DE SEDA
peppers.description: C. pubescens; clear yellow-orange 2x1½" pendent, smooth fruits on 4'x4' plants with large, pubescent leaves; fruits meaty and hot.

peppers.name: CHILE GRANDE
peppers.description: A large, smooth skinned, 4in long by 1in wide tapered pepper which matures from green to red approximately 60 days after transplanting.

peppers.name: CHILE PEPE (PI 632921)
peppers.description: This variety is more accurately part of the Capsicum annuum var. glabriusculum species. More detialed description currently unavailable.

peppers.name: PERON ROJO
peppers.description: Translates to' Pear shape'. See its brother 'manzano'

peppers.name: CHILI PETINE
peppers.description: A very prolific plant which produces peppers which begin green and ripen to red. Dark green leaves have a distinctive purple cast

peppers.name: CHILE VERDE (PI 438531)
peppers.description: This variety produces 6cm long by 1cm wide slender pods which mature to red.

peppers.name: CHILHUACLE AMARILLO
peppers.description: An Oaxacan (Mexico) chile used in moles. Resembles a small Poblano. There are three forms, amarillo (yellow), rojo (red) and negro (black). Also spelt chilguacle.

peppers.name: CHILHUACLE NEGRO (CAP 1004)
peppers.description: An Oaxacan (Mexico) chile used in moles which comes in three forms, amarillo (yellow), rojo (red) and negro (black). The pods are called  'Chilaca' when fresh and 'Pasilla' when dried. Other common names used include 'Chile Negro',  'Mexican Negro and 'Pasilla Bajio' . These 8 to 10 inch long cylindrical peppers are thin walled and ripen from dark green to dark brown (75-80 days). They have less than 250 Scoville units and are mainly used dried for their rich, smoky flavouring in sauces. Plants are tobacco mosaic virus (TMV) resistant.

peppers.name: CHILHUACLE ROJO
peppers.description: An Oaxacan (Mexico) chile used in moles. Resembles a small Poblano. There are three forms, amarillo (yellow), rojo (red) and negro (black). Also spelt chilguacle.

peppers.name: CHILI PENGUIN (PI 273419 )
peppers.description: The variety occurs in the wild in much of Central and South America. Plant low, spreading; flowers small white; fruit erect, oval, rust colored, 0.5in by 0.3in, prolific.

peppers.name: CHILIANCHO HYBRID
peppers.description: A medium hot, dark green, thin walled pepper which grows toaround 4 inches long. 65 days.

peppers.name: CHILLY CHILI HYBRID
peppers.description: This ornamental pepper seems to explode in a riot of color, bringing bright orange and red to landscapes or containers. As a bonus, Chilly Chili is safe to use around children because the peppers are not pungent. Two to 2-1/2 inch long fruit are borne above the foliage and start out greenish-yellow, then turn to orange, and finally to dark red. Plants grow about 1 foot tall and spread up to 14 inches wide. Extremely heat tolerant, Chilly Chili provides garden color even during the hottest summers.

peppers.name: CHILTAPIN (PI 310488)
peppers.description: This variety is actually part of the species Capsicum annuum var. glabriusculum. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: HAHONY KOCHO
peppers.description: Used as an ingrediant of the Korean dish  Kimchi - fermented cabbage with peppers. The Cayenne type pods are approximately 2in in length and mature from green to red.

peppers.name: CHILTOMA DE NICARAGUA
peppers.description: 3x1½" pendent, wrinkled red fruits. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: CHIMAYO
peppers.description: Chimayo is an early maturing highly flavoured medium-hot chile originating from the New Mexican village of Chimayo. The pods grow to approximately 10cm long and are an excellent all round pepper for roasting, making chile powder, ristras, sauces and salsa.

peppers.name: CHINA EXPRESS
peppers.description: 60000 to 80000 SHU. Dark green thin fruit mature to red in 75 days

peppers.name: CHINCHI UCHU
peppers.description: The pods are red, 3 to 5 cm in length, oval with distinctive longitudinal lines present. Pods have an erect habit.

peppers.name: CHINDA 2
peppers.description: A variety from the genebank at the Asian Vegetable Research and Development Center, Taiwan. This 2ft tall plant produces erect 2in x 0.25in red fruits which are said to be good for oriental soups and stir fries.

peppers.name: CHINESE GIANT
peppers.description: This old-fashioned bell pepper can be traced back to the early 1900, when it was one of the largest peppers at the time. The peppers arevery large measuring 5 to 6 in deep and wide, but grows on a compact, bushy plant. When this variety is fully ripened (approx 75 days), it turns bright red and is very sweet. The thick-walled, blocky fruit are absolutely perfect for making stuffed peppers.

peppers.name: CHIPOTLE
peppers.description: The general name for any smoked pepper. The true chipotle is greyish tan in colour, quite stiff and is often described as looking like a cigar butt. lso known as smoked jalapeno, the chipotle is medium hot with a deep, smoky flavor. It can also be found packed in canned adobo sauce. Scoville units: 10,000.

peppers.name: CHOCOLATE BEAUTY
peppers.description: A hybridised F1 bell pepper variety.  This plant produces  medium-large, 3 or 4-lobed bell peppers which mature from green to an attractive chocolate/dark mahogany colour approximately 85 days after transplanting. The plants are tobacco mosaic virus (TMV) resistant.

peppers.name: CHRISTMAS
peppers.description: A veru prolific compact ornamental variety with slightly sweet pods. The pods are approximately 1.25 inch long by 0.5 inch wide and grow erec on the plant.The pods mature from white, purple, yellow and orange through to red pods.

peppers.name: CHRISTMAS BELL (PI 497974)
peppers.description: This variety has many names: Balloon, Pimenta Cambuci, Campane, Peri Peri, Ubatuba Cambuci, Aji Flor, Orchid, Bishops Crown and Bishops Hat to name a few!! This very unusual pod shaped variety is believed to have been  transfered from South America to Europe by the Portuguese in the 18th century and is actually part of the species Capsicum baccatum var. pendulum.  The plants are quite large growing 3 to 4 ft tall and produce 30 to 50 extremely weird 3 or 4 flat winged, wrinkled almost flying saucer like 1 ½" wide pods. The flesh of each pod is thin athough crisp to taste and they mature from green to red approximately 90-100 days after seedlings have emerged. The body of the pods have some detectable heat, but the wings are sweet and mild.

peppers.name: CHUPETINHA (PIMENTA BICO)
peppers.description: The literal translation is "small rubber nipple". Fruits are elongated, cone-shaped, 3 x 8cm, red, slightly pungent. Also called pimenta biquinho, PI 441634 and BGH 4200.

peppers.name: CILI GORONONG
peppers.description: Cili is the Malaysian word for Chile. This  Malaysian variety produces pendent shaped 2½x1½' yellow-orange, heavily wrinkled fruits tapering to a point; plants 1½' tall x 2' wide; hot with good smokey-tropical fruit flavor.

peppers.name: CILI MERAH
peppers.description: Moderate set of 5x1" slightly wrinkled, tapered fruits. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: CILIBANGI 1
peppers.description: Ornamental variety named after Bangi, the town whereit was developed at the  University of Kebangsaan

peppers.name: CILIBANGI 2
peppers.description: Larger fruits than Cilibangi-1.  Named after the town Bangi, where it was developed at the University of Kebangsaan.

peppers.name: CILIBANGI 3
peppers.description: High fruit yields. Ideally used fresh when flesh is cruncy.  Named after the town Bangi, where it was developed at the University of Kebangsaan.

peppers.name: CILIBANGI 4
peppers.description: Ideally used when dried.  Named after the town Bangi, where it was developed at the University of Kebangsaan.

peppers.name: CILIEGIA
peppers.description: Meaning 'Cherry'. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: CLEOS DRAGON
peppers.description: A Habanero relative, the heaviliy wrinkled pods are approximately 1 1/2 to 2 inches long by 1 1/2 to 2 inches wide. The mature from lime green to red.

peppers.name: CLOVIS COAST
peppers.description: Medium early maturity. Vigorous plant, growing to a height of 70cm (28 inches). Fruits are conical in shape, 25cm long and 4cm wide. The flesh is thick, yellow-green and the skin is smooth. Fruits ripen to a bright red. Highly resistant to diseases

peppers.name: C01706
peppers.description:
Immature Pod shown. Description currently unavailable.

Note: The CO classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at the Asian Vegetable Research and Development Center, Taiwan

peppers.name: C02722
peppers.description:
Heavy set of erect, clustered 2.25in x 0.5in tapered red fruits grow on a 1.5ft tall x 1.5ft wide plant.

Note:The CO classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at the Asian Vegetable Research and Development Center, Taiwan

peppers.name: C04177
peppers.description:
This large plant grows on average to 3ft high x 4ft wide and bears lots of 2in long x 1.25in wide wrinkled oval fruits which grow erect on the plant.

Note:The CO classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at the Asian Vegetable Research and Development Center, Taiwan

peppers.name: C05081
peppers.description:
This 2ft tall plant bears good yileds of 1in x 0.75in smooth, oval shaped fruits which have a smokey tropical fruit flavour but little heat.

 Note:The CO classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at the Asian Vegetable Research and Development Center, Taiwan

peppers.name: C05813
peppers.description:
This plant bears 1.5in x 1in smooth, oval red fruits which hve an intense, smokey, tropical fruit flavour, but little to no heat.

Note:The CO classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at the Asian Vegetable Research and Development Center, Taiwan.

peppers.name: C05842
peppers.description: This low growing, sprawling plant  bears good yields of 2.5in x 1.25in smooth block fruits which ripen from green to orange and finally to red. The plants are meaty and have a smokey tropical fruit flavour but little heat. Note:The CO classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at the Asian Vegetable Research and Development Center, Taiwan

peppers.name: COAST
peppers.description: Medium early maturity. Vigorous plant, growing to a height of 70cm (28 inches). Fruits are conical in shape, 25cm long and 4cm wide. The flesh is thick, yellow-green and the skin is smooth. Fruits ripen to a bright red. Highly resistant to diseases.

peppers.name: COBAN
peppers.description: A smoked Guatemalan piquin type chile.

peppers.name: COBINCHO
peppers.description: A rare variety from the species Capsicum Exile. A mature pod is shown here.  Seeds can be difficult to germinate but we found putting them on a damp paper towel, in a zip lock bag, in a warm place works well.  Others have had success wetting, then drying, then wetting again.  Once growing the plant sprawls, stems are very thin and the plant has very small, delicate white flowers.  Not many pods in the first year, but easy to over winter indoors and second year should be covered in pods.  Does not grow very tall, makes an attractive indoor pepper.

peppers.name: COBRA G4
peppers.description: This Cayenne type variety produces 5 to 6 inches long by 0.375 to 0.5 inches wide, thin-skinned, curved pods which hang in great numbers. The pods mature from olive green to dark red.

peppers.name: COCHITI
peppers.description: A medium large wax type pepper originally grown at Cochiti Pueblo in northern New Mexico (hence the name).

peppers.name: COLA DE RATA
peppers.description: See De Arbol. Also know as  pico de pajaro (bird beak)

peppers.name: COLOR GUARD
peppers.description: A compact ornamental variety  that makes a great container pepper. The pods are approximately 1 inch long by 1/4 inch wide and grow erect on the plant. They  mature from pale yellow to purple to orangeand finally  to red.

peppers.name: COMAPENO
peppers.description: A small orange chile consumed both fresh and dry in Veracruz, Mexico. Also called Ozulyamero

peppers.name: CONFETTI
peppers.description: Conical - 1" peppers. Multicolored peppers on one pepper bush. Great producer

peppers.name: CONGO TRINIDAD
peppers.description: In Trinidad, habanero pepper relatives are called 'Congo peppers' and this one is an extra-large red habanero type. At 2 inches long and wide, its peppers are significantly bigger and more ribbed than the typical red habanero.  They are also intensely hot and extremely productive, with large harvests of peppers that continue to form as long as weather permits. 80 days

peppers.name: CORACAO DE GALINHA (PI 441689)
peppers.description: Introduced by a Japanese colony. Fruits 1.2 x 2cm, red. The plants grow to approximately 1.2 meters in height. They begin fruit production in approximatley 120 days.

peppers.name: CORAZON DE QUETZALCOATL
peppers.description: A heart shaped poblano grown in Durango, Mexico

peppers.name: CORNO DI TORO RED
peppers.description: This is a Cubanelle type from Italy. Corno Di Toro means bull's horn and these sweet peppers have fruits which are 8 to 10" long and are curved like a bull's horn, hence the name. They ripen to red approximately 68 days after transplanting.

peppers.name: CORNO DI TORO YELLOW
peppers.description: This is a Cubanelle type from Italy. Corno Di Toro means bull's horn and these tall prolific plants produce sweet tasting podss which are 8 to 10" long and are curved like a bull's horn, hence the name. They ripen to yellow approximately 68 days after transplanting.

peppers.name: COSTENO AMARILLO
peppers.description: Shiny, amber in color, tapering to a point, and measuring about 2 to 3 inches long and 3/4 to 1 inch across at the shoulders. Wafer-thin flesh; has a light, crisp, lemon-citrus flavor with green tomato and grassy tones, and a subtle heat. Used in the preparation of yellow mole sauces. Also good in soups and stews..

peppers.name: COTAXTLA
peppers.description: A cultivated variety of serrano grown in Mexico

peppers.name: COW HORN
peppers.description: These  3 feet tall plants produce 6-10 inch medium hot, slender, curved pods which resemble a cow's horn, hence the name. The pods ripens from dark green to red approximately 75 days after transplanting.

peppers.name: MARIACHI
peppers.description: 65 days – Similar to Hungarian Medium Hot and Szentesi Semi Hot in shape and size. Use for salsa or stuff.

peppers.name: CRIMSON HOT
peppers.description: An excellent early producing Ancho type pepper. Large triangular waxy pods with a medium thick f 60 days. 2500 SHUlesh, maturing from green to crimson red with a moderate level of heat. Treated seed for healthy growth. 6-7in pods

peppers.name: AJI CRIOLLA SELLA
peppers.description: An Aji type, this medium sized 24in plants produces  2-3" fruits that ripen from light green to golden yellow approximately 100 days after transplanting. The peppers are quite pungent and have lemony overtones.  A very nice variety.

peppers.name: CSERESZNYE PAPRIKA
peppers.description: This is a Hungarian pepper often used to make the famous paprika spice. Pods are 2 to 3 cm in diameter and mature from green to red. They are mainly eaten fresh but are  also canned or dried.

peppers.name: CUBANELLE
peppers.description: These 6in tapered short bright yellow fruits are much loved when fried. Good for frying (65-68 days). Very similar to the 'Aconagua' and the longer 'Biscayne'

peppers.name: CUMARI
peppers.description: These small pea size (3-4 mm) pods grow on a branching shrub like plant.  Very prolific. Extremely aromatic and very fruity. One of my favourites! A Capsicum Chinense version is also available (note Chinense pods are shown here)

peppers.name: CUMARI DO PARA
peppers.description: From the Para state of Brazil. Similar to the Cumari variety.

peppers.name: CUOLLORICI
peppers.description: A large (up to 10 inches) curled pod heirloom from Tricarico, Italy. Variety is a sweet pepper, used as a fryer, and with a distinctive taste, but said to be reminiscent of the mild Pimiento de Padron pepper.

peppers.name: CYKLON
peppers.description: Plants grow 24" tall and produce lots of 4 inch long by 1 to1/2 inch wide tapered pods that mature from a emerald green to  a deep red. An excellent chili pepper to use for salsa and adding a crunch to salads

peppers.name: CZECHOSLOVAKIAN BLACK
peppers.description: A highly ornamental European heirloom variety  that combines the qualities of earliness, adaptability, flavour and colour. This plant can grow upto 3ft tall and has green foliage accented by purple veins and white-streaked lavender flowers. The 2 1/2 in by 1in pendant fruits are a blunt conical shape (similar to a Jalapeno) and mature from black, to purple and fianlly to a rich red in only 55-60 days. The showy red fruit at the base, purple black fruit at the top contrasts with purple green leaves.

peppers.name: DA NANG MARKET
peppers.description: arge producer of cayenne type peppers on a tall bush

peppers.name: DAGGER POD (X-235)
peppers.description: A Cayenne Type. Fruits are approx 4 to 5 inches long by 0.5 to 0.75 inches and mature from green through to orange and then to red.

peppers.name: DATIL (PI 281435)
peppers.description:
This variety has been grown for about 300 years in St. Augustine
Florida, and it's name in Spanish means "edible date". The pods are two inches long with shoulders 3/4 inch and mature from green to yellow. It is a Chinense variety and has the a similar heat and aroma to the Habanero, except that the Datil is more fruity and much sweeter. This species is most readily distinguished by the three to five flowers at each node, the drooping pedicels and the circular constriction at the base of the fruit 'cap'

peppers.name: SWEET DATIL
peppers.description: These glossy red peppers from St Augustine, Florida have the same taste as the Datil pepper but with no heat.

peppers.name: DE ARBOL (TREE CHILE)
peppers.description: Chile de arbol is a mild to quite hot pepper popular in western Mexico, where they are sometimes called pico de pajaro (bird beak) or cola de rata (rat tail). Plants are extremely vigorous, growing upto 120cm is a single season hence the translation of 'De Arbol' which means 'small tree' or 'Tree like'. They should be planted at least three feet apart. The slender pendant shaped fruits grow to around 10cm in length and mature from light green to dark red. Often dried and used by the Mexicans to make decorative wreaths or 'Ristras'. Red, slender pepper, up to 3" long. Originally from the Oaxaco and Jalisco states in Mexico.

peppers.name: DE ARBOL PURPLE
peppers.description: These 2-3 inches long, thin pointed pods turn purple before maturing to red.

peppers.name: DE SIETE CALDOS
peppers.description: A chile from Chipas Mexico, that is supposedly so hot that one is enough to spice up seven pots of soup!

peppers.name: DEDO DE MOCA (PI 497972)
peppers.description: Fruits 3 to 4in long, very narrow with a strong flavour. Also listed as  BGH 72. Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: DELGARDO
peppers.description: Sweet pepper that matures to a nice red colour. It is mosaic virus resistant and is less susceptible to blossom end rot and russeting. Excellent flavour with thick walls.

peppers.name: JALAPENO DELICIAS F1
peppers.description: A very productive PETO jalapeno hybrid (65-70 days)  500 SHU

peppers.name: DEMRE
peppers.description: A 4-6 inch long mild, thin skinned Cayenne type pepper from Turkey. Sometimes called Turkish Hot.

peppers.name: DESI TEEKHI
peppers.description: Pods have an irregular shape and average 1/2 inch in thickness and 2 inches in length. Thin walled. Matures to a deep red. Compact plants are about 2 feet tall and are suitable for growing in large pots. 120 days.

peppers.name: DHANI
peppers.description: Grown in Mizoram & some areas of Manipur in India. Blood red in colour and highly pungent. The Indian version of the Birds Eye chile pepper.

peppers.name: DIAMOND WHITE
peppers.description: This bell pepper variety produces 3 to 4 inches long by 3 to 3.5 inches wide blocky peppers. The peppers mature from a translucent white to yellow to orange and finally to a scarlet red approximately 75 days after transplanting. The pods have medium thick walls.

peppers.name: DIENG PLATEAU
peppers.description: The variety produces erect 1¼x1/3" red fruits on 2x2' plants; ripe fruit tend to separate from peduncle; very hot; good drier.

peppers.name: DIENTE DE PERRO (DOGS TOOTH)
peppers.description: USDA accession number PI 555634. Pods grow to 1 inch long by 0,25 inches wide and mature from green to red.

peppers.name: DOLMALIK
peppers.description: A Turkish Poblano which illustrates that some Mexican types are remarkably 'true' when grown elsewhere.

peppers.name: DONETSK
peppers.description: This great Ukrainian chile pepper was originally imported from the Donetsk region of the Ukraine by a  Wymoing couple hence its name. Donetsk is a pungent, cayenne like chile pepper variety that produces an abundance of one to two inch long, smooth, bright red chile peppers. The plant of the Donetsk Chile is 2-3 ft high and is very productive. It is an ideal chile pepper variety for the short seasons of colder climates.  Matures in about 70-80 days.

peppers.name: DONG XUAN MARKET
peppers.description: Originating in Vietnam, these very unique 2in ovate pod grow erect on bushy plant ripening from green to red. The pods have the classic oriental pungency.

peppers.name: DOVE
peppers.description: Large productive 5 in. x 4 3/4 in./ 13 cm x 12 cm. Should be harvested immature for best creamy, near-white appearance. Good leaf cover. Ripens pale green/cream/pale yellow/pale orange/red.

peppers.name: DRAGONS CLAW
peppers.description: This is a Cayenne type variety which produces 8 to 10 inches long by 0.5 to 0.75 inches wide thin walled slender tapered pods which are curved at the tip. They mature from green to deep red.

peppers.name: DUNDICUT
peppers.description: The national pepper of Pakistan. Developed and grown in the Tharparkar region of Sindh, Pakistan. Pods range from spherical to teardrop shaped and average 1 inch in diameter. Strong fruity aroma, ripening to a deep ruby red colour. This pepper is commercially cultivated in Pakistan and is considered indispensable for many dishes. Heat is highly variable and ranges from 50,000 up to 150,000 SHU.

peppers.name: EARLS MACEDONIA #2
peppers.description: 5½x3" tapered red fruits on 1' tall by 8" wide plant; slightly purple leaf nodes.

peppers.name: EARLS MACEDONIA #4
peppers.description: 5x2" fruits turning light-green to orange to red; mildly hot with good flavor. Plant 1x1', with slightly purple leaf nodes.

peppers.name: EARLY SUNSATION
peppers.description: A hybridised F1 bell pepper variety. The peppers are about 4-1/2 inches long and nearly that wide, and are smooth and consistently well shaped. They mature from green to a beautiful shade of golden-yellow after approximately 80 days. As a bonus, these plants are tolerant to most pepper virus diseases and 3 races of bacterial spot.

peppers.name: EASTERN ROCKET
peppers.description: A medium sized bell pepper variety that produces 4 to 6 inches long by 2.5 to 3 inches wide, 3or 4 lobed blocky peppers. The peppers have thick walls and mature from greenish yellow to red approximately 65 days after transplanting.

peppers.name: WILD DYNAMO
peppers.description: Opinion is split on this one.  Some report it as being a Bolivian/Peruvian Cardenasii, others say it is a Brazillian Annuum.  Greg's version shown here seems to show a Baccatum, and Jakob Axelsson confirms this in his photograph collection.

peppers.name: ECUADORIAN RED PEPPER FOR HELL
peppers.description: From the Rocoto family which certainly lives up to its name - this is definately not one for softies. The black seeds are a characteristic of the Pubescens species.

peppers.name: EL CHACO
peppers.description: A locally named hot cultivar from the vast plains next to the Paraguay River. 75 days. 4 inch pods, slightly curved and deep-red when ripe

peppers.name: JALAPENO EL JEFE F1
peppers.description: A F1 hybridised Jalapeno variety developed by Johnny's Seed. Similar in appearence to 'Conchos' but is said to have  slightly larger fruit with narrower shoulders. Also said to be less prone to checking (cracks in skin). 67 days to green, 90 days to red.

peppers.name: ELEPHANTS TRUNK
peppers.description: A very attractive variety from the indian sub continent. The pods are shaped like an elephant's trunk (hence tyhe name), growing to 6-8 inches long. They mature from lime green to a deep red.  Very similar to 'Whippets tail'

peppers.name: ELISA
peppers.description: This is an extremely early elongated bell, Dutch-type pepper. The peppers are smooth, thick-walled with an average 6 inch length and 3 to 4 lobes. When ripe, these huge, gorgeous peppers are bright red with a sweet flavour. Tobacco mosaic virus resistant and tolerant to Potato Virus, Black spot, and tobacco etch virus. Sets well even in cooler temperatures.

peppers.name: ELSITA (PI 294453)
peppers.description: Jalapeno type, hot, red pepper. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: EMBERS
peppers.description: An ornamental pequin type, this plant produces a profusion of small (0.5 to 0.675 long) cone shaped peppers which grow erect on the plant. They ripen from pale yellow to orange and finally to red.

peppers.name: EMERALD GIANT
peppers.description: Roasted, stuffed & baked, or eaten fresh in salads, Emerald Giant's large, thick fleshed peppers have more vitamin C than an orange! 74 days

peppers.name: ENCORE
peppers.description: Encore is a blocky, very smooth skinned, thick walled bell pepper type. Peppers mature from green to red and has excellent diseace resistance.

peppers.name: ENTERPRISE
peppers.description: Sweet bell hybrid. A New early mid-season disease resistant large blocky pepper hybrid from Asgrow that has shown excellent performance in field conditions. Vigorous plant. 71 days

peppers.name: ESCONDIDO
peppers.description: Also spelt Esconidida, this Anaheim type orginates from Escondida in New Mexico (hence its name) which is over 5,000 ft over sea level. The thin skinned pods can grow up to 5 inches long by 1 to 1.25 inches wide and ripen from green to brown and finally to red.

peppers.name: ESPANOLA
peppers.description: The Ristra Chile, well adapted for the UK short-season growing, this medium-hot, thin-walled fruit matures to a bright, true, fire-engine red.  Air-dried Espanolas also make an excellent, deep-flavoured chile powder. Their medium pungency is just right to add a little zing to any dish and makes delicious red chile sauce, my favourite cooking chile. Colourful 150 - 200mm long Espanolas mature extra early.

peppers.name: EXPLOSIVE EMBER
peppers.description: Probably one of the most stunning edible ornamental pepper in the world, this compact plant (10-14 inches) has brilliant purple foliage and purple upright growing 1in conical shaped fruit which mature from dark glossy purple to red. As an added bonus, before fruiting the plant displays a stunning show of deep purple flowers with jet centres. On of thechileman's favourites. ## VERY HIGHLY RECOMMENED ##

peppers.name: EXTRA HOT
peppers.description: This Anaheim type sold by Cross Country Nurseries measures 6 to 7 inches long by 1 to 2 inches wide and matures from green to red. A good variety for Stuffing, Roasting, Fried/Stir-Fried, Canning/Processing etc

peppers.name: F1 SUNNY
peppers.description: This is a hybridised cayenne variety which has been developed to produce pods which are hotter than a standrad cayenne.  The pendant pods are long and thin walled and typically grow between 10 to 15cm long. They mature from a dark green colour to a vivid red.  A good cooking variety particularly for those that like a spicy Indian curry..

peppers.name: CHAO TIAN JIAO FACING HEAVEN)
peppers.description: This is a pungent variety grown in Szechuan province of China. The fruits are very aromatic with a great citrus flavour and ripen to a bright claret red.Pods have a good pungency with an intense start to the burn mellowing after a while. It is also called 'Facing Heaven' or 'Heaven Chile' on the account of the fruits grow pointing towards the sky.

peppers.name: FAT N SASSY
peppers.description: This F1 hybridised bell pepper variety is reputed to be one of the best green to red bell peppers for its early sets of large and heavy blocky bell peppers. Fruit sets are abundant with the peppers measuring 4-1/2 inches in length and width. They mature from green to red approximately 65 days after transplanting and have a nice sweet flavour.

peppers.name: FATALII
peppers.description: This chile is one of the hottest, if not the hottest on earth. A Habanero relative and sometimes spelt Fatalli, this prolific plant can grow upto 4ft tall, although 2ft is more common. The plant produces good yields of 3" long by 1 ¼" wide wrinkled extremely hot fruits which turn from pale green to bright yellow when mature (100 days). They have a fruity, almost citrus-like flavour and make a very attractive-coloured hot sauce. Believe me, these are not called 'Fatalii' for nothing!!!.

peppers.name: FATALII RED
peppers.description: A red version of the standard Fatalii chile, one of the hottest, if not the hottest on earth. A Habanero relative and sometimes spelt Fatalli, this prolific plant can grow upto 4ft tall , although 2ft is more common. The plant produces good yields of 3" long by 1 ¼" wide wrinkled extremely hot fruits which turn from pale green to bright yellow when mature (100 days). They have a fruity, almost citrus-like flavour and make a very attractive-coloured hot sauce. Believe me, these are not called 'Fatalii' for nothing!!!.

peppers.name: FEHEROZON
peppers.description: Names means 'Waterfall', this is one of the most popular sweet peppers in Hungary. The pods grow to approximately 4in in length by 2.4in wide and mature from a pale yellow to red. Sometimes called Hungarian Paprika.

peppers.name: FIESTA (FIPS)
peppers.description: A very nice ornamental variety. This small plant produces many tightly packed clusters of long, pointed, erect growing chillies. The pods start off ivory, then many shades of yellow, orange and red. Excellent in containers as a patio plant, which can be brought indoors as a table centrepiece for dinner parties. Very similar - if not the same as 'Riot' and 'Medusa'. Also know as Fips.

peppers.name: FIGARO
peppers.description: A hybridised sweet bell pepper from Vilmorin, this vigorous plant produces 1.5 to 2 inches long by 2.5 to 3.5 inches wide, 'Cheese' type peppers which matures from green to bright red approximately 70 days after transplanting.   It is said that it requires less nitrogen than standard varieties.

peppers.name: FIJI EMBERS
peppers.description: Prolific plant which produces many medium hear-shaped peppers

peppers.name: FILFIL I SURKH (PI 125801)
peppers.description: Fruit about 3in long and matures from green to red.

peppers.name: FILIUS BLUE
peppers.description: Edible Ornamental. Plants produce unusual purplish foliage and fruits that are purplish-blue and very hot when young, turning red and mild when they mature (80 days) Edible ornamental pepper. Violet colored leaves specked with white. Oval purple fruit are held upright and retain their color for a long time before turning red

peppers.name: FIRE CRACKER
peppers.description: Hot Indian Pepper Hybrid suitable for dry red and green peppers, heavy fruiting variety 9-10cm fruit length

peppers.name: FIRE TONGUE
peppers.description: Pods have a tart flavour. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: PEQUIN FIRECRACKER
peppers.description: Also spelt Piquin Firecracker, this attractive ornamental variety produces a multitude of 2cm conical shaped, multi coloured fruits which grow erect on the plant. Pod colours including cream, orange, purple and red and are present on the plant at the same time. The pods are very hot and although they are edible, they have no discerning taste. This is an  ideal variety for the patio or in the conservatory.  A right cracker!

peppers.name: FIRENZA
peppers.description: This is a hybridised Jalapeno variety. The plant produces 3-3 1/2 inch long, cylindrical, with slightly tapered blunt tip peppers. Looks and tastes like the standard Jalapeno but is more disease resisitant.

peppers.name: FISH PEPPER
peppers.description: Pre-1870's African American heirloom variety used to season fish and shellfish in the African-American communities around Baltimore and Philadelphia . A very striking ornamental pepper where both the 18 - 24inch plant and the 1 - 2 inches long pendant fruits can be completely variegated. The leaves and fruit are lined with creamy white and green, with the peppers eventually turning orange-red.  These chiles are still very much sought after by cooks.

peppers.name: CHINESE FIVE COLOR
peppers.description: A good edible ornamental pepper also known as Chinese Multi-Color. The dark  foliage provides an excellent backdrop to the 1-2" peppers upright conical pods which ripen from purple to cream to yellow to orange and finally to red. This plant produces peppers in abundance and all 5 colours (hence the name) are present on the plant at the same time making this a good choice if your looking to grow a beautiful potted plant.

peppers.name: FLAMINGO F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: Matures from a light yellow to pinkish-orange, then to red. A sweet bell pepper has concentrated fruit set and can produce high yields. Similar to Gypsy.  Mostly 3-lobed fruit are medium large, smooth and tapered. It has thick walls. Flamingo performs well in most pepper growing areas and its earliness makes it a stand-out in the northern U.S. and Canada. has earliness, good yield and resistance to Tobacco Mosaic Virus.

peppers.name: FLOR DE PABELLON
peppers.description: Translates into 'Flower of the Pavillion' A cultivated variety of Poblano

peppers.name: FLORAL GEM (PI 371871)
peppers.description: This sprawling plant produces small waxy yellow peppers which mature to orange/red approximately 65-75 days after transplanting. The peppers are known as 'Torrido' when picked and pickled at the immature stage. 1000 to 4000 scoville heat units (SHU)

peppers.name: JALAPENO FOOLED YOU F1
peppers.description: A hybridised Jalapeno variety with no heat although it  retains the essential flavour of a jalapeño.  These peppers look like normal jalapeños except they are a little larger at 3.25 inches long. The fruit is thick-walled and heavy, and like other jalapeños, is borne in profusion. This variety is perfect for making mild salsas or using in Mexican dishes served to children or others who do not tolerate spicy food.(65 days)

peppers.name: FRESNO
peppers.description:
Fresno peppers are similar in shape and heat to jalapeño peppers (5-700 SHU) and are grown extensively in California, Texas and New Mexico. This cold tolerant plant grow approximately 2-2.5 ft tall by 20 inches wide and are prolific beaers of upright arrow shaped 2-3 inch long by 1in wide peppers which mature from bright green to orange to a beautiful deep red . The peppers have a slight sweetness about them and are fantastic when used fresh for salsas.
Also known as Chile Carbide orChile Cera.

peppers.name: FRESNO SUPREME
peppers.description: Fresno Supreme is said to produce better quality, more uniform darker green fruits and slightly more pointed in shape compared to a normal Fresno. This variety is resistant to TMV. 4000-6000 SHU

peppers.name: FRIARS HAT
peppers.description: See Bishops Crown, Cambuci and Pimenta Cambuci

peppers.name: FUNTUA
peppers.description: The principle chile grow in Nigeria.

peppers.name: FUSHIMI
peppers.description: Fruits are slender and tapered, 6" long. The small thin-walled pepper is bright green and well flavored. Fushimi pepper is very popular for tempura and Japanese dishes. Very easy to grow and very prolific.

peppers.name: GALAXY F1 HYBRID (BELL)
peppers.description: Sweet/Bell Hybrid Blocky to semi elongated fruit.   Performs well, especially in cool areas. Sets fruit early (76 days)

peppers.name: GOURMET F1
peppers.description: An F1 hybridised bell pepper variety from Johnny's Seed. This early orange bell has thick juicy walls and a fruity sweet taste and is easy to grow under a wider variety of conditions.

peppers.name: GARDEN SALSA F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: An Anheim type hybrid from PETO. Used for salsa,roasting etc 2500 to 3500 scoville (73 days)  Chilli pepper Garden Salsa, great for the Mexican sauces and fresh salsa with just the right amount of heat, glossy green skin which turns red if left on the plant. Succulent skinny fruits with a heat rating of 3,000 Scoville. Best used when green for salsa. The best pepper for salsa and sauces. Fruits are quite smooth with medium thick walls tapering to a point. Fruits are 7 to 8 inches long by 1 inch wide. 73 days from transplants.

peppers.name: GARDEN SUNSHINE
peppers.description: An extremely productive bell pepper type. This plant produces creamy yellow coloured block fruits which mature from green to orange and then red approximately 80 days after transplanting

peppers.name: GATOR BELLE
peppers.description: A very productive large bell pepper variety. These medium tall plants produce 3 to 4 lobed bright green thick walled fruit which mature from green to red approximately 75 days after transplanting. Plants are tobacco mosaic virus (TMV) resistant.

peppers.name: GEORGESCU CHOCOLATE
peppers.description: A 4in long by 2in wide blocky sweet pepper which matures from green to a rich reddish brown. Nice tasting.

peppers.name: GEORGIA FLAME
peppers.description: A traditional moderately spicy pepper which produces a heavy crop of crunchy and tasty peppers, maturing from green to an iridescent flame red in 90 days. 1500 SHU .

peppers.name: GION RED
peppers.description: Ornamental. Dwalf 8in tall compact plant with fairly large sized conical fruits

peppers.name: GOAN
peppers.description: An indian variety that resembles a pointed casabel.

peppers.name: GOAT HORN
peppers.description: Cayenne type A warm pepper from Southeast Asia. Used to spice up Asian cuisine, and also grown as an Ornamental. The plants have a compact habitat. It is also possible to grow a Goat Horn as a perennial. Perhaps fairly unsurprisingly the pods are shaped like a 'goat horn'! Excellent. 2000 SHU

peppers.name: GOAT PEPPER
peppers.description: A mature pod is shown here. Description currently unavailable.

peppers.name: GOATS WEED
peppers.description: Goats weed is a long lived variety which overwinters well. The pods grow erect o the plant and ripen from green to black to a fluorescent red.. The flavour is savoury spice without being fruity. Its foliage is tight, and bears dark and mid olive green leaves with a pubescens-like silver fuzz on the stems and the under leaf. Its appearance is striking, particularly as the green, black and red fruit are present together all year round. Very heavy producer. Should grow up to four foot high, with a two foot width.

peppers.name: GOLD FINCH
peppers.description: Pale lemon yellow, large 4 3/4 in./12 cm blocky four lobed bell. Ripens light green/creamy yellow/pale lemon/red.

peppers.name: SWEET SPOT
peppers.description: First F1 hybrid 7 1/2 in./ 18.5 cm sweet banana with BLS 1, 2, 3 tolerance. Ripens lime yellow/yellow/red.. Very similar to Banana supreme.

peppers.name: GOLDEN IMPERATOR F1
peppers.description: This bright yellow maturing hybrid performs well in greenhouses and also in open fields. Golden Imperator has good resistance to "Stip" and has proven to be a very reliable producer

peppers.name: GOLDEN HEAT
peppers.description: Plants are small, well-branched with small leaves. Fruit set is heavy and concentrated. Fruits are slender, straight, about 5 inches x 0.6 inches, weighing about 11g (0.4 oz), green turning bright red at maturity. Flesh is thin and hot. Good for drying

peppers.name: GOLDEN GREEK PEPPERONCINI
peppers.description: This strain from Greece is somewhat rare and prized by those who want the peppers for pickling. Because they are smaller and lighter in color than the regular Pepperoncini, homemade jars of these golden peppers look more like the commercial product. Same thin-walled, slightly wrinkled shape, and mildly hot flavor as the other Pepperoncini, and the perfect addition to Greek salads. 62 days.

peppers.name: GOLDEN NUGGET
peppers.description: 1½' tall plant with purple stems, purple and white varigated leaves, and white and purple flowers with upright, 1" tall, conical fruits turning dark golden yellow; very attractive.

peppers.name: GOLDEN SUMMER BEAUTY
peppers.description: Thick walled bell pepper that mature to a rick gold colour after 70 days

peppers.name: GOLDEN SUMMER HYBRID (BELL)
peppers.description: A thick-walled 4 lobed bell peper type. The blocky golden fruit have a mild, sweet flavor and begin lime green before maturing to their final to golden yellow colour. TMV resistant. (65 days)

peppers.name: GOLDEN SUMMIT
peppers.description: This old Yugoslavian heirloom has been in cultivation for over 200 years!  The light green fruit turns a beautiful gold color, maturing to a bright, deep red in approximately 65 days.

peppers.name: GOLDEN TREASURE
peppers.description: This sweet Italian variety has medium thick flesh and thin skin. The long 8-9in two lobed fruits, 2in at the shoulder mature to a lovely yellow color (80 days).

peppers.name: GOLDFINGER
peppers.description: Small plant producing 5cm long tapering fruit that ripen from green to bright yellow. Fruity baccatum flavour. Very little heat at the bottom of the fruit, but the heat increases as you reach the seeds.

peppers.name: GOLDIE (BELL)
peppers.description:
Long bell shaped fruits of 8-12cm, and weighing up to 120g. Mature to red
from green via yellow and orange. Vigorous plants of upto 50cm in height.

peppers.name: GORMET F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: A hybridised F1 bell pepper variety. This early orange bell pepper has thick juicy walls and a fruity taste and matures from green to a very beautiful orange colour approximately only 65 days after transplanting.

peppers.name: JALAPENO GRANDE
peppers.description: This is a hybridised Jalapeno variety from PETO which features large 4in x 1.5in fruit which mature from dark green to red approximately 75-80 days after transplanting. The plant is very vigorous and produces well, even under stressful growing conditions. Approximately 4000 to 6000 scoville heat units (SHU)

peppers.name: JALAPENO GRANDPAS FAVOURITE F1
peppers.description: A miniture Jalapeno type from Cross Country Nurseries, the peppers are 2 to 2.25 inches long by 0.625 to 0.75 inches wide and matures from green to red. A good variety for making fresh salsa.

peppers.name: GRIF 15020
peppers.description: This wild Capsicum variety has been subject to much debate and has been reclassified as a variety of Capsicum Schottianum byA.T. Hunziker.

peppers.name: PI 639682
peppers.description: This wild variety is one of the worlds rarest peppers, found only in the Galapagos Islands. The plant is slender with distinctive hairy leaves (like Pubescent). The pods are very small, round and mature from green to red.

peppers.name: BUBBA (GRIF 9221)
peppers.description: This 6' tall plant is multi-branching and very prolific. The 3-5in pods ripen from green to orange and finally to red approximately 60 days after transplanting.  The plant displays green, orange and red on the pod a the same time. Pods are medium flesh with the typical fruity baccatum aroma and flavour.  The plant is also tolerant of cooler weather.

peppers.name: GRIF 9231
peppers.description: Reclassified from Chinense species in June 2005 by the USDA National Genetic Resources Program. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: GRIF 9232
peppers.description: Reclassified from Chinense species in June 2005 by the USDA National Genetic Resources Program. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: GRIF 9242
peppers.description: Reclassified from Chinense species in June 2005 by the USDA National Genetic Resources Program. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: GRIF 9283
peppers.description: Reclassified from Chinense species in March 2004 by the USDA National Genetic Resources Program. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: GRIF 9284
peppers.description: This variety is more accurately part of the species Capsicum annuum var. glabriusculum.

peppers.name: GRIF 9351
peppers.description: An immature pod is shown here. Description currently unavailable.

peppers.name: GRIF 9357
peppers.description: An Annuum version of this variety is also available. A more detailed  description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: GROVE PEPPER
peppers.description: This ornamental tabasco relative produces 1in long x 0.25in wide erect  pods which mature from yellowish green to red approximately 75 days after transplanting.

peppers.name: GUAJILLA DE ZIHUTENEJO
peppers.description: Pendent 4½x1¼" tapered oval red fruits on 2½' tall by 3' wide plants; excellent for drying.

peppers.name: GUAJILLO
peppers.description: Meaning 'little gourd' Guajillo is one of the hotter, large podded chile's and is extremely common in northern and central Mexico. The thin walled translucent pods are approximately 4in long by 1in wide and are a beautiful russet red in colour.  They have an erect habit and are used primarily in salsas and sauces. Medium sized chile to 4-7". Turns black when dried. Has a mild flavor along the lines of the Jalapeno. Seeds detatch from the placenta and rattle around inside the chile when dried. As such, it is occasionally used as a rattle These long peppers measure about 6" by 1 1/2" and have a sweet, medium-hot flavor. The guajillo is frequently used in Mexican cooking. Scoville units: 3,000.

peppers.name: COSTENO
peppers.description: This delicious chile comes from the Oaxaca region of Mexico. Related to the guajillo chile; also known as a chile bandeno. Orange-red in color, tapering to a point, and measuring about 2 to 3 inches long and 1/2 to 3/4 inch across at the shoulders. Thin to medium fleshed; has dusty, green, soapy flavors with apricot fruit tones and a fiery, intense, lingering heat. Used in mexico to give red colour to hot sauces.

peppers.name: GUAM BOONIES (DONIE SALI)
peppers.description: Donnie Sali is the  native/local name for the Guam Boonie (Donie = hot pepper and Sali = type of local bird that eats the pepper pods). A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: GUARDIAN (BELL)
peppers.description: Sweet/bell hybrid.Continuous set, TMV resistant. 74 days

peppers.name: GUINDILLA
peppers.description: Guindilla is elongated and curved, measuring 1,5 to 5 inches long and 0,25 to 0,5 inch wide. The green inmature pod has a mild pungency and green been flavor. As guindilla matures, it becomes more pungent. The red guindilla is medium-hot with a sweet flavour. In the Spanish Basque country, guindilla is served as a tapas or vegetable, fried with garlic in olive oil. The red guindilla is dried and used as a flavoring component in dishes such as dried cod al pil pil and gambas al pil pil.

peppers.name: GULBARGA
peppers.description:
Gulbarga A town in central south India which grows a particular chile which 
is sold (erroneously) as the Kashmiri chile. Consequently, it is called the 
Mock-Kashmiri. The Gulbarga, with its long thin wrinkled fleshy appearance 
does not remotely resemble the true Kashmiri, despite its nice crimson 
colour, neither does it have the flavour of the Kashmiri.

peppers.name: GUNTUR (ANDRA)
peppers.description: Named after the city Guntur, reputedly the chile capital of India. The pods are s about 5 cm long by 2 cm wide, with a sharp point. It has a good deep red colour when dried and resembles a dried red  jalapno. It is the chile most likely to be used as the major component in standard Indian chile powder..

peppers.name: GUNTUR SANNAM S4
peppers.description: Guntur Sannam S4 Grown in Guntur,Warangal and Khammam districts of Andhra Pradesh, India. Skin is thick. Pods mature to red and are hot.

peppers.name: GUYANA TRADEGY PEPPER
peppers.description: This pepper is roughly 3/4 inch by 3/4 inch. This is a Dynamite pepper that grows in abundance on a small bush like plant. One plant can produce up to 100 pods

peppers.name: GYPSY F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: Light yellow coloured sweet pepper type (60-65 days)  Fruits average 3 1/2 inches in length, are yellow and wedge shaped, eventually turning an orange-red. Plants are 20 inches tall with an 18 inch spread. Very early and very high yielding, does well in dry, hot conditions

peppers.name: HABANERO AMARILLO (PI 438535)
peppers.description: Fruit ovate, pungent, yellow, 1 cm wide, 2cm long.

peppers.name: HABANERO ANARANJADO (PI 438630)
peppers.description: Fruit pointed, pungent, orange 2.5cm diameter, 4cm long.

peppers.name: CAP 267
peppers.description:
Immature pod shown here. Very similar to Aji Cristal. A more detailed description is currently unavailable. 

Note: The CAP classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at a research institution in Germany.

peppers.name: HABANERO BROWN
peppers.description: This extra-large habanero is not only special for its size and productivity, it also ranks as one of the world's hottest peppers.  Expect an impressive harvest of these 2-1/2 inch long chocolate brown peppers, but handle with care as these fruit are searingly hot.  This is a beautiful and very tasty habanero for hot chile fans to add to their gardens. 85 days.

peppers.name: HABANERO CAPPUCCINO
peppers.description: This habanero variety is very similar to the Red Habanero, but the pods colour is darker. In the final immature stage the pods have a light brown colour similar to that of a cappuccino. Immature pods shown here.

peppers.name: CHOCOLATE HABANERO
peppers.description: The notorious & viciously hot Chocolate Habañero ranks among the deadly few at the top of the heat scale registering upto 450,000 scoville heat units. Indeed the Chile Pepper Institute of New Mexico State University reported that the Chocolate Habanero Chile was the hottest chile pepper they had tested. Also known as the 'Congo black' the fruits have a unique, rich flavor unduplicated by any other pepper. The 2" fruits ripen from an emerald green to a gorgeous, chocolate brown approximately 100 days after transplanting. The ultimate salsa pepper used to make the famous Jamaican Jerk Sauce. The variety is a must for heat lovers..

peppers.name: HABANERO CONDORS BEAK
peppers.description: Compact plants height 30cm spread 60cm, hot fruits ripen from purple to dark red (an unripe pod is shown here).

peppers.name: HABANERO DAVIE PEACH (PI 572560)
peppers.description: This 2 1/2 to 3ft white flowering plant produces good yields of rough skinned. 2in long fruits which start off light green before maturing to a light peach and then a dark peach colour  (hence the name). The fruits fully mature  approximately 100 days after transplanting. The pods  have a wonderful fruity flavour an searing heat.  United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) number PI 572560

peppers.name: HABANERO DUTCH F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: This hybidised variety is a cross between a Dutch chili (Annuum) and an Orange habanero (Chinense). A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: HABANERO GOLD BULLET ®TM
peppers.description:
Description currently unavailable.

Please note that Habanero Gold Bullet®TM is a Redwood City Seed Company, Redwood City, California USA is the owner of the Bullet trademarkand any seeds purchased MUST be for your own use.

peppers.name: HABANERO GOLDEN
peppers.description: Almost as hot as its notorious brother the Chocolate Habanero, this pepper is amongst the hottest in the world and is not for the faint hearted. This relatively large greeninsh white flowering 2 1/2ft plant produces high yields (up to 50)  2 ¼" long by 2" wide wrinkled peppers. The peppers mature from light green to a deep golden-orange approximately 100 days after seedlings emerge. The pungency will depend on local conditions and a sunny position is recommended. Care must be taken when handling these fire bombs. ## HIGHLY RECOMMENDED FOR HEAT LOVERS ##

peppers.name: HABANERO HAROLD ST BARTS
peppers.description: This nice Habanero variety produces heavy yields of 2"x1.5", wrinkled, very hot orange-yellow fruits with nice fruity-smoky aroma. Named after Harold Langlois who brought it back from a field trip to the Island of St. Barts.

peppers.name: HABANERO LITTLE FINGER
peppers.description: Chilli Pepper Habanero Little Finger.  C chinense. Red fruits growing to the size of little fingers approx 38mm x 15mm across, with a sweet hot flavour.

peppers.name: HABANERO LONG CHOCOLATE
peppers.description: A chinense from the Caribbean region. Produces very hot 5-8 cm long pods that ripen from green to dark brown.

peppers.name: HABANERO LUCIFERINO
peppers.description: Heavy fruiting plants height 60cm with orange fruits that hang under leaves making them easy to harvest.

peppers.name: TURRIALBA (GRIF 15853)
peppers.description: Piquin type. More detailed information is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: HABANERO MUSTARD
peppers.description: This is a rare habanero. Large plant (18-32") produce high yields of peach-colored fruits (95-100 days)

peppers.name: HABANERO ORANGE
peppers.description: Habanero Orange chiles are a little slower to germinate than many others, but this chile variety is worth the wait as it is 40 times hotter than a standard Jalapeno Pepper!  A producer of light green, thin, crinkled peppers which ripen to a brilliant orange-red coloration (85-95 days), each chile pepper is around 1½ inches long by about 1 inch across. This variety is dangerously hot and not for the faint hearted, tipping in at an eye watering 200,000 - 300,000 scoville heat units.

peppers.name: HABANERO PAPER LANTERN
peppers.description: This elongated Red Habanero type is renowned for its mouth-blistering heat. The plants are relatively compact & sprawling compared to other Habanero varieties and produce excellent ylelds of  3 in x 1 in pendant shaped fruits which ripen from lime green to a bright iridescent scarlet red approximately 90 days after transplanting.  The Paper Lantern is heavier yielding than other habanero's.

peppers.name: HABANERO PEACH
peppers.description: This is an ideal Habanero chili plant for in the house or on the office desk, compact 16-18" plants are absolutely loaded with peach-coloured fruits.

peppers.name: HABANERO RED
peppers.description: This original taste bud assasin is not for the faint hearted as it can reach a blistering 285,000 scoville units, which makes it one of the hottest chiles available, around 40 times hotter than the Jalapeno!  Habanero plants grow up to 36" tall and produce enormous amounts of lantern-shaped 1" by 1½" wrinkled pods.The pods of thie variety ripen from light green to an iridescent bright red (90-100 days). Not as lethally hot as as the Caribbean Red, but a worthy competitor!

peppers.name: HABANERO RED SAVINA TM
peppers.description: The Red Savina Habanero was reputed to be the worlds hottest Chile pepper weighs in at a whooping 577,000 Scoville Units!!! (thats before the Naga Morich/Dorset Naga came long).
