Its is also the first habanero to receive USDA plant-protection certificate.. At around 50 times as hot as a Jalapeno, it is one of the prime ingredients in the manufacture of the disabling Pepper spray used by Police forces around the world. Extreme caution must be taken when handling this pepper which has been known to blister sensitive skin. These firebombs grow on medium sized 2-3ft plants, with each plant producing up to 50 bright red coloured wrinkled fruits which reach maturity approx 100 days after transplanting.

peppers.name: HABANERO VENEZUELAN SWEET
peppers.description: These pods apparently have the fruity aroma of a Habanero combined with the sweet taste of a bell pepper. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: HABANERO WHITE
peppers.description: The White Habanero also know as 'Peruvian white Habanero' is a lovely & rare variety that is hard to come by and said to originate from Peru. These firey hot lantern shaped peppers grow on small, but very high yielding bushy pepper plants with the creamy-white colored pods measuring approximately 2 inches long by 3/4 of an inch in diamater. If you like seraing hot chiles, this could be the one for you as they have been rated at over 300,000 scoville heat units.

peppers.name: HABANERO WHITE BULLET ® TM
peppers.description: White Bullet ®TM is an extremely hot white habanero variety from the Caribbean. The fruits are only 1" long and 1/2" wide and some say they are even hotter than either Red Savina or Chocolate Habanero. Very high yielding, a single plant may produce hundreds of fruits which turn an ivory-white when fully mature after approximately 100 days. Definitely worth trying, especially if you happen to enjoy the delightful sensation of having the back of your head blown off.  Please note that White Bullet®TM is a Redwood City Seed Company, Redwood City, California USA is the owner of the Bullet trademarkand any seeds purchased MUST be for your own use.

peppers.name: HABANERO YELLOW POINTED
peppers.description:
The name of the variety is misleading since it is not a habanero.  
The pods are elongated (5 cm in length), yellow and somewhat fruity.
The flowers are greenish.

peppers.name: HAHONGS KACHO
peppers.description: A edible ornamental variety also called Rooster Spur, Takanotsume and Japanese Hot Claw. A profussion of small 1-2" bullet shaped fruit grow upright in clusters resembling claws (hence the name) and mature from green to bright red in approx 100 days. Highly recommended for use in Thai curries.

peppers.name: HANOI RED
peppers.description: Vietnamese market chili which is 3" in length and quite hot.

peppers.name: HANPYUL F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: A hybridised cayenne type pepper from Korea introduced in the early 1980s

peppers.name: HEALTHY
peppers.description: First introduced to US in 1993. Plants are about 2 feet tall and are covered with non bell shaped sweet 4in long fruit which  ripen from yellow to orange to red.

peppers.name: HEATWAVE
peppers.description: Chilli peppers that are excellent for those hot culinary delights, mixture can contain red, orange and yellow peppers. Ideally suited to greenhouse and conservatory growing.

peppers.name: JALAPENO HERCULES F1
peppers.description: A hybrid Jalapeno type noted for its unique fruit smoothness. Fruits the same diameter as a Jalapeno but longer and mature from a medium dark green to red. A vigorous plant.

peppers.name: HERSHEY
peppers.description: A hybridised F1 bell pepper variety. The 4 lobed  fruits starts out green on vigorous plants before ripening to a rich chocolate colour approximately 70 days after transplanting. Nice sweet flavour.

peppers.name: HI TOWER F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: Plant produces large 5in rectangular fruit which mature from green to red. TMV resistant.

peppers.name: HIDALGO
peppers.description: This hot versatile chile is from Mexico it is similar to Serrano in shape and just as hot. A 14 inch plant with 3 inch long and 1/2 inch diameter chiles. (Capsicum annuum).

peppers.name: HINKLE HATZ
peppers.description: A very old and rare Pennsylvania Dutch variety, that is the size and shape of chicken heart. The peppers are 1 inch long by 3/4 inch wide and usually mature to red, though sometimes yellow.

peppers.name: HOLIDAY CHEER
peppers.description: An ornamental variety very similar in appearence to 'Marbles'.The small round  upright pods change from purple to yellow to red on a bushy, well-branched plant

peppers.name: HONGILPOOM F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: A hybridised cayenne type pepper from Korea introduced in the early 1980s

peppers.name: HONGSIL F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: A hybridised cayenne type pepper from Korea introduced in the early 1980s

peppers.name: HORNET F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: 3-4 lobed sweet bell pepper which matures from green to red.

peppers.name: HOT LEMON
peppers.description: This is something very special! Hot Lemon produces 2.5inch long tapering chillies that ripen to a bright glossy yellow. The name doesn't come from the colour though - it comes from the wonderfully citrus-lemony aroma and taste. Great in any recipe where you want some extra fruity tang. Plants produce 2.5inch long tapering chiles that ripen to a bright glossy yellow.

peppers.name: HOT PIXIE
peppers.description: The Hot Pixie is an open pollinated Scotch Bonnet type pepper that reaches maturity approximately 90 days after sowing. The Hot Pixie has a lantern shape and colour's from lime green to orange/red. This chile can attain a length of 2 inches and has a pungent aroma which can be used for pickling . An easy to grow variety with high cropping yields.

peppers.name: HOT PORTUGAL
peppers.description: A Cayenne Type pepper which grows on a sturdy upright plant which produces heavy yields of glossy 8in long tapered red fruit  (65-75 days). Originally  developed by Joseph Harris & Co of Coldwater New York, circa 1935

peppers.name: HOT SUMMER
peppers.description: A hot hybridised Cayenne type pepper. Pepper approx 13-14 cm in length

peppers.name: HOT TREE PEPPER (PI 267729)
peppers.description: This medium sized vigorous, variety is late maturing; producing 3in long x 0.75in wide curved, glossy pods which mature from green to red.This variety is also listed as CAP 1033

peppers.name: HOTAZEL
peppers.description: An open pollinated Habanero type hot pepper. wrinkled fruits reach maturity in approximately 90-100 days

peppers.name: HSIAO YANG CHIAO (PI 419039)
peppers.description: Fruit long. Cold tolerant. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: HUACHINANGO
peppers.description: Found with white veins on the skin and red body. Tapers to a rounded end. About 4 to 5 inches long and 1 1/2 inches wide. Sweet with medium hot intensity. Are smoked and dried to make chipotle grande chiles. Fresh huachinango chiles are commonly used in stews, salsas and sauces.

peppers.name: HUASTECO
peppers.description: This upright plant can grow up to 3ft tall and produces Serrano type 2 to 2.5 inches long by 0.5 to 0.625 inches wide peppers which ripen from dark green to red approximately 80 to 85 days after transplanting. The pods have some pungency measuring around 2500 to 4000 scoville heat units (SHU)

peppers.name: HUNGARIAN BLACK
peppers.description: This is a very rare and unusual East European variety originating in the city of Kiskenfelegyhaza in modern day Hungary. This 2ft tall plant has brilliant purple foilage that produces edible and highly ornamental pendant shaped black peppers. The peppers reach maturity approximately 80 days after transplanting.

peppers.name: HUNGARIAN HOT WAX
peppers.description: The mid-hot Hungarian wax pepper is so named because it was developed in Hungary and it has a waxy color that resembles bees' wax. Strains that are totally mild are usually called banana peppers. The peppers are orange red when ripe, but most people pick them while still yellow, before they ripen. The peppers have thin walls and usually are used fresh in salads, but they also are pickled. This is a popular garden pepper and a reliable producer in cooler climates.

peppers.name: REBENTONA
peppers.description: The plant is about 50-70 cm tall when grown in 2.5 l pots and the leaves are dark green. The flower are erect, white/greenish with purple anthers.

peppers.name: HUNGARIAN YELLOW WAX
peppers.description: A medium-hot Old World favourite developed in Hungary. This pepper has a waxy color that resembles bees' wax. Wax peppers are actually orange-red when ripe, but are usually harvested while yellow.  The medium thick fruit mature from yellow to red in 67- 70 days. A perfect pick for pickled peppers. 750 to 3000 SHU.

peppers.name: UBATUBA CAMBUCI (PI 497974)
peppers.description: This variety has many names: Balloon, Pimenta Cambuci, Campane, Peri Peri,  Aji Flor, Orchid and Bishops Hat to name a few!! This very unusual pod shaped variety is believed to have been  transfered from South America to Europe by the Portuguese in the 18th century and is actually part of the species Capsicum baccatum var. pendulum.  The plants are quite large growing 3 to 4 ft tall and produce 30 to 50 extremely weird 3 or 4 flat winged, wrinkled almost flying saucer like 1 ½" wide pods. The flesh of each pod is thin athough crisp to taste and they mature from green to red approximately 90-100 days after seedlings have emerged. The body of the pods have some detectable heat, but the wings are sweet and mild.

peppers.name: GOSHOKU TOGARASHI (ICHIMI)
peppers.description: Name means "5 color hot pepper," small, delicate 18" plant produces numerous 1-1.5", upright, conical fruit; green>purple>cream>orange>red, very decorative when all colors can be seen

peppers.name: IDEAL F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: Yellow sweet pepper with 3-4 lobes. PVY and TMV resistant.

peppers.name: ILWOLGON GOCHU F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: A hybridised cayenne type pepper from Korea introduced in the early 1980s

peppers.name: INCA BERRY
peppers.description: This variety produces small oval shaped peppers which mature from white through to yellow and finally to red. Thick flesh

peppers.name: CGN 14202
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note: The CGN classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Wageningen, The Netherlands

peppers.name: INCA SURPRISE
peppers.description: 3 foot bush plant covered with tiny elongated peppers.

peppers.name: INCHANGA
peppers.description: A Cayenne type enlogated 4in hot peppers that that reaches maturity in approximately 90-100 day.  Developed by Prof Rob Melis of Pro-Seed at the University of KwaZulu Natal. Inchanga is named after an area just outside Durban.  This F1 is now widely sold in South Africa and is mainly used to make chili powder.

peppers.name: INFERNO FI HYBRID
peppers.description: This is an early producing Hungarian Wax hybrid which produce exceptionally good yields of 8in long x 1.5in wide smooth tapered pods that ripen from lime green through orange to red. These easy to grow peppers are sweet tasting with some heat and a good variety for pickling. 2500-4500 SHU (60-65 days)

peppers.name: INIA F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: Large blocky, thick walled pepper that turns from green to yellow at maturity.

peppers.name: ISLA COLON MILD
peppers.description: This variety produces erect 1½x3/4" blocky fruits with longitudinal wrinkles; plant 1' tall x 1½' wide; leaves long, pointed, wavy margins, dark green; fruits only mildly hot.

peppers.name: ISLANDER
peppers.description: A hybridised F1 bell pepper variety. This 3-lobed, medium-size, thick-fleshed peppers has a mild, lightly sweet taste. Fruits ripen through a showy stage of violet (56 days), yellow and orange streaks, eventually turning a rich, very dark red. (81 days)

peppers.name: ISLETA
peppers.description: From Isleta Pueblo, New Mexico.An exceptionally tasty chile with  broader shoulders and a  Mild-medium taste. Mature pods average 4-5 inches long

peppers.name: ITALIA
peppers.description: This Cubanelle/frying variety from Italy produces very sweet tasting 6 to 8 inches long by 1.5 to 2.5 inches wide pendant pods which mature from green to red. Lovely in Stir fries.

peppers.name: PEPPERONCINI
peppers.description: A classic wax type Italian pepper that is slightly wrinkled with a fine flavour for eating fresh or pickled. Pepperoncini plants produces abundant yields of long yellow-green 4in fruit which mature to red approximately 62-72 days after transplanting. Sometimes listed as a sweet pepper the fruit smell spicy but have a sweet, rich taste with mild heat and are either pickled or preserved in oil.

peppers.name: ITALIAN ROASTER
peppers.description: A hybridised Cayenne type variety. Expect loads of these long, thin green peppers with just the right amount of heat to spice up a meal. The 8 to 9 inch long fruit is about 3/4 inch wide at the shoulder with thin walls that make them perfect for grilling. Just char on two sides and they're ready to eat, seeds and all. You can harvest some as they turn red also. They are particularly good on top of a burger or other sandwich. Virus resistant, medium-large plants. 76 days.

peppers.name: IULOR F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: 3-4 lobed sweet pepper. TMV and PVY resistant.

peppers.name: JALAPENO IXTAPA
peppers.description: A hybridised jumbo fruiting Jalapeno variety named after the state of Ixtapa in Mexico where these chiles are grown. This vigourous plant produces good yields of large chiles which mature from dark green to red. They have good disease resistance, particularly to bacterial spot races 1,2 and 3 and have a scoville range or 4000-6000 units.

peppers.name: JALAPENO JALAPA F1
peppers.description:
Siad to be the first hybrid Jalapeno variety. This plant is said to produce an abundance of hot and flavourful cylindrical 3 x 1 1/4  in fruits that ripen from green to red approximately 65 days after transplanting.  Milder than Jalapeno M at around  4500 to 6000 scoville heat units, these plants are relatively compact are very vigorous and an excellent choice even in short season areas. 
Note:An immature pod is shown here.

peppers.name: JALAPENO
peppers.description: The Jalapeño is one of the best known peppers and is widely used in the catering industry given its excellent flavour. It is named after the city of Xalapa in Mexico, interestingly where they are no longer grown although they are still extensively grown throughout other regions in Mexico. In Mexico, Jalapenos are called Cuaresmenos. The standard Jalapeno produces 3" thick walled fruits which ripen from green to red.  They are usually eaten in the green stage, fresh or pickled, but when allowed to ripen, jalapeños are amazingly sweet. Used extensively in Mexico on nachos, the rest of the world on Pizza's and the US in pepper eating contests!  2500-10000 Scoville units.

peppers.name: CHOCOLATE BHUT JOLOKIA
peppers.description: This variety is closely linked to the 7 Pot/Pod and Trinidad Scorpion landrace varieties. It may or may not be a different variety.

peppers.name: JALAPENO EARLY
peppers.description: This is a standard Jalapeno pepper strain with some improvements to yield and a somewhat earlier crop. These bullet shaped peppers are produced in large numbers on a very vigorous 24 to 26 inch plant. The pods are approximately 3 1/2 inches long by 1 1/2 inches wide and begin there life as a very dark forest green colour, before maturing to a brilliant scarlet red in 65 to 75 days. The may be harvested when green or red and are used extensively in Mexican cooking either dried or fresh. 4000 to 6000 scoville units.

peppers.name: JALAPENO M (SANTIAGO)
peppers.description: Jalapeno M (also called Jalapeno Jumbo or Jalapeno Santiago) is the most popular chile variety grown in Mexico and is widely used in Tex-Mex cooking, as well as for pckling purposes. These dark green chiles mature to a fiery scarlet red color and grow up to 3 inches in length with a typical Jalapeno shape, but is slightly larger than the standard Jalapeno. Approximately 3500 to 6000 scoville units. Very similar (if not the same as) Jalapeno Grande.

peppers.name: JALAPENO PURPLE
peppers.description: The Purple Jalapeno is a beautiful, ornamental version of the standard Jalapeno pepper. The plants are very productive with a single plant producing upto 50 pods which begin as a brilliant emerald green, then mature to a stunning dark purple and finally to a fabulous scarlet red!  As the plants often have chiles on them of varying ages, all three colors are often seen on a single plant which produces a most wonderful and most beautiful color effect! Though Purple Jalapenos may be beautiful, don't let their brilliant colours fool you as this variety rates at a respecatable 6000 scoville heat units which is twice as hot as a standard Jalapeno.

peppers.name: JALAPENO TELICA
peppers.description: This is believed to be one of the larger varieties of Jalapeno. Plants are said to  grow 60cm high and bears bullet shaped fruits up to 7.5cm long. It can be harvested green or allowed to mature to red. The fruits develop a characteristic "corking", a pattern of crack markings on the skin as it reaches full size. Heat level is around 6000-8000 scoville units.

peppers.name: JALAPENO YELLOW
peppers.description: Pendent 1½x1' typical Jalapeno-type fruits that mature to deep orange with a light red blush; plants 1½' tall x 1' wide; very attractive in pickled peppers.

peppers.name: JALAPENO JALORO F1
peppers.description: A hybridised Jalapeno variety. This is the first yellow jalapeno pepper developed, from the Texas Agricultural Extension Service. Fruit is a beautiful golden yellow before turning orange then red, making for a beautiful show on the compact plants. Peppers are just as hot as regular jalapenos. As a bonus, plants are resistant to six viruses that threaten peppers. 70 days.

peppers.name: JAMAICAN HOT CHOCOLATE
peppers.description: These shiny, habanero-type peppers are deep chocolate-brown when ripe and ribbed or wrinkled, resembling large dates or prunes. Fruits are 1-1/2 to 2 inches long and with a very hot Caribbean flavour that is strong and smoky. Those in the know say that Jamaican Hot Chocolate makes a great hot sauce. This strain originated from a pepper found in a market in Port Antonio, Jamaica. 85 days.

peppers.name: TRUE JAMAICAN SCOTCH BONNET
peppers.description: A very compact, densely foliaged plants bear an abundance of bright yellow or red, thin-skinned hot peppers that are shaped like a tam o' shanter. Actually a type of squash pepper. Interesting shape and spicy taste make this pepper good to eat fresh, pickle, or use as a garnish. 95 days.

peppers.name: JAMAICAN RED HOT
peppers.description: A Scotch bonnet type which many say is hotter than a normal Habanero. A 2ft tall plant can produce in excess of fifty 2 x 1.5 inch very pungent wrinkled fruits which mature from a lime green to a dark rich red. The pods have a very distinctive fruity flavour of apples, apricots and a hint of citrus all rolled into one and are a firm favourite in the Caribbean for the famous hot sauces. Approximately 150,000 scoville heat units.

peppers.name: JAP CHOT
peppers.description: 6-8 cm long by 0.5 cm wide pods mature from green to red. Mild but tasty.

peppers.name: JAPONES
peppers.description: Japones is  the principal pepper used in Szechwan dishes. The  5cm long red fruits are produced in large clusters on 60-75cm tall plants. Asie for chinese cusine, they are also a great addition to a chile con carne or crushed into a red chile sauce.

peppers.name: JEMEZ
peppers.description: From Jemez Pueblo in northern New Mexico a village at 6,000ft above sea level!. This is said to be an early maturing varietyMild to medium-hot. 4-4½ inch long pods at maturity.

peppers.name: JIGSAW
peppers.description: Small upward pointing peppers on compact plants with variegated leaves. Note: An immature pod is shown here.

peppers.name: JIMMY NARDELLO
peppers.description: This legendary Italian heirloom was introduced to the U.S. by Guiseppe Nardello in 1887.  A favorite from the southern part of Italy, these productive 2ft plants can yield upto a dozen peppers. Although technically a frying pepper, this is one of the sweetest non-bell peppers you'll ever taste. Bright red, 6 to 7 inch long peppers are only about 1 in. wide, and taper from the shoulder to tip, with a curving, somewhat wrinkled appearance. They are great for adding to salads or cooking into stir-fries. No matter if you use it fresh or cooked, its flavour remains very sweet. Expect large yields. 80 days.

peppers.name: JINGLE BELLS
peppers.description: A F1 hybridised baby bell type pepper. This 18in tall plants produce minature 2in square shaped bell peppers with mature from green to bright red approximately 55-70 days after transplanting

peppers.name: JINPOOM F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: A hybridised cayenne type pepper from Korea introduced in the early 1980s

peppers.name: JUPITER
peppers.description: Released in 1985, this 4 lobed, blocky fruit is up to 20% larger than most popular varieties. the peppers have thick walls and when fully ripened, turn bright red (72-75 days).This uniform plant also offers good disease resistance.

peppers.name: JWALA
peppers.description: Jwala is a very popular moderately hot pepper grown and used in various spicy foods in India. If you are a curry fan, then the Jwala is your pepper of choice! The umbrella type plant produces lots of fruits starting green and maturing to a red ripe. The matured red pepper has good pungency. This variety is easy to grow and produces great results.

peppers.name: KAALA SWEET
peppers.description: A sweet Bell pepper from the University of Hawaii.

peppers.name: HARI MIRCH
peppers.description: Hindi term for hot chiles in Northern India. 'Lal Mirch' is red chile, 'Hari Mirch' is green chile. Kashmiri chiles are known as 'Degi mirch'.

peppers.name: KALEIDOSKOP (CAP 1477)
peppers.description: Immature pod shown here. Description currently unavailable.

peppers.name: KALIA
peppers.description: Deep red, short, with smooth skin. Pointed tip.

peppers.name: KALOCSAI M
peppers.description: Named after the famous Hungarian paprika city of Kalocs. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: KALOCSAI PAPRIKA
peppers.description: Named after the famous Hungarian paprika city of Kalocs. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: KALOCSAI V2
peppers.description: Named after the famous Hungarian paprika city of Kalocs. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: KARLO
peppers.description: Matures from light green to red. The fruit shape is cylindrical and with a rounded tip. Karlo chiles are appreciated fot their full-bodied aroma and mild heat. Can be used roasted and peeled in salsas, salads, sauces, chutneys, and casseroles.

peppers.name: KARMA F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: A sweet bell variety. These large 30in plants produce an abundance of  6 by 4 inch four lobed peppers with thick walls and bright red skins.The peppers mature form dark green to an intense red colour approximately 68 days after transplanting. TMV resistant.

peppers.name: KARPITAI HYBRID
peppers.description: Hungarian yellow wax type. 4 to 6in fruit (52 days)

peppers.name: KASHMIRI (DEGHI MIRCH)
peppers.description: Originally a variety grown in Kashmir India, it is now a generic term for any medium long dried red chile. 'Deghi Mirch' is also a mild  flavored red chili powder used extensively in Indian Cusine for its colouring properties.. It is more sweet than hot.  'Guajillo' is an appropriate substitute.

peppers.name: KELLU UCHU
peppers.description: Also called Aji Amarillo, this is one of the most common Peruvian Aji's. The pods grow to around 4.5in long  x 2.25in wide and mature from green to a bright yellow.

peppers.name: KERINTING
peppers.description: An extremely long thin Cayenne yype which looks very similar to Whippets Tail. The name in Malay is believed to means 'curly hair'.

peppers.name: KEYSTONE GIANT
peppers.description: A bell pepper type. These vigorous 30 inch plants produce a heavy yiled of big, blocky, thick skinned 5 inch fruits. 74 days

peppers.name: KING ARTHUR
peppers.description: A hybridised F1 bellpepper variety. This high yielding variety produces large 4 lobed 4in bell peppers which have good disease resistance. They are quite sweet to taste and ripen approximately 74 days after transplanting

peppers.name: KING OF THE NORTH
peppers.description: A sweet bell pepper type. This 3 lobed mild tasting peppers can grow up to 6in long by 4in wide, are thick walled, blocky and are great for stuffing. The peppers ripen from green to red and can be used at either color. It has no heat and only requires 65-70 days to bear fruit.

peppers.name: KLARI BABY CHEESE
peppers.description: These are called a Klari cheese peppers after the women who maintained this heirloom variety and the peppers resemblance to an old fashioned wheel of cheese.  The peppers are very ornamental as they ripen from white to yellow to red on the plant all at the same  These thick walled peppers are very sweet and are often  eaten just like an apple, hence its alternative name, the "Golden Delicious Apple Pepper". 65 days from transplant.

peppers.name: KOCHU
peppers.description: A cayenne type chile from Korea

peppers.name: KOREAGON GOCHU F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: A hybridised cayenne type pepper from Korea introduced in the early 1980s

peppers.name: KOREAN YELLOW
peppers.description: Korean heirloom. This variety produce 2x1/3" orange-yellow, smooth, erect fruits born in clusters on 2' tall x 1½' wide plants.

peppers.name: KOREAN HOT
peppers.description: If you only had room for one chilli plant, you should have this one, it is ideal for using fresh, dried or in powder form.  Has a great taste and a decent heat Level. 4 to 5 inches long, a great looking all rounder.

peppers.name: KORI SITAKAME
peppers.description: Meaning "Red chile". This variety is from Norogachi, a Tarahumara pueblo in highland Chihuahua, Mexico. Relatively thin-walled and smooth-skinned triangular fruit. Looks almost translucent when dry. Medium to hot, increasing after a few seconds. 3½ inch pods when mature.

peppers.name: KOVINCHU (PI 260585)
peppers.description: These thin walled long slender pods grow typically to around 4in long. They mature from green to red.

peppers.name: KRAKATOA
peppers.description: An F1 hybridised Cayenne Type medium sized plant that produces hot long slender peppers 14-18cm long that ripen from green to red.

peppers.name: KRIMSON
peppers.description: This medium sized bushy plantproduces good yields of  6-8" x 2", thick-fleshed paprika type peppers which are sweet and spicy to taste. The fruits ripen to green (62 days) and then to red (82 days). A good variety for roasting and grilling, salsa, and for adventurous salads.

peppers.name: KULAI
peppers.description: A cayeene like chile grown in Malaysia

peppers.name: KUNG PAO
peppers.description: These large, fast growing 3ft tall plants are loaded with skinny 6-9" long thin walled cayenne type pepper which  mature from green to a dark rich red in 85 days. At around 10000 scoville heat units, they are often used to spicy up Thai, Szechuan and other Southeast Asian dishes.

peppers.name: KUNJA
peppers.description: 4x½" smooth, pendent red fruits on 1½x1½' plants.

peppers.name: LA ROUGE ROYALE
peppers.description: A 5-7in sweet blocky bell pepper which matures from green to red

peppers.name: LABRADOR
peppers.description: A hybridised F1 bell pepper variety. These medium/large sweet peppers ripen from green to yellow in approximately 80 days. A compact plant that holds well in the garden.

peppers.name: LADA
peppers.description: Mayan local name for Capsicum annuum

peppers.name: LADY BELL F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: Prolific 4-5in sweet block pepper which matures from green to red

peppers.name: LAFAYETTE
peppers.description: These huge blocky 4 lobed bell  peppers are delicious, but when they ripen to bright yellow they become wonderfully sweet while still staying crisp. It is sometimes a challenge for yellow peppers to retain their firmness, but Lafayette does. Plants are compact and are resistant to 3 races of bacterial leaf spot.

peppers.name: LAL MIRCH
peppers.description: Hindi term for hot chiles in Northern India. 'Lal Mirch' is red chile, 'Hari Mirch' is green chile. Kashmiri chiles are known as 'Degi mirch'.

peppers.name: LAMUYO
peppers.description: These attractive vigorous plants produce  3 or 4 lobed elongated bell shaped peppers which grow typically to 6 to 7 inches long and about 3-1/2 inches across. The pods ripen from a deep green to glossy red in approximately 75 days and have a nice sweet taste. A very forgiving and easy variety to grow at home.

peppers.name: LANTERN
peppers.description: A hybridised bell pepper variety is not to be confused with the notorious Paper Lantern. These beautiful, big bell peppers are about 5 inches long and 4-1/2 inches wide, and heavy with thick walls. They are mostly 4-lobed and begin as dark green, maturing to a lovely rich red approximately 75 days after transplanting. The fruit is sweet tasting, very uniform and produced in good abundance.

peppers.name: LAOTIAN
peppers.description: 1-2in long peppers which grow upright on plant

peppers.name: LAUNGI
peppers.description: Deep red peppers to 2" long, intensely hot. One of the hottest varieties from India, used extensively for fiery curries, sauces, etc

peppers.name: LEMME'S ITALIAN SWEET
peppers.description: A heirloom Italianfrying-type pepper. The peppers measure approximately 5-7in in length and are slightly fatter and shorter than 'Jimmy Nardello'. They mature from green to crimson approximately 75 days after transplanting.

peppers.name: LILAC LAVENDER BELL
peppers.description: This plant produces good yields of 3 to 4-lobed blocky bell peppers, measuring 4-1/2 inches long and 3-1/2 inches wide. The peppers mature from ivory to lavender and finally to crimson (70 days), but they remain in the lavender stage longer than other purple peppers. Their thick flesh has a mild, sweet flavour.

peppers.name: LIMON
peppers.description: A yellow 'Lemon Drop' pepper. 1.5-2 in fruits are wrinkled and taper at both ends. Very Prolific. 2ft plant short season

peppers.name: LIPSTICK
peppers.description: This is a very early, meaty red conical pepper. The 3-4in peppers taper to a blunt point and mature from green to a deep red approximately 75 days after transplanting.

peppers.name: LISAS PEQUIN
peppers.description: A bird pepper. Plants produce hundreds of small upright green,orange and red fruits

peppers.name: LITTLE DICKENS
peppers.description: This very attractive compact variety produces good yields of 2.5 to 3.5 in long by 0.75 to 1.25 in wide conical pods which grow erect on the plant. The pods  mature from green to bright orange and are sweet tasting.

peppers.name: LITTLE DIPPER HYBRID
peppers.description: A miniture sweet bell pepper with1-2in long red & green peppers (60 days)

peppers.name: LITTLE ELF
peppers.description: A Pequin type variety.  This plant has small, dark green leaves which provide a striking backdrop for masses of peppers that begin as yellow tinged with purple, then turn orange and finally red (90 days). The tiny fruit is no bigger than 1/2 to 3/4 inch long and appears in clusters, with all colours on the plant at the same time. Plants grow only about 16 inches tall with a similar spread, so they are great for borders as well as container growing. Coluorful and petite, this ornamental pepper is quite charming.

peppers.name: LITTLE NUBIAN
peppers.description: Also known as the Jamacian Sore Throat pepper

peppers.name: LOCOTO (PI 260485)
peppers.description: Bolivian name for the Rocoto pepper

peppers.name: LOMBAK
peppers.description: Lombak' is the Indonesian name for Chile peppers. These 5-6in long cayenne type fruits make an excellent hot drying pepper with a great taste and rich colour. The top two thirds of the pepper is medium hot, the bottom one third is sweet and may be eaten like a sweet pepper. The pods mature from green to red approximately 85 days after transplanting.

peppers.name: LOMBAK MERAK
peppers.description: Used in the making of Sambel Oelek

peppers.name: LOMBAK RAWIT
peppers.description: A very small but hot pepper used in the making of Sambel Oelek

peppers.name: LOMBARDO
peppers.description: A cayenne type sweet pepper variety. Pod length 15 cm x 2 cm wide and mature from green to red .

peppers.name: LONG GREEN BUDDA
peppers.description: Sweet peppers grow on a compact bushy 2 ft plant (70 days)

peppers.name: REVOLUTION
peppers.description: This bell pepper variety that produces a concentrated set and good yields even in cool weather.  Extra-large blocky thick-walled peppers are four-lobed, about 4-1/2 inches long and wide, with firm, thick flesh turning from green to an eventual brilliant red (72 days).  Resistant to phytophthora, four races of bacterial leaf spot, and cucumber mosaic virus.

peppers.name: THAI LONG
peppers.description: This chilli produces long, thick, well fleshed chillies with good heat. Very good frying chilli sliced lengthwise and added to stirfries. Prefers ample moisture, but doesn't like being waterlogged. Feed fortnightly with a dilute organic tomato feed once flowering has started.

peppers.name: LORELEI (BELL)
peppers.description: Green bell pepper which matures to purple then red

peppers.name: LOUISIANA SPORT PEPPER
peppers.description: This  pepper is popular in America for its use as a pickled pepper to go on hot dogs and other sandwiches.  It is especially well known as an essential condiment in a Chicago-style hot dog.  Peppers resemble Tabasco peppers, but the Sport pepper is larger, about 1-1/2 inches long and 1/2 inch wide.  They are medium-hot and produced in great abundance on sturdy plants.  75 days.

peppers.name: LUCIFERS DREAM
peppers.description: Looks very muchl like Peter Pepper. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: LUTEUS F1 HYBRID (BELL)
peppers.description: Bell peppers mature from green to yellow

peppers.name: MACHO
peppers.description: Another name for Piquin/tepin type chiles from the Oaxaca region of Mexico.

peppers.name: MACIO F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: Red sweet pepper. 3-4 lobes. TMV resistant.

peppers.name: MADAME JEANETTE (SURINAM RED)
peppers.description: Apparently named after a famed Brazilian prostitute, this Habanero variant is grown on the Islands of Surinam and Aruba. The pods are shaped like small Bell peppers but with blistering Habanero heat. Said to be very prolific. Also known as Surinam Red.

peppers.name: MAESTRO
peppers.description:
A large Enza early 4 lobed sweet bell pepper with good disease resistance (66 days) Early summer fruiting hybrid.
Thick walled and red at maturity.

peppers.name: MAITE
peppers.description: A large early Enza block sweet pepper hybrid (66 days)

peppers.name: MAKUSARE
peppers.description: Resembles a mini Scotch Bonnet. Bright yellow when ripe

peppers.name: CHILTEPIN
peppers.description: A wild variety of piquins also called bird peppers, wild bird peppers and birdseye peppers, usually round in shape.  There are many local variants of this pepper.

peppers.name: MALAGUETA (PI 497984)
peppers.description: Semi wild relative to the Tabasco. This native of Brazil produces a bushy, dense plant with very small upright peppers, measuring less than an inch in length. These peppers have wrinkled skins and searing heat and ripen from light green to Red (120 days). Although this was once popular in England in Elizabethian times through trade with Portugal, this variety is now rare outside of South America. Their is some debate amongst as to whether this variety is actually part of the Baccatum var pendulum species.

peppers.name: MALAYSIAN CHILI
peppers.description: 3in conical slender fruit. Standard chile variety in Malaysia

peppers.name: MALIBU PURPLE
peppers.description: 1/2in  small rounded peppers that ripen to flame red. Compact plant

peppers.name: MANDARIN FI HYBRID (BELL)
peppers.description: A sweet/bell hybrid. The distinctly sweet 5 to 6in elongated fruits mature from green to deep pumpkin orange coloured in appromimately 75 days

peppers.name: MANESRU (PI 123470)
peppers.description: Fruit pointed, 2 to 3in long by 1in broad; red, hot

peppers.name: MANZANO AMARILLO
peppers.description: Manzano means 'apple' which describes the appearence of the fruits - like small apples. Like its cousin the Rocoto, this variety has unusual black seeds which are very hard (like apple pips) and should be removed before eating. Manzano comes generally in three types, Amarillo, Rojo (Red) and Canario (Yellow). Also known as 'Caballo' in Guatemala.

peppers.name: MANZANO CANARIO
peppers.description: Manzano means 'apple' which describes the appearence of the fruits - like small apples. Like its cousin the Rocoto, this variety has unusual black seeds which are very hard (like apple pips) and should be removed before eating. Manzano comes generally in three types, Amarillo, Rojo (Red) and Canario (Yellow). Also known as 'Caballo' in Guatemala. An immature pod is shown here.

peppers.name: MANZANO ROJO
peppers.description: Manzano means 'apple' which describes the appearence of the fruits - like small apples. Like its cousin the Rocoto, this variety has unusual black seeds which are very hard (like apple pips) and should be removed before eating. Manzano comes generally in three types, Amarillo, Rojo (Red) and Canario (Yellow). Also known as 'Caballo' in Guatemala.

peppers.name: MARABA (PI 497977)
peppers.description: This variety produces hundreds of .75x.33" smooth, blunt-tipped, pencil-shaped fruits on 2' bush with very dark green leaves; fruits yellow with purple suffusion; another excellent miniature habanaro variety.

peppers.name: MARBLES
peppers.description: Marbles is a beautiful edible ornamental pepper created by Oregon State University. This compact 12 to 18 inch plants become densely covered with fruit and are very decorative producing marble-sized peppers which grow erect on the plant. The pods turn a collection of colours, first yellow, then purple, orange, and finally maturing to a flame red approximately 55 to 65 days after transplanting.

peppers.name: MARCONI GIANT
peppers.description: A hybridised F1 variety, which resulted from a cross between Marconi and  Lamuyo. These  8in tapered red peppers have a  sweet smoky flavour (63 days)

peppers.name: MARCONI GOLDEN
peppers.description: These are the traditional Italian sweet peppers. They turn green to yellow, and either color is tasty. Peppers grow to about a foot long by 3" wide, and in addition to being extremely flavorful when fresh, these peppers are particularly good fried or roasted, something done quite frequently in Italy. (90 days)

peppers.name: MARCONI PURPLE
peppers.description:
These deliciously sweet Italian peppers turn from green to a rich shade of purple when they ripen, adding a beautiful new color choice to the range of Marconi peppers. Expect plentiful harvests of these peppers, which become about 6-in. long with a tapered shape ending in a blunt tip. Traditionally used for frying, Marconis are also wonderful when eaten fresh. 
6-8in fruit. Matures from green to purple/black

peppers.name: MARCONI RED (ROSSO)
peppers.description: A very large two lobed sweet pepper. The thick walled elongated blocky peppers grow up to 7" long and have a crisp, super sweet flavour. They mature from green to a bright red on the plant in 70-90 days and are ideal for stuffing, roasting and salad toppings. Medium harvests can be expected from the Marconi plants which can reach 30 inches high.

peppers.name: MAREKO FANA
peppers.description: A thin pale green corkscrew shaped Cayenne type from Ethiopia

peppers.name: MILORD
peppers.description: A bell pepper variety. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: MARTINDALE III (BELL)
peppers.description: A Stokes seed variety. This bell pepper ripens to dark red (72 days)

peppers.name: MARTINIQUE
peppers.description: A Scotch Bonnet Type from the Island of Martinique

peppers.name: MARTINS CARROT
peppers.description: This is very rare and old heirloom hot pepper introduced and developed by the 17th century horticulturist Jacob B. Garber (1800-1886) of Lancaster County, USA. It is a smooth podded relative of the Jalapeno. 3 to 3 1/2 inch pods which really do look like small carrots grow on a 2 1/2 ft tall bushy plant and ripen to a deep oranage colour. Mildly pungency..

peppers.name: MAVRAS
peppers.description: A hybridised F1 bel lpepper variety.These large blocky, four lobed fruit have thick walls and is superior in many peoples eyes to other purple sweet bell competitors.  The unripe fruit is a shiny purple colouring and then ripens into dark red. High yielding and Tm2 resistant.

peppers.name: MAXI JALA
peppers.description: A hybridised 'heavy weight' Jalapeno variety, the Maxi-Jala has a length of 9 cm, a diameter of 3.5 cm and a weight of 45g. The fruit shape of Maxi-Jala is conical with thick walls and is a strong vigorous plant with very good cover. The pods mature from green to red and are ideal for stuffing, pickling, salads, pureeing, salsas and roasting

peppers.name: MAYATA
peppers.description: These strong, sturdy plants have excellent fruit sets delivering good yields of atttractive, elongated bell peppers which start out green before ripening to  a brilliant red colour (75 days). The gourmet quality peppers are about 6 inches long with 3 to 4 lobes, medium thick flesh, and have a sweet flavour.

peppers.name: JALAPENO AGRISET 4002
peppers.description: A hybridised prolific Jalapeno variety which is slightly larger than the Agriset 4001. Agriset 4002 jalapeno features thick walls, good cover, good heat, and dark green fruits.

peppers.name: MEDUSA
peppers.description: A stunning ornamental plant with a 'chile hairdo' to rival the ledendary Medusa of Greek mythology. This 8in tall compact plant can produce upto 100 small 2in upright fruits which mature from Ivory to Yellow to Orange and finally to Red. The plant should be in full sun to obtain the best colours on the fruits. The fruits are edible although non pungent making it an excellent choice if you have hungry young children. Approx 100 days to maturation

peppers.name: MERAH
peppers.description: Sometimes mislabed as a Frutescens, a more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: MERAKAI (PI 124078)
peppers.description: Fruit short, 1.5in by 2in, red and hot

peppers.name: MERCED TMR (BELL)
peppers.description: A variety from Ferry Morse that has been used by growers for a red harvest. 4 lobed (75 days)

peppers.name: MERLIN
peppers.description: Sweet/bell hybrid. Early season blocky sweet bell pepper (68 days). A larger version of North Star

peppers.name: MESILLA
peppers.description: A hybridised Cayenne type pepper which is sometimes seen in grocery stores labeled 'finger-hots' , these slightly curved and wrinkled, 10 inches long and 1.5 inches wide peppers matre from green to red (85 days). The are  borne in abundance on large 3 to 4ft plants which are very easy to graw and have good disease resistance. 2000-4000 scoville heat units.

peppers.name: MULATO
peppers.description: [moo-LAH-toh].When dry the pepper is very dark brown, almost black, in colour (due to the chlorophyll remaining in the ripe fruit). It is an important chile in Mexican cooking, along with the Ancho and Pasilla chiles. The Mulato is 10-15 cm long and 5-7.5 cm wide. It is the smoky, licorice, aromatic flavour, as well as its chocolate-black colour which gives it its appeal.

peppers.name: MI-2
peppers.description: A cayenne type from Sri Lanka

peppers.name: MIRASOL
peppers.description: Mirasol means 'looking at the sun' in Spanish and describes the erect nature of the pods which grow on a compact plant. The pods are 3 to 5in in length and can be used  both fresh and dry. Conical in shape and medium hot measuring  about 5,000 scoville heat units, these peppers have a unique flavor with a hint of fruitiness.

peppers.name: MISHME (PI 315029)
peppers.description: Also listed as CGN 22789. Description currently unavailable. Note: The CGN classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Wageningen, The Netherlands

peppers.name: MISQUCHO COLORADO (PI 152225)
peppers.description: Found to be resistant to tomato spotted wilt tospovirus (TSWV) by S.A. Aleixandre, Universidad Politecnica de Valencia. A mre detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: MISSION BELLE (BELL)
peppers.description: Green maturing to red bell pepper

peppers.name: JALAPENO MITLA
peppers.description: An F1 hybridised early Jalapeno M type that produces exceptional yields of very uniform large fruit. This large upright plant produces continuous sets of 3in long bullet shaped fruits which mature from green to red (65 days). Approximately  4000 to 6000 scoville heat units (SHU)

peppers.name: JALAPENO MITSI LEA F1
peppers.description: This is a hybridised Jalapeno variety that produces  3 to 4 in long by 1.25 to 1.5 in wide peppers which mature from green to red. Used in Chipotles, Fresh Salsas and Mexican Cuisine

peppers.name: MOHAWK
peppers.description: A sister to the well known Redskin. Mohawk is a small bell pepper variety which possesses a compact habit ideal for patio pots and containers. Very early to mature, producing good yields of 4 to 5in orange coloured bell-shaped fruits. Great for display or cooking, very early and high yielding, a good all rounder.

peppers.name: MOMBASA
peppers.description: The principle chile variety cultivated in Uganda. See African Birds Eye

peppers.name: MONALISA (BELL)
peppers.description: 4 lobed sweet pepper which matures to red

peppers.name: MONZETTA SARDA
peppers.description: The name translates roughly into 'Sardinia Snail'.The pods mature from green to red

peppers.name: MORA
peppers.description: Like the chipotle, the mora is a type of dried, smoked jalapeño. Reddish brown in color, tapered and wrinkled, and measuring about 2 inches long and 1/2 to 3/4 inch across. Mora has a sweet smoke flavor with strong tobacco and raisin tones. Mora is wonderful with rot vegetables, game, beef, pork, poultry and fish, and even fruits like pears, apples and peches. Also called Morita and varieties include 'Americano' and 'Rayada Grande'

peppers.name: MORITA
peppers.description: These small, brown, dried chiles look like thin chipotles but are less smoky with a spicier taste. They are a variety of dried, smoked jalapeño. Use fewer moritas to replace chipotles in a recipe.

peppers.name: MORRON (PI 257284)
peppers.description: This plant originates from Spain and produces elongated pods that ripen from green to dark brown. An iImmature pod is shown here.

peppers.name: MOUSE HEART
peppers.description: Mature pod shown here. Description currently unavailable.

peppers.name: MOZAMBIQUE (XAI XAI)
peppers.description: Named after the small Mozambique town of Xai-Xai, situated on the Limpopo river, this variety is said to be as hot as a Tabasco around 60000 SHU

peppers.name: JALAPENO MUCHO NACHO
peppers.description: This is a hybridised jumbo jalapeno variety that issaid to be not only longer than the standard jalapeno, but also wider, heavier, and with hotter fruits. The plants are said to be very vigorous and excellent producers of 4 inch long peppers which ripen from green to red approximately 75 days after transplanting .

peppers.name: MULATO ISLEÑO
peppers.description: The Mulatos are similar in shape to Ancho but somewhat longer and flatter and sweeter in taste.  The 4 to 6 inches long, 3 inches wide blunt-ended pods start off glossy green before ripening to  to a dark chocolate brown colour called 'achocolatado' after 85-95 days They hang pendant fashion from large-leafed 2 1/2 foot plants.  These thick fleshed chiles can be used at either stage. They are sweeter and a little more pungent than Ancho chiles.

peppers.name: MURCH (PI 135822)
peppers.description: Fruit bullnosed, flattened, 1 by 3/4in, red, and mildly hot

peppers.name: MUSHROOM RED
peppers.description: Also called squash or Cheese pepper. An heirloom chilli pepper thought to be a spicy ancestor of today's bell peppers. Exceptional taste - a unique blend of spice and fruitiness, one which is well worth trying. The Chiles are golf ball sized and resemble a green or red mushroom hanging upside-down from the plant. These sturdy plants produce chiles over a long period.

peppers.name: MUSHROOM YELLOW
peppers.description: Chiies are golf-ball sized and resemble a green or red mushroom hanging upside-down from the plant.

peppers.name: MUTA
peppers.description: Serrano type but much hotter nad not as wrinkled or seedy

peppers.name: NAGA JOLOKIA (TEZPUR) PC-1
peppers.description: The real deal is a Chinense, but there are also Annuum & Frutescen versions (shown here) grown across the world which are no where near as hot. The anuum version is sold under the name PC-1 in the US and the heat level is medium/hot (at best) despite the claims of 'ebay seed sellers'. The 'real deal' is reputed to be even hotter than the offical world record holder the Red Savina Habanero. We believe the 'real deal' is probably the Naga Morich from the descriptions we have read.

peppers.name: NASO DI CANE (Dog Nose Chile)
peppers.description: Sweet and flavour some variety with little heat. A Calabrian variety from Italy.

peppers.name: NAVAJOA
peppers.description: This is a hybridised F1 Anaheim variety that features large fruit and an excellent set. Theis plant produces predominately two lobed 8in long by 2in wide smooth skinned peppers which mature from dark green to brilliant red.

peppers.name: NELLORE
peppers.description: An de arbol type variety grown in India.

peppers.name: NEW DELHI LONG
peppers.description:
New Delhi Long  is a hot; 4" long by 1/2" wide peppe which  
matures from green to red.

peppers.name: NGUA KOK TSIU
peppers.description: A de Arbol type Szechuan chile

peppers.name: NIKKO
peppers.description: A thin, twisted hot Cayenne type Japanese chile

peppers.name: NIPPON TAKA
peppers.description: An ornamental hybridised Thai chili pepper that is an early fruiting plant. This chili plant can reach a height of 1m and develops bright red upright fruit in clusters. Up to 7 cm long fruits. 140 or more fruits per stem can be harvested from this variety. Plants are resistant to anthracnose, phytophthora, and virus.

peppers.name: NORTH STAR
peppers.description: These 3 to 4-lobed blocky bell pepper sets fruit even under adverse conditions. The pods ripen from deep green  to red approximately 65 days after transplanting. Plants are resistant to Tobacco mosaic resistant (TMV).

peppers.name: NOSEGAY
peppers.description: Immature pods are shown here. This very nice ornamental variety is simiar to Marbles, Ammazzo and Holiday Cheer. The erect small cherry like pods mature from cream to various shades of orange and then finally to a rich red. A good choice for a container or the  kitchen window sill.

peppers.name: NOVA F1 BELL
peppers.description: Nova-Bell F1 is a sweet pepper variety. This relatively low growing plant, yields pendant thick walled fruit which mature from deep green to red.

peppers.name: NP 51
peppers.description: Variety from the Indian Agricultural Research Institute

peppers.name: NPU 6A
peppers.description: Variety from the Indian Agricultural Research Institute

peppers.name: NS 101 F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: Variety from the Indian Agricultural Research Institute

peppers.name: NS 1101 F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: Variety from the Indian Agricultural Research Institute

peppers.name: NS 1420 F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: Variety from the Indian Agricultural Research Institute

peppers.name: NS 1701 F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: Variety from the Indian Agricultural Research Institute

peppers.name: NUMEX BAILEY PIQUIN
peppers.description: This cultivar was released by the New Mexico State University's (NMSU) Chile Pepper Breeding Program in 1991 and named in honor of Mr Alton L.Bailey, NMSU's extension vegetable specialist who helped evaluate this selection.  NuMex Bailey Piquin is unique because the fruit falls from the stem at maturity, making harvesting easier. The fruits are small, less than 0.5 inch wide and less than 1 inch long with a distinctive flavour. The season is very long at around 120 days.  When dried, fruit powder has a pungency of 97,000 SHU

peppers.name: NUMEX BARKERS HOT
peppers.description: The hottest of the Numex types, these Peppers grow to 5 to 7 inches long by 1 to 2 inches wide and  mature from green to red. They may be eaten in either there red or green form.

peppers.name: NUMEX BIG JIM
peppers.description:
The Numex Big Jim is listed in the Guinness Book of World Records as the producer of the largest Chile pods ever grown, with specimans in excess of a foot long (12 inches) not unknown. The variety was developed in the mid 1970's by Dr Nakayama as a result of a bredding program at the New Mexico State University (NMSU), home of the Chile Pepper Institute.
Plants grow easily and vigourously and are surprisingly small in comparison to the gigantic pods growing between 24" to 36" high. Up to 30 pods may grow on a single plant which ripen from green to a deep red approximately 80 days after transplanting seedlings.

Due to the pod size and mild heat quotient (500 to 2,500 SHU), Big Jim is  perfect for making decorative “ristras” as well as the classic (and very tasty) chile relleno dish.  

To make Chile Relleno's, toast, peel and de-seed ripe chiles. Stuff them with your favorite plain or herbed cheese (cheddar cheeses work well). In a small bowl, beat two eggs with a dash of salt and a tablespoon of flour to make a light batter. Dip each stuffed pepper into the batter before frying in hot olive orvegtable oil in a heavy skillet. Drain on paper towels, sprinkle with a bit of additional cheese, top broil and serve with a fresh salsa. You can also add diced, cooked chicken or beef to the cheese stuffing if you wish or any other combinations you wish to try. Delicious!!.

peppers.name: NUMEX CENTENNIAL
peppers.description: This was the first ornamental variety released from NMSU intended for growing in small containers.  It was released in 1988 to celebrate NMSU's Centennial celebrations.  Many seed companies offer seed of this cultivar, unfortunately, under different names.  'NuMex Centennial' has purple flowers and purple foliage.  The upright fruits are purple, then ripen to yellow, orange, and finally red. Very similar in appearence to the Bolivian Rainbow. ##HIGHLY RECOMMENDED BY THE CHILEMAN##

peppers.name: NUMEX CONQUISTADOR
peppers.description: This non pungent cultivar was released by the NMSU in 1989 and is considered to be a paprika type chile. When harvested in the green stage, it is stuffed with jalapeno flavored cheese to produce chile relines with uniform pungency. These 6-7in long fruits ripen from green to a beautiful red colour, and are delicious eaten red or green. A perfect Chile for a novice.

peppers.name: NIU CHIAO CHIAO
peppers.description: The name means 'Bulls Horn'. A more detailed description is currently unavailable

peppers.name: NUMEX ECLIPSE
peppers.description: This hybridised cultivar was developed at the New Mexico State University in 1988 by Drs.Bosland,  Iglesias, and Tanksley. Its cousins are the Numex Sunrise and Numex Sunset. The pods are 4-6in long and turn brown at maturity. They are used primarily as ornamental chiles.  All three cultivars originated from a cross between 'Permagreen' and 'New Mexico 6-4'.  They are similar in pungency to 'New Mexico 6-4'.

peppers.name: NUMEX ESPANOLA IMPROVED
peppers.description: Developed by Dr Matta and Dr Nakayama in 1984, this cultivar resulted from a hybridization between 'Sandia' and a northern New Mexico strain of chile.  It is an early maturing red chile cultivar (55 days) and is grown for its earliness. The 5-7in fruits have a mild pungency (1500 to 2000 Scoville units)

peppers.name: NUMEX GARNET
peppers.description: This is a paprika pepper with a deep red coloring but no heat.

peppers.name: NUMEX JOE PARKER
peppers.description: Developed b the NMSU in honor of Mr Joe E. Parker of Las Cruces, New Mexico, a 1950 graduate of NMSU's College of Agriculture and Home Economics.   Parker evaluated this specific selection.   This cultivar is an improved version of the 'New Mexico 6-4', the standard chile cultivar for southern New Mexico. The plants are medium tall and very productive producing 15-20cm long peppers which ripen from bright green through mahogany to red in approx 80 days.It has thicker walls, more flesh and longer peppers than the original. This pepper is excellent for roasting, stuffing or chopping for a variety of dishes and is commonly used in New Mexico to make the dried pepper wreaths. Mild pungency 1000 SHU

peppers.name: NUMEX MIRASOL
peppers.description: The  word mirasol in Spanish means looking at the sun.  The chile type is called mirasol because the 3-4in long clusters of erect fruit point to the sun.  'NuMex Mirasol' was developed over six years by Drs. Bosland and Gonzalez using a pedigree breeding method that included hybridization and repeated single plant selections and was finally released in 1993. It is used both as an ornamental on wreaths and a ground powder in cooking

peppers.name: NUMEX NO 64
peppers.description: The commercial variety for fresh green or dried red Chile, 5-7 inches long.

peppers.name: JALAPENO NUMEX PINATA
peppers.description: Also developed by Drs. Bosland and Votava of the NMSU in 1997, NuMex Pinata is a multicolored jalapeno. The fruit changes from bright green to bright yellow then to orange and finally to red, it could become a favorite to home gardeners who want colorful salsa.

peppers.name: JALAPENO NUMEX PRIMAVERA
peppers.description: Developed by Dr. Bosland and his team of research specialists at the NMSU in 1997  This is a "No Spice"  Jalapeno that has all of the flavor of a traditional jalapeno, but only 1/10 the heat of a regular jalapeno. NuMex primavera is a high yielding cultivar.

peppers.name: NUMEX R NAKY
peppers.description: A hybridised cultivar developed by Dr. Nakayama of the New Mexico State University in 1985 which resulted it cross breeding between 'Rio Grande 21', an early maturing native type, 'New Mexico 6-4', and a Bulgarian paprika.  It sets fruit under high temperature and low humidity. A mild variety that produces 5-6 inches long pods

peppers.name: NUMEX RIO GRANDE
peppers.description: A hybridised cultivar which resulted from a cross between Numex 6 and Anaheim.  Plants are normally 2 to 2 1/2 feet in height and produce large (6 x 1 3/4 inches), smooth, green pods with thick flesh which mature to red.  Today, this cultivar is no longer grown widely in New Mexico. 2500-5000 scoville units

peppers.name: NUMEX SANDIA
peppers.description: The cultivar was developed by Dr Roy Harper in 1956 by crossing breeding a Numex No.9 type with a Californian Anaheim-type.. 'Sandia' produced 5-7 inch long, medium wide green pods with medium thick walls which are much hotter than Numex 6-4 (1,500-2,000 SHU) but not as hot as Barker. Very popular with home gardeners.

peppers.name: NUMEX SUAVE ORANGE
peppers.description: This variety is from the smae family as the Habanero and was developed by the Chile Pepper Institute to have all the flavours of a Habanero but less heat. The word 'suave' is Spanish for mellow, smooth or mild.  The pods have a citrus like flavour with an orange lemony overtone and an apricot aroma. The heat is in the back of the mouth and throat and not on the lips and tongue.  Each plant can yield upto 100 mildly pungent fruits which rate at around 850 units on the scoville scale..

peppers.name: NUMEX SUAVE RED
peppers.description: This variety is from the smae family as the Habanero and was developed by the Chile Pepper Institute to have all the flavours of a Habanero but less heat. The word 'suave' is Spanish for mellow, smooth or mild.  The pods have a citrus like flavour with an orange lemony overtone and an apricot aroma. The heat is in the back of the mouth and throat and not on the lips and tongue.  Each plant can yield upto 100 mildly pungent fruits which rate at around 850 units on the scoville scale..

peppers.name: NUMEX SUNBURST
peppers.description: These are ornamental de Arbol-type chiles for making mini-ristras and wreaths in alternative colors. Smaller than the usual New Mexican type of ristra pepper, these measure only 2-3 inches long by 3/8 inch wide. The pods grow erect on the plant and mature to  bright orange around 70 days after transplanting Approximately 500-1000 scoville heat units.

peppers.name: NUMEX SUNFLARE
peppers.description: These are ornamental de Arbol-type chiles for making mini-ristras and wreaths in alternative colors. Smaller than the usual New Mexican type of ristra pepper, these measure only 2-3 inches long by 3/8 inch wide. The pods grow erect on the plant and mature to bright red around 70 days after transplanting Approximately 500-1000 scoville heat units.

peppers.name: NUMEX SUNGLO
peppers.description: Sunglo is a nice edible ornamental variety that  produces good yields of 3 ¼" long by ½" wide hot chilis. Pods are erect and mature from green to a bright yellow.  This is a nice variety  for adding colour to cooking and a colourful hot chili to brighten the home or garden.

peppers.name: NUMEX SUNRISE
peppers.description: This hybridised cultivar was developed at the New Mexico State University in 1988 by Drs.Bosland,  Iglesias, and Tanksley. Its cousins are the Numex Sunset and Numex Eclipse. The pods are 4-6in long and turn bright yellow at maturity. They are used primarily as ornamental chiles.  All three cultivars originated from a cross between 'Permagreen' and 'New Mexico 6-4'.  They are similar in pungency to 'New Mexico 6-4'.

peppers.name: NUMEX SUNSET
peppers.description: This hybridised cultivar was developed at the New Mexico State University in 1988 by Drs.Bosland,  Iglesias, and Tanksley. Its cousins are the Numex Sunrise and Numex Eclipse. The pods are 4-6in long and turn orange at maturity. They are used primarily as ornamental chiles.  All three cultivars originated from a cross between 'Permagreen' and 'New Mexico 6-4'.  They are similar in pungency to 'New Mexico 6-4'.

peppers.name: NUMEX SWEET
peppers.description: A  paprika type chile that was developed by the NMSU n 1990. A mildly pungent variety, its striking red colour and suitle flavour makes it perfect for use in paprika

peppers.name: NUMEX TWILIGHT
peppers.description: This Piquin type ornamental chile was developed by Dr's Paul Bosland, Jaime Iglesias, and Max Gonzalez at New Mexico State University in 1992. The various fruit colors enhance its value as commercial greenhouse pot plant and has become a firm favourite by the pot plant industry.  The plant typically grows 12" tall when grown in pots, and 24-30" tall in the field. When spaced closely together, makes a uniform and colorful hedge. The pods grow upright on the plant, with each plant having hundreds of small fruits less than 20mm long. The dark leaves show off the coloured fruits as they ripen from purple to yellow to orange and lastly to red (70 days). NuMex Twilight has also has become an important source of cucumber mosaic virus resistance for plant breeders. 50,000 SHU.

peppers.name: OJE DE PAJARO
peppers.description: The smallest and hottest of the Chile tepin group

peppers.name: OLD MOTHERS TEAT
peppers.description: Sometimes called Old Maid Teat. These plants on average grow 2ft tall by 2-3 ft across and are heavy producers of 2.5" long and 1/2" across pods, with a nipple at the end, hence the name. The plant has green stems, dark green leaves, and produces white flowers. They pods mature to bright yellow approximately 85 days after transplanting. Very Unusual.

peppers.name: JALAPENO OLÉ
peppers.description: A giant Jalapeno variety with high yields on a medium sized plant . 2500 to 4000 SHU (60 days)

peppers.name: OLENA RED
peppers.description: Moderate production of 3½x4" blocky fruits turning red at maturity; thin flesh; excellent flavour.Originally a hybrid, stabilized for many years from seed from Olena Warshona (hence the name)

peppers.name: AJI OMNICOLOR (PI 215739)
peppers.description: This prolific ornamental variety produces 2 to 2.5 inches long by 0.5 to 0.625 inch wide pendant shaped peppers which grow upright on the plant. The pods  mature from a pale yellow to purple then  to yellow and orange before finally ripening to red. A lovely variety which will brighten up any garden. The pods also have a nice flavour. Strong sun gives omnicolor a nice purple blush (anthocyanin), it's an defense mechanism  against strong UV-radiation. Also listed as CGN 22141.

peppers.name: ORANGE BELL
peppers.description: Coloured sweet bell type .Large thick walled pepper which turn a rich orange when ripe (72 days)

peppers.name: ARBORETUM ROUND BLACK
peppers.description: Pods ripen from black to red. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: ORANGE PEKOE
peppers.description: Heavy set of pendent 3/4x1/3" smooth, blunt fruits on ½' tall x 1' wide plants with 3/4x1/3" dark green leaves; would make a very attractive potted plant; good drier; superficially similar to Short Yellow Tabasco, but flowers typical large, white

peppers.name: ORANGE SUN
peppers.description: This beautiful deep orange bell pepper grows to around 4 to 5 inches long and not quite as wide. The 4 lobed peppers mature from green to orange approximately 75 days after transplanting. The thick walls have a very sweet flavour make this a wonderful addition to salads and  stir-fries.

peppers.name: ORDONO
peppers.description: A Native American chile from Batopilas Canyon, Chihuahua Mexico.This white flowering variety can grow up to 3ft tall and produces good yields of 1" long by ½" wide hot peppers that grow erect on the plant. They mature from yellow, to purple, to orange, and finally to red approximately 90 days after transplanting.  Plant has green stems, green leaves, and white flowers. An excellent container plant.

peppers.name: ORI
peppers.description: Ori produces an abundance of thick-walled, big, bright yellow peppers, even under the most adverse weather conditions! This makes it a really wonderful and easy to grow garden variety to add to your pallet of peppers. It turns from green to bright yellow.

peppers.name: ORIOLE
peppers.description: Good sized 4 3/4 in./12 cm blocky four lobed fruit which may be harvested dark green or mature tangerine-orange. Plants have some TMV tolerance. Ripens dark green/orange.

peppers.name: ORION
peppers.description: A hybridised bell pepper variety. This high quality Dutch pepper plant has heavy foliage shielding the fruit from the sun. The large  blocky 4 lobed peppers can grow upto 5 inches long and wide and reach maturity approximately 75 days after transplanting. The plant also offers good  disease protection with resistance to 3 races of bacterial leaf spot and tobacco mosaic virus.

peppers.name: OROPESA F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: Created by United Genetics for the greenhouse markets. This hybrid is appreciated for its size, thick walls, and for its productivity. This bell type pepper is medium early and matures from green to golden yellow

peppers.name: OROZCO
peppers.description: A stunningly attractive 3ft tall plant with purple/black stems producing upright fruits, turning from light green to purple (almost black), yellow, orange, then red.  The foliage is purple almost black on the front and green on the back.  This chile is a great looker and deserves a place in any chile plant collection.  From eastern Europe.

peppers.name: ORTEGA
peppers.description: A product of the famous Ortega Chile Co, these large 7"x2" peppers offer a definite southwestern flavour and can be stuffed, grilled or roasted. Excellent for stews, sauces and pepper recipes.

peppers.name: OSE UTORO (CGN 22142)
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note: The CGN classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Wageningen, The Netherlands

peppers.name: OT CHI THIEN
peppers.description: These plants are prolific producers of Red long pointy, hanging HOT peppers. They ripen early in about 75-85 days and are extremely hot. The plants grow to about 2 1/2 feet and continue to produce until frost

peppers.name: PA 353 YELLOW
peppers.description: These very pungent variety developed by US Vegetable Laboratory, produces 1.5in long by 2in wide bonnet shaped fruits ripen to  yellow. Offer good disease resistance to Southern root-knot nematode.

peppers.name: PAKISTAN #1
peppers.description: Erect, 1½x1" smooth, elongate fruits that taper slightly to a point; very hot; fruits turn green to purple to red; plant 1½' tall x 1' wide.

peppers.name: PAKISTAN #2
peppers.description: Erect, 3/4x3/4" smooth, almost round fruits that turn from green to purple to red; very hot; plant 1½x1½'.

peppers.name: PAKISTAN #3
peppers.description: Erect, 1x2/3" smooth, red oval fruits with a slight point on the tip; fruits turn green to purple to red; very hot; plants 2x2'; leaves subtending fruit tend to pull off when picking ripe fruit.

peppers.name: PAKISTAN #4
peppers.description: Erect, 1¼x3/4" smooth, oval fruits that are blunt on the tip; fruits turn from green to purple to red; very hot; plant 1½' tall by 2' wide.

peppers.name: PALADIN
peppers.description: Sweet bell hybrid. Beautiful golden fruit (75 days)

peppers.name: PANT C-1
peppers.description: An Indian Cayenne type pepper. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: PANUCO
peppers.description: Named after a river in norhern Veracruz, this chile is a cultivated variety of Serrano grown in Mexico.

peppers.name: PAPALOAPAN
peppers.description: A cultivated variety of Jalapeno grown in Mexico

peppers.name: PAPER DRAGON
peppers.description: The perfect drying pepper for seasoning, this is the one seen hanging in dried bundles in most China town shops. The taste is medium hot, which is perfect for most soups and sauces. Dried peppers can be grounded into chile powder.

peppers.name: PAPRIKA SUPREME
peppers.description: This tall vigourous plant produces 6-8" long x 1 1/2" wide tapered fruits which have a mildly sweet flesh, with some heat in the ribs.

peppers.name: PARADO
peppers.description: A piquin type grown in Oaxaca, Mexico

peppers.name: PASILLA
peppers.description: Pasilla means 'little raisin' in Spanish, referring to the dark brown, wrinkled, dried pod. Called 'chilaca' when fresh, it adds character to rich complex flavour of enchilada, mole sauce and salsas. Plants grow 2 to 3 ft. tall, with first branches well up the stem so pods don’t touch the ground. The thin cylindrical 8-10in pods turn brown at maturity (75-80 days) and are very mild, 250 SHU or less. The pasilla is mainly used by Mexican cooks in the dried pod or in powdered form. Varieties include 'Apaseo', 'Bajio', 'De Oaxaca' 'and 'Padilla'., A pepper no inspiring Mexican serious cook should be without!

peppers.name: PASILLA BAJIO
peppers.description: When fresh, this pepper is called 'Chilaca'  it is also known as 'Chile Negro' or Mexican Negro. These 8 to 10 inch long cylindrical peppers are thin walled and start off dark green before ripening to dark brown (75-80 days). They have less than 250 Scoville units and are mainly used dried for their rich, smoky flavoring in sauces. Plants are tobacco mosaic virus (TMV) resistant.

peppers.name: PATAGONIA
peppers.description: An Hispanic heirloom grown in Patagonia, AZ. The cone-shaped chiles stand up on the plants, and are yellow with some purple mottling, ripening to orange then red. Used to make a thin hot sauce by blending with vinegar. Pods are relatively small averaging approx  1" at maturity.

peppers.name: JALAPENO PECOS F1
peppers.description: A vigorous growing large elogated Jalapeno hybrid from Rogers. Matures green to Red in 81 days. 6000 SHU

peppers.name: PELITA F1
peppers.description: Chilli Pepper Pelita F1  Fruits up to 6cm in length, extremely hot. Fruiting on medium tall, upright, bushy plants.

peppers.name: JALAPENO PELUDO
peppers.description: Meaning 'Hairy', this is a long and thick jalapeno variety cultivated in Mexico

peppers.name: FRIGGITELLO
peppers.description: This variety from the Campania region of Southern Italy  is one of the most common in Italy and you can find it in every market,  It is so common that every company has its own selections. This can generate some confusion and plenty of hybrids or generic varieties have since been developed. The  true Friggitello is around 4in long and has a somewhat irregular elongated shape. The pods are mild, with a bitter taste and are usually fried slightly and eaten as s side dish.

peppers.name: AJI UMBA YELLOW (OJEMMA)
peppers.description: These nice pods have a similar heat, aroma and flavour of the Habanero, but a more 'box-like' appearence. They average about 1 - 1.5 inches in length and ripen from a light lime green to yellow on a shrub like plant. A nice varieity to use for 'Habanero hot sauces', salsas and for drying and smoking. Also known as Adjuma and Ojemma.

peppers.name: PEPPERONCHINO GREEK
peppers.description: This flavorful golden pepper is the classic garnish for deli sandwiches, salads and pizza. This delcious Greek pepper grows on a plant that matures to 30 inches in height and produces an abundance of sweet lime green peppers which mature in about 65 days to a rich golden green color. The peppers are of a mild, sweet flavor and offer only a small degree of heat. When the peppers are picked at 2-3 inches in length, they are typically canned and pickled.  Excells in cold climates with short seasons.

peppers.name: PEQUIN (BIRD)
peppers.description:
Pequin is a wild 'bird pepper. There are two 'types' of pequins, one called chiltepin which is tiny and round and the more oval shaped ones called chilipiquin. Chile Pequin is the Nahautl language word corrupted to the present day word. In ranch country, both grow wild and all are called chile pequins. Pequins do not take well to cultivation and must be hand picked so are not widely available in supermarkets.  Plants fruit best in second year and should be brought indoors to overwinter. 
In Mexico both fresh green and dry red chile pequins are available. The green eaten fresh as a condiment or in salsas; the red ripe dry ones used in cooking and ground into chile blends. Very hot! I use both to make chile pequin jelly. Other names: bird, chile bravo (wild), chile del monte (woodlands).

peppers.name: PERI PERI (PI 497974)
peppers.description: This variety has many names: Balloon, Pimenta Cambuci, Campane, Ubatuba Cambuci, Aji Flor, Orchid and Bishops Hat to name a few!! This very unusual pod shaped variety is believed to have been  transfered from South America to Europe by the Portuguese in the 18th century and is actually part of the species Capsicum baccatum var. pendulum.  The plants are quite large growing 3 to 4 ft tall and produce 30 to 50 extremely weird 3 or 4 flat winged, wrinkled almost flying saucer like 1 ½" wide pods. The flesh of each pod is thin athough crisp to taste and they mature from green to red approximately 90-100 days after seedlings have emerged. The body of the pods have some detectable heat, but the wings are sweet and mild.

peppers.name: PERIDOT
peppers.description: Very similar of not identical to 'Bishps crown'. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: AJI LIMON (PERU YELLOW)
peppers.description: Also called Peru Yellow. The hot fruits grows horizontally and sometimes erect. Measuring about 1,5 inches long and 0,5 inches in diameter, the pods have  lemony overtones that suites fish and shellfish, as well chicken, ceviche, salsa, mojo, and salads

peppers.name: BHUT JOLOKIA YELLOW
peppers.description: This variety is closely linked to the 7 Pot/Pod and Trinidad Scorpion landrace varieties. It may or may not be a different variety.

peppers.name: PERUVIAN PURPLE
peppers.description: This highly ornamental Pequin type variety produces 0.75 to 1 in long by 0.375 to 0.5 inches wide purple pods which grow in upright in clusters on the plant. The pods ripen to red approximately 85-95 days after trasnplanting. This beautiful plant has dark purple stems, purple/green variated leaves and produce stunning purple flowers. A real eye catcher.

peppers.name: SPECTRAL
peppers.description: A hybridised ornamental variety developed by Craig Houllier.The parent plants are. not known.  This beautiful plant grows to around 3ft tall and is quite upright. The pods are around 3/4 inch long and grow erect on the plant. The foliage starts off almost black in colour before lightening to a dark green as the season progresses.

peppers.name: PETER PEPPER RED (PI 593566)
peppers.description: Regularly voted as the Worlds most pornograpic pepper!  This plant produces good yields of 2 ½" long by ½" wide penis shaped peppers. Peppers are mildly hot and turn from green to red when mature (90 days). Note an immature pod is shown here. The chilies are downwards pointing and prefers slight shade and a wind free growing area. nited States Department of Agriculture, PI 593566.  Rare.

peppers.name: PETIT MARSEILLAIS
peppers.description: French heirloom with luminous 3 - 4" long yellow wrinkled peppers.

peppers.name: PETO WONDER
peppers.description: This hybridised F1 bell pepper variety produces elongated fruits which grow to around 6-1/2 inches long and 4-1/2 inches wide at the shoulder. They  mature from dark green to deep red approximately 75 days after transplanting. When red, this pepper has more vitamin C than an orange!

peppers.name: PI 124080
peppers.description: Fruit red, mild, about 4in by 2in. A good sweet type for salads.

peppers.name: PI 127442
peppers.description: Cherry like peppers. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: PI 135826
peppers.description: Fruit elongate bullnosed, 3.5 by 1.75in; red and sweet. Seeds only slightly peppery.

peppers.name: LIMO BLANCO (PI 152222)
peppers.description: Also listed as CGN 19193. Note: The CGN classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Wageningen, The Netherlands. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: PICKLES (PI 159259)
peppers.description: The variety is more accurately part of the Capsicum baccatum var. pendulum species. This 6ft tall plant produces very unusual 6 to7in green pendant shaped pods with a "Jello-like" transparency that ripen to a vibrant transparent orange.  The pods are medium-thick flesh with the typical fruity baccatum aroma and flavour. Few and very small seeds for the size of the plant and pod. This plant has a very long season and seems to be tolerant of the cool weather

peppers.name: EARBOB (PI 159272)
peppers.description: This 4ft tall erect plant, yet branching habit produces rounded pods which ripened from green to bronze and then to red  approximately 60 days after transplanting. The pods are medium-thick fleshed, sweet to tast with the usual baccatum fruity and aroma, with little heat.  On the downside this plant is a relatively low producer and has a very long season. Part of the species Capsicum baccatum var. pendulum.

peppers.name: MIRCH (PI 173877)
