peppers.description: Hindi term for hot chiles in Northern India. 'Lal Mirch' is red chile, 'Hari Mirch' is green chile. Kashmiri chiles are known as 'Degi mirch'.

peppers.name: PI 174810
peppers.description: The fruits of this Indian variety grow to approximately 2.5in long by 1/2in wide. They are tapered in shape and mature from green to red.

peppers.name: ROCOTILLO
peppers.description: Rocotillo exists both as a baccatum and chinense. A mature Chilnese pod is shown here. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.description: This variety produces 1.5in long by 1in wide pods which are shaped like large acorns with somewhat lobed wide shoulders tapering to a point. The pods ripen from green to orange and then to red.

peppers.name: PERUVIAN GOLDEN (PI 238052)
peppers.description: A prolific variety which grows well in containers. Pods are approximately 1in long and 0.75in wide and mature from green to a golden yellow colour.

peppers.name: ORANGE LANTERN (PI 257127)

peppers.name: ECUARDORIAN DEVILS BREATH (PI 257132)

The pods measure approximately 6 by 3.5cm, are rough skinned, flattened, pointed and 3 sided. They mature from green through to orange and finally to a rich ruby red.

peppers.description: Also known as BGH 4365. A more detailed description is currently unavailable. Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: BGH 135 (PI 441602)
peppers.description: Fruits flattened, 2 x 2cm, orange. Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: BGH 436 (PI 441609)
peppers.description: Fruits small, round, red. Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: BGH 1656 (PI 441612)
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: BGH 1717 (PI 441619)
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: BGH 1723 (PI 441622)
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: BGH 1768 (PI 441627)
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: BGH 4201 (PI 441635)
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: BGH 4213 (PI 441637)
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: BGH 4283 (PI 441639)
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: PI 441656
peppers.description: Plants bushy, pubescent. Fruits few. A more detailed description is  currently unavailable.

peppers.name: PIMENTA ARDIDA VERMELHA (PI 441520)
peppers.description: This productive variety produces 2 x 10cm pods which mature to red, not astringent. Also know as BGH 181. Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: PI 501532
peppers.description: This wild variety is no longer classified as a part of the Capsium genus having recently been reclassified as part of the species Tubocapsicum anomalum. The pods are berrylike, very small and round with an unusual circular Calyx. Believed to be found in Japan, southern China, Taiwan, and the Philippines.

peppers.name: SIVULI (PI 511885)
peppers.description: This variety is more accurately part of the sub species Capsicum annuum var. glabriusculum. Description currently unavailable.

peppers.name: SIVULI (PI 511886)
peppers.description: A tepin variety. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: PI 543184
peppers.description: Shrub to 2m tall. Flowers nodding, petals white, anthers purple. Fruit to 6cm long, pendulous, shiny green turning red, conical, wrinkled, ribbed. Seeds white. Cultivated by Indians in dooryard gardens.

peppers.name: AJI DULCE 4 (PI 543188)
peppers.description: One of the any varieties name Aji Dulce

peppers.name: PI 543207
peppers.description: Fruit top-shaped, flanged, 5cm in diameter, 3-4cm long, style scar inserted, dull red colour, piquant. Seeds yellow.

peppers.name: CHILITO DE SIMOJOVEL (PI 566812)
peppers.description: This variety is more accurately part of the sub species Capsicum annuum var. glabriusculum. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: TURBO PUBE (PI 585267)
peppers.description: A prolific Rocoto variety.  Large bullet shaped pods mature from dark green to mid orange.  At this stage they have little heat, but they continue to mature to darker orange where they become much hotter.

peppers.name: PI 590503
peppers.description: Erect, woody shrub, 1.2m tall. Flowers purple. Fruits green, yellow, then red, to 5cm long, irregularly ovate, thick flesh, black seeds, pungent flavor.

peppers.name: PI 590505
peppers.description: Fruits elongate, pointed, 4-5cm long, yellow-orange when ripe, slightly curved. Seeds yellow-white.

peppers.name: PI 593491
peppers.description: This variety is more accurately part of the sub species Capsicum annuum var. glabriusculum. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: PI 593528
peppers.description: This variety is more accurately part of the sub species Capsicum annuum var. glabriusculum. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: PI 593557
peppers.description: This variety is more accurately part of the sub species Capsicum annuum var. glabriusculum. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: PI 593574
peppers.description: This variety is more accurately part of the sub species Capsicum annuum var. glabriusculum. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: SUPER PUBE (PI 593622)
peppers.description: A prolific Rocoto variety A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: PI 639653 (GRIF 15051)
peppers.description: This wild shruby variety grows typically to 80 cm tall and is profusely branched. Fruits red, piquant.

peppers.name: PI 593644
peppers.description: This variety is more accurately part of the sub species Capsicum annuum var. glabriusculum. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: PI 614001
peppers.description: Immature pods shown here. Description currently unavailable.

peppers.name: PI 631136
peppers.description: This variety is more accurately part of the sub species Capsicum annuum var. glabriusculum. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: PI 631141
peppers.description: This variety is more accurately part of the sub species Capsicum annuum var. glabriusculum. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: PI 631150
peppers.description: More accurately this varieity is part of the species Capsicum baccatum var. baccatum. Plant erect, 80 cm tall. Fruits erect, ovoid, 1.0 cm long, 0.5 cm wide, shiny red, piquant. No flowers. Mottled leaves.

peppers.name: PI 631154
peppers.description: This wild shruby variety grows typically to 1 m tall and produces shiny red, globose fruits measuring  0.5-1cm in diameter. Piquant.

peppers.name: GUARANI (PI 632922)
peppers.description: More accurately this varieity is part of the species Capsicum baccatum var. baccatum. Plant very branched from the base, erect, 1 m tall. Flowers erect, cream-colored with yellowish green spots at the base of the corolla. Fruits erect, triangular, up to 2 cm long, red when mature.

peppers.name: PI 633751
peppers.description: More accurately this varieity is part of the species Capsicum baccatum var. baccatum. Plant erect and supported, approximately 2 m tall, branches in a pronounced zig zag. Fruits erect, less than 1 cm long, ovoid, bright red at maturity, leaves pilose.

peppers.name: PI 633752
peppers.description: More accurately this varieity is part of the species Capsicum baccatum var. baccatum.  A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: CHILTEPE (PI 632932)
peppers.description: More accurately, this variety is acctually part of the Capsicum annuum var. glabriusculum species. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: PI 639127
peppers.description: This variety is more accurately part of the sub species Capsicum annuum var. glabriusculum. Plant approximately 4 feet tall. Fruits approximately 1 cm long, erect, green, turning red at maturity.

peppers.name: PI 639128
peppers.description: More accurately this varieity is part of the species Capsicum baccatum var. baccatum. Plant erect, semi-supported, 50 cm tall. Leaf size variable. Flowers white with yellowish green spots at the base of the corolla. Fruits erect, round, 1.5 cm diameter, light green changing to red when mature, piquant.

peppers.name: PI 639126
peppers.description: This variety is more accurately part of the sub species Capsicum annuum var. glabriusculum. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: PI 639649 (GRIF 15022)
peppers.description: More accurately this varieity is part of the species Capsicum baccatum var. baccatum. Plant 40-50 cm tall. Many fruits, 1 1/2-2 cm long, turning from green to orange to bright red when mature.

peppers.name: PI 639651
peppers.description: Plant erect, approximately 80 cm tall. Flowers small, white, without spots, anthers yellow with wings at the base of the filaments. Fruits erect, elongated, triangular, 2.5 cm long, 0.5 cm wide, purplish greenish, orange at maturity, piquant.  Used as a condiment and a medicine by the Tovas.

peppers.name: PI 427289 (HAES XX)
peppers.description: A cross between Keystone and Malaysia Chili. (Capsicum annuum). Fruit thick walled, conical, 2.5cm diameter. 10cm long, pungent, high quality. Immune to Hawaiian strain of bacterial wilt and tolerant to root knot nematode.

peppers.name: PICO DE GALLO (Roosters beak)
peppers.description: Means "Rooster's beak" A salsa chile from Mexico. Hot, with heat that builds in the mouth over time. 1/3" wide and 2.5" long.

peppers.name: PICO DE PAJARO (PI 511879)
peppers.description: Translates to "Bird's beak" and originates from Yecora, Sonora, Mexico. The knobby fruit are often curved. Pods are almost 1" wide and 5-5½" long.  Also known as 'Cola de Rata' (Rat tail). USDA accession number PI 511879

peppers.name: PILI PILI
peppers.description: The name means 'pepper pepper' in Swahili and many African pod shapes are known by this term. It is believed to be part of the Frutescens species although it is often labelled as an Annuum.

peppers.name: PILOT PEPPER
peppers.description: This variety grows like a small tree and is loaded with fruit. The pods are approximately 3/4in long  and 1/2in wide and although they look like they might belong to the Capcisum Chinense species, the pods lack the characteristic fruity aroma.

peppers.name: PIMENT BEC C'OISEA NOIR
peppers.description: A Pre-1900 African American heirloom with white & purple mottled leaves and 'normal' 3/4" pendent purple to red fruits; stems purple-black; flowers purple. Oral history suggests that the variety originates from from catering family of P. Albert Dutrieuille. Dutrieulle brought it with them from Haiti. Was briefly offered in the 1890's by Philadelphia seed houses as 'Black Nubian', and mentioned in late 1800's cookbooks.

peppers.name: PIMENTA CAMBUCI (PI 497974)
peppers.description: This variety has many names: Balloon, Pimenta Cambuci, Campane, Peri Peri, Ubatuba Cambuci, Aji Flor, Orchid and Bishops Hat to name a few!! This very unusual pod shaped variety is believed to have been  transfered from South America to Europe by the Portuguese in the 18th century and is actually part of the species Capsicum baccatum var. pendulum.  The plants are quite large growing 3 to 4 ft tall and produce 30 to 50 extremely weird 3 or 4 flat winged, wrinkled almost flying saucer like 1 ½" wide pods. The flesh of each pod is thin athough crisp to taste and they mature from green to red approximately 90-100 days after seedlings have emerged. The body of the pods have some detectable heat, but the wings are sweet and mild.

peppers.name: PIMENTA DE CHEIRO (PI 441642)
peppers.description: Translates to 'Chile of Aroma'. A small podded variety from Brazil

peppers.name: PEPPADEW TM
peppers.description: The Peppadew™ is a sweet, tangy, mildly spicy pickled pepper from South Africa. It is said to have a taste somewhere between a mild chilli and a plain bell pepper. The variety was first brought to the worlds attention by Johan Steenkamp who 'discovered' a chest-high bush of them growing in the garden of his holiday home in the Eastern Cape, South Africa.  The bush was laden with small bright red fruit something like a cross between cherry tomatoes and very round chillies and he decided to call them  peppadews.

peppers.name: PIMENTO
peppers.description: Pimento is the Portugese term for chile peppers. They are many varieties. In general, these medium to large 2½ foot plants produce a relatively good yield of thick walled, heart shaped, elongated fruits that are up to 6" long, with a crisp, super sweet flavour. They mature from green to red and are superb for stuffing, roasting and salad toppings.

peppers.name: PI 543193
peppers.description: Fruits box-like, 4cm long, 3-4 strong ribs, inverted apex, orange when mature, not piquant. Seeds light yellow.

peppers.name: PIMENTO DE PADRON
peppers.description: Pimientos de Padrón are small green peppers named after a town in Galicia Spain. They are usually fried in salt and served as a tapa. At their best, eating them is rather like playing Russian Roulette; although they are all delicious, about one in five will blow a hole in the top of your skull! Sometimes almost all of them are highly explosive; occasionally, an entire batch is sweet.

peppers.name: PIQUILLO DE LODOSA
peppers.description: Pimientos del piquillo come from Navarra in Spain, and have their own "Denominación de Origen" (D.O. Pimientos del Piquillo de Lodosa). These small red peppers are charred over wood charcoal / old vines, then peeled by hand, marinated in olive oil with herbs, and eventually eaten either alone or in a salad or stuffed.

peppers.name: PIMENTO ELITE F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: A sweet pepper which is less heart shaped than the normal Pimento. Matures green to red in 87 days. See Pimento

peppers.name: PIMENTO L
peppers.description: These large heart-shaped fruits grow to approximately 4 1/2 inches long and borne on 1-1/2 ft. tall, strong, upright plants. The peppers ripen from green to red approximately 95 days after transplanting and are a good variety for canning or pickling. Tobacco mosaic virus (TMV) resistant.

peppers.name: PIMIENTO PALMERA
peppers.description: Also known as Pimeintos Picones, this variety is the core ingredient in the sauce 'mojo picon' (ingredients - dried peppers, olive oil, vinegar, garlic, cumin, salt).  A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: PIMIENTO PERA DULCE
peppers.description: Pera = pear shaped, this thin walled Spanish variety has practicularly no heat. Used in the making of salsas in Spain.

peppers.name: PIMENTO RED RUFFLED
peppers.description: A Cheese type variety that matures from green to red approximately 85 days after transplanting. The 1.5 to 2in long by 3 to 3.5in wide pods have scalloped edges with thick flesh. Very tasty.

peppers.name: AJI PINGUITA DE MONO
peppers.description: The name Aji Pinguita De Mono translates to ' little monkey dick' a reference to the pods shape. The pods are small measuring only 0.5 to 1in long, are slightly curved and taper to a point. They mature from green to a bright scarlet approximately 90 days after transplanting. This variety is among the hottest of the little Aji's known in Peru measuring 70,000 - 80,000 Scoville units. The Aji Pinguita de Mono is found in all regions of the Peruvian jungle, mainly in the central valley of Chanchamayo.

peppers.name: PIMIENTO PIQUILLO
peppers.description: This Spanish variety (from Lodosa) produces nice shiny pods which ripen from green to red and are mildly pungent. The thin walled pods have a nice crunch to them and they are good for stuffing or roasting.

peppers.name: PIRI PIRI
peppers.description:
PIRI-PIRI is a Swahili word meaning ‘pepper-pepper’ referring to any peppers. In
Portugal, it has come to mean the small fiery hot pepper, found hanging in
garlands in all the markets. No chicken is ever ordered in an Algarve restaurant
without the question “Com piri-piri?” (with piri-piri?) being asked.

Portuguese traders then carried the seeds to their African colonies of Angola and Mozambique. From there, they spread across Africa, along with their Swahili name ‘piri-piri’. To complete the circle, some of the small hot pods were brought back to Portugal, where they have kept their Swahili name up to the present day.

peppers.name: PIROS F1
peppers.description: a long slim Anaheim type producing attractive 180-200mm fruits. Ripens green to red and being medium pungency.

peppers.name: PISBAS HARARI
peppers.description: Believed to originate from Hararah in Ethiopia. The pods are erect and roundish and about 1cm in diameter. A very prolific plant.

peppers.name: PISBAS HAYMI
peppers.description: From the high mountains of Haymi, Africa.

peppers.name: POBLANO
peppers.description: From Puebla, this is one of the most common Mexican chiles. The chiles are heart shaped, about 4 inches long and 3inches wide.see Ancho (the dried form)

peppers.name: PODAROK MOLDAVI
peppers.description: A Russian paprika type sweet pepper which is reported to be resistant to verticillium wilt disease. The pods are 3.5in long x 1.75in wide and mature from yellow to red

peppers.name: POINSETTIA (JAPANESE HOT CLAW)
peppers.description: This pepper is an edible ornamental variety. The long thin 3in fruits which resemble an eagles claw, grow upright in clusters on a compact plant forming a dramatic display. They matures from light green to a range of reds (90 days).  The peppers have a very intriguing hot flavour, eaten fresh or dried for hot pepper powder and flakes. Also know as Japanese hot claw and very similar - if not the same as 'Takanotsume'.

peppers.name: PORTUGAL FIRE
peppers.description: Tall plants loaded with 7 inch shing dark green fruits that mature to a deep red colour (65 days)

peppers.name: PR 93-2-1
peppers.description: Bell pepper developed by Ohio State Universiry

peppers.name: PRAIRIE FIRE
peppers.description: The Prairie Fire is a compact ornamental pepper perfect for outdoor borders or indoor pots. The small sprawling plants sprout 3cm long upright chiles which stand out above foliage. The pods ripen from cream to yellow to orange (50 days) and finally to red (75 days). Flavour is bright, fruity, and pungent. The plant's branches cascade to the ground making this an excellent pepper for use as a groundcover.

peppers.name: PRETTY PURPLE
peppers.description: Ornamental and flavourful, this 2ft tall purple leaved small fruited variety, produces tear shaped erect fruits which are approximately 1-1/2" long and 3/4" in diameter. This beautiful pepper is purple for 90% of the season before finally maturing to red approximately 75 days after transplanting. The foliage, stems, flowers and fruit all share the same have attractive purple coloration.  The plant & pods are similar  to 'Purple Prince' although the flowers have more purple overtones and the pods are slightly larger.

peppers.name: PROF MEADERS CHOCOLATE
peppers.description: A 3 to 4in long by 2 to 3in wide blocky bell pepper variety which  matures from green to brown.

peppers.name: PUCA UCHU
peppers.description: see Ai Rojo or Aji Red

peppers.name: PUEBLO
peppers.description: A mild tasting Anaheim type which produce 5 to 7in long by 1.5 to 2in wide smooth pendant pods which mature from green to red. A good variety for Stuffing, Roasting or for use in Stir-Fries.

peppers.name: PUL AM HONG PI GO CHU
PUL AM HOUSE PUT GO CHU
PULLA
peppers.description: A debate rages as to whether this is a form of DeArbol, Guajillo or Mirasol. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: PUNJAB LAL
peppers.description: A very productive Indian Cayenne type which produces 2x½" erect fruits that turn green to purple to red; plant 2'x2'. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: PUNJAB SMALL HOT
peppers.description: A Cayenne variety from Indian. This 2ft tall plant produces good yields of 2 to 3 in long, thin skinned pendant pods which mature from green to red.

peppers.name: PUPPY PEPPER
peppers.description: These very attractive non pungent peppers are common in Costa Rica.

peppers.name: PURIRA
peppers.description: There is much debate as to whether this variety is part of the species Annuum or Frutescens. The greenish white flowers display the characteristics of a Frutescens. These bushy plants grow to 18–24" and produce a profusion of 2in long conical shaped hot fruits that grow upright on the plant. The medium thick fleshed pods start off yellow and have a purple mottling before maturing to an orange/red colour approximately 65-77 days after transplanting. The variety is said to have good disease resistance and is an  attractive variety for container pots.

peppers.name: PURPLE BEAUTY
peppers.description: A coloured sweet bell type. Rare 4 lobed variety that matures to a deep dark purple (70-74 days). A compact plant with good fruit set

peppers.name: PURPLE CHIHUAHUA
peppers.description: A stunning ornamental type producing edible 1in upright fruits which turn from light green to purple, yellow, orange then red

peppers.name: PURPLE CLUSTER
peppers.description: This ornamental Pequin type variety produces 0.5 to 1in long by 0.25 to 0.375 in wide conical shaped pods which grow erect on the plant. They mature from purple to red. This plant has beautiful purple foliage and flowers.

peppers.name: ECUADORIAN PURPLE
peppers.description: This variety is truly purple: flowers, fruit, and stems. Even the leaves have a purple tinge. The pods are 1/4" long by 3/8" wide and mature from purple (almost black) to red  The plant is quite tall (but compact, and makes a good ornamental. Also known as Purple Ecuador.

peppers.name: PURPLE PRINCE (PRETTY IN PURPLE)
peppers.description: This is a stunning and very productive ornamental variety. Plants are realtively compact growing typically between 1 and 2ft tall and have dark black/purple stems and dark green/purple foliage. The pods resemble small purple spherical marbles which grow up right on the plant and mature to orange and finally a crimson red. The pods are surprisingly hot. ##HIGHLY RECOMMENED ##. Also known as Pretty in Purple.

peppers.name: RED ROCKET
peppers.description: Tapered, thin-walled, 5-6" long fruits. Dries quickly to a bright crimson red. Early, high yielding & a good Rista pepper.

peppers.name: PURPLE TEPIN
peppers.description: A nice and small ornamental with little pubescent stems and greenish purple leaves. Extremely productive. A ripe pod is shown here.

peppers.name: PURPLE TIGER (TRIFETTI)
peppers.description: An extremely attractive medium/hot ornamental pepper that produces good yields of stumpy 1" long by ½" wide hot purple fruits which mature to red. The foliage is also tri coloured (green, purple and white) and the plant has an open bush habit. Note that the plant size can be restricted by the pot size. An Ideal pot plant for sheltered areas. Very unusual and onewhich will lighten up even the dullest greenhouse. Also called Trifetti and Variegata.

peppers.name: PURPLE VARIEGATED
peppers.description: Strange and beautiful! These chile plants have strongly purple and green striped stems with older leaves showing green, purple and white variegation. The flowers are also purple and the glossy chillies start purple then ripen to red. A true sight to behold! Good naturally bushy habit.

peppers.name: VENEZUELAN PURPLE
peppers.description: The plant is small and completely purple. Clusters of round pea-sized peppers start purple-green and ripen to bright red, which stands out against the purple foliage. Quite hot with a good 'peppery' taste.

peppers.name: PUSA JWALA (GRIF 15604)
peppers.description: A Cayenne type also known as' Finger Hot Indian. These 3ft tall plants are prolific producers of hot, 3-5in long thin wrinkled peppers which ripen from lime green to orange and then to red in about 85 days.  An ideal chilli ideal for flavouring Indian curries.

peppers.name: PUSA SADABAHAR (GRIF 15502)
peppers.description: An Indian Cayenne type pepper. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: QUADRATO d'ASTI GIALLO
peppers.description: An Italian sweet 3-4 lobed bell pepper with a sweet spicy flavour (70 days)

peppers.name: QUATRO MILPAS
peppers.description: in the mountain village of Quatro Milpas, Sonora. Fleshy and smooth-skinned. Mild heat. Pods average 4-4.5 inches when mature

peppers.name: QUEEN
peppers.description: A hybridised bell pepper variety. This 4 lobed block bell pepper ripens from green to orange before finally turning red . The thick walls of this very sweet pepper contribute to good keeping quality once fruit is mature.

peppers.name: QUINTISHO
peppers.description: An unusual pepper from Bolivia. The round, yellow-orange fruits resemble a tiny cherry tomato.

peppers.name: RABBIT MOUTH
peppers.description: 5x2½" tapered, smooth red fruits with end the shape of a rabbit's nose; sweet, thick flesh.

peppers.name: RAIN FOREST
peppers.description: C. baccatum; flattened, red habanaro-shaped 2x2½" hot fruits with strong citrusy flavor; very productive.

peppers.name: RAIN FOREST TRICOLOR
peppers.description: A spectacular container plant from the rain forests of Central America, the plant displays a never ending array of variegated foliage, each leaf will exhibit shades of white, green and purple with no two leaves looking alike. Also features purple stems and blooms. Bears loads of hot fruits that turn from deep purple to bright red when mature. 10 seeds,

peppers.name: RAJAS PRIDE
peppers.description: Raja's Pride is a Cayenne type which produces long 4in pods which mature from light green red. Much milder than standard Cayennes.

peppers.name: RAMNAD MUNDU (RAT TURD)
peppers.description:
Ramnad Mundu Grown in Ramnad district of Tamilnadu, India Yellowish red and 
hot when ripe. Also known as Rat turd.

peppers.name: RANGER
peppers.description: Sweet/bell hybrid. Plants similar to Keystone resisant giant (75 days)

peppers.name: RAT TAIL
peppers.description: A 4 to 6 in long by 0.75in wide Cayenne type variety that matures from lime green to red.

peppers.name: RED BEAUTY
peppers.description: A hybridised red bell pepper variety widely adapted to reliably turn red in almost any area of the country. Very thick-walled, heavy fruits are blocky, and about 4 inches long. Heavy yields of bright red sweet peppers. Resistant to tobacco mosaic virus.

peppers.name: RED FIRE (CAP 691)
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note: The CAP classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at a research institution in Germany.

peppers.name: SWEET CHERRY
peppers.description: These 1 1/2in round Cherry shaped fruits turn from deep green to red approximatety 78 days after transplanting and have medium-thick walls. Used in salads and for pickling.

peppers.name: RED IMPERATOR F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: Red Imperator F1 is a half-long pepper, quite large in size and very productive, already popular in Europe. It can be grown in open field as well as greenhouses or tunnels. The peppers mature from deep green to red.

peppers.name: JAWAHAR (GRIF 15318)
peppers.description: An indian Cayenne type pepper. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: RED KNIGHT X3R
peppers.description: A hybridised  bell pepper variety. These big, heavy blocky peppers measure 4-1/2 inches long and wide, and mature from geen (65 days)  to red  (80 days).  This variety has protection against three races of bacterial leaf spot and two pepper viruses, and features a more compact plant habit than similar varieties.

peppers.name: PI 639652 (GRIF 15050)
peppers.description: This low growing shruby variety can reach up to 1m tall and is profusely branched. The flowers are white and the 1cm long pods mature from black to red. The pods are extremely piquant.

peppers.name: RED RAMIRO
peppers.description: Long thick fleshed sweet pepper up to 10 inches long. Matures from green through to red.

peppers.name: REDSKIN F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: A true dwarf bell pepper although still a 'big brother' to the Mohawk. This plant has a compact habit growing to 30-40cm in height making it ideal for a patio container plant. This attractive plant produces medium sized 4 to 5" fruit which mature from green to red. A safe choice and a high yielder.

peppers.name: RELLENO ITALIAN SWEET
peppers.description: A delicious Anaheim type chile from Italy. The plant produces good yields of 4 to 7in long by 0.75 to 1in wide pendant shaped pods which mature from green to red approximately 75 days after transplanting

peppers.name: REN HOT
peppers.description: This nice ornamental variety is similar to 'Pequin Frecracker' and produces a multitude of upright 1 to 1.5in long by 0.75in wide mutlicoloured pods which mature from pale yellow with purple blotches to orange and finally to red.

peppers.name: RIO TERIBE
peppers.description: 2x½" blocky fruits held upright; leaves dark green.Collected in wild by Bob Howe & Amy Wolf, summer 1999 along tributary of the Rio Teribe approximately 500 m from border of Parque de National La Amistad, Bocas del Toro Province, Panama.

peppers.name: RIOT
peppers.description: This is a highly ornamental variety developed by Dr. James Baggett at Oregon State University, USA.  The small bushy little plants produces a profussion of fiery spikes of colourful thin upright pods which almost explode with colour. The well-exposed pods ripen steadily over a long period for a continuing rainbow-colored display.  50 days to yellow & 70 daysto ripe red. A great container plant for the kitchen or patio.

peppers.name: ROBUSTINI PEPPERONCINI
peppers.description: This is a hybridised Pepperoncini variety.  The pods are typically 2 to 3 inches long with either lobed or slightly pointed tips. Harvest the thin-walled peppers when they are a yellowish light green and pack into jars with white vinegar. Peppers will become lighter in colour over time. Prolific harvests. 62 days.

peppers.name: ROCOPICA
peppers.description: A hybridised variety which resulted from a cross between a Rocoto (Pubescens)and an Ulupica (Cardenasii). The pods are round like ulupica pods but are quite a bit larger (1cm).  Flowers are less fluted (more like a rocoto). The taste of the peppers is pure ulupica

peppers.name: ROCOTILLO
peppers.description: Rocotillo exists both as a baccatum and chinense. A maturing Baccatum pod is shown here. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: ROCOTO CANARIO (YELLOW)
peppers.description: Probably the most famous of the Pubescens species, its history lies in the Andes region of Peru where it is also known as 'Manzano', meaning apple due the shape of the fruit. It is also called Locoto in Bolivia, Chilli Peron, Chilli Caballo and Chilli Ciruelo. The most distinguishing feature of these peppers are their black seeds. The peppers themselves are very pungent, approx 2in long and 1 1/2in wide and resemble miniture bell peppers and this variety matures in colour from green to yellow. Rocotos can be a slow to germinate, so be sure to keep the soil temperature above 75F, although once mature these plants are very resistant to low temperatures. Rocotos are at their best when eaten fresh and should be left on the plant until needed.

peppers.name: ROCOTO ORANGE
peppers.description: Probably the most famous of the Pubescens species, its history lies in the Andes region of Peru where it is also known as 'Manzano', meaning apple due the shape of the fruit. It is also called Locoto in Bolivia,  Chilli Peron, Chilli Caballo and Chilli Ciruelo. The most distinguishing feature of these peppers are their black seeds. The peppers themselves are very pungent, approx 2in long and 1 1/2in wide and resemble miniture bell peppers and this variety matures in colour from green to orange. Rocotos can be a slow  to germinate, so be sure to keep the soil temperature above 75F, although once mature these plants are very resistant to low temperatures.  Rocotos are at their best when eaten fresh and should be left on the plant until needed.

peppers.name: ROCOTO RED (ROJO)
peppers.description: Probably the most famous of the Pubescens species, its history lies in the Andes region of Peru where it is also known as 'Manzano', meaning apple due the shape of the fruit. It is also called Locoto in Bolivia,  Chilli Peron, Chilli Caballo and Chilli Ciruelo. The most distinguishing feature of these peppers are their black seeds. The peppers themselves are very pungent, approx 2in long and 1 1/2in wide and resemble miniture bell peppers and this variety matures in colour from green to red. Rocotos can be a slow  to germinate, so be sure to keep the soil temperature above 75F, although once mature these plants are very resistant to low temperatures.  Rocotos are at their best when eaten fresh and should be left on the plant until needed.

peppers.name: CUNEO GIALLO
peppers.description: A bell pepper variety. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: ROMANIAN SWEET
peppers.description: A Romanian heirloom chile with 8-9cm blocky pods.Romanian Sweet Peppers start out ivory-colored, turn orange, then mature to red. All three color stages can appear at the same time, making a stunning display in your garden. Traditionally harvested when ivory and fried. Plants are prolific and  are ideal for growing indoors or on a windowsill..

peppers.name: ROOSTER SPUR
peppers.description: Also called 'Hot Claw', 'Takanotsume' and 'Hahong Kocho', this is a small pepper from Japan and China that is very piquant. The little 3in long slender firecrackers grow upright on a 2ft busy plant are mature from light green to bright red. Used in stir fry and Szechwan dishes, and often dried.

peppers.name: MULATO COSTENO
peppers.description: This variety is a large pepper of the classic Mulato type which is grow extensively in the Northern regions of Mexico. The 6-7in long peppers are wide at the shoulders and taper to a point and mature from a dark green to a dark chocolate almost black shade. This large plant is very hardy and holds up well in tough growing conditions

peppers.name: ROUND OF HUNGARY
peppers.description: A Pimento type cheese pepper that has ribbed, flattened fruits that mature early.These distinctive fruits ripen from green (55 days) to red (75 days) and the thick flesh has a distinctive sweet taste. Ideal for stuffing or used fresh in salads.

peppers.name: ROYAL BLACK
peppers.description: Tasty, hot and elegant 'Royal Black' makes a beautiful backdrop in any flower bed. The foliage and stems of this 3ft plant are dark-purple, almost black and have a strong oriental quality with an occasional variegated growing tip of green, purple, and creamy white. The undersides of the leaves are green with purple venation. The bullet shaped 1 1/2in  long by 1/2 in wide pods start off upright before gravity takes it course. They are initially a very dark purple/black before ripening to red approximately 90 days after transplanting. When ripe they add a further accent to this stunning plant, appearing like crown jewels on a botanical tapestry of deep purple. ## VERY UNUSUAL AND HIGHLY RECOMMENDED ##.

peppers.name: ROYAL GOLD (PI 315023)
peppers.description: One of Cross Country Nurseries version of the Yellow Habanero.

peppers.name: RUSSIAN
peppers.description: Low set of 1-1.5" narrow, upright red fruits on 3-4' plant

peppers.name: SAE LO NA GUN GO CHU
SAE MA EUL KEUM JANG GO CHU
SAFI
peppers.description: The Safi Chile is an African strain of Scotch Bonnet with a high level of pungency and flavour. The plant is 60 to 80 cm high, with dense medium green foliage. The pods are a globular-square shape with a dented surface and measure approximately 5cm long by 4cm in diameter. One of the brightest red chiles available when mature, the pods initially start off light green. The unintiated should not however be fooled by this chiles beauty as it is amongst the hottest available.

peppers.name: SALMON
peppers.description: Fruits are elongated, with slightly rounded end, 5 to 6 cm long, 0,8 cm diameter. Fruit colour is bright green to vivid red at maturity.. Upright compact plant habit, perfect for containers. Upright fruits, concentrated in clusters.

peppers.name: SAN FELIPE
peppers.description: From San Felipe Pueblo, New Mexico USA hence the name. Medium to medium-hot. 3-4" long when mature

peppers.name: SAN JOSE MARKET
peppers.description: x1" tapered, ridged pendent red fruits on 1½' tall x 2½' wide plants; hot with smokey-tropical fruit aroma.

peppers.name: SANTA FE GRANDE
peppers.description: This medium sized attractive open pollinated variety produce a very heavy crop of conical shaped thick walled 3in fruits which have a pendant habit. The peppers start off as a pale yellow colour, before maturing to either a brilliant orange colour or to a very fiery red approximately 75 days after transplanting. The peppers have a slightly sweet taste and are about the same heat as a Jalapeno (5000 to 8000 scoville heat units) and are delicious fresh, and also perfect for pickling. ## AN EXCELLENT COOKING VARIETY ##

peppers.name: SANTAKA
peppers.description: Also know as 'Asian Hot', this mirasol type chile plant (meaning the fruits point towards the sun) produces small upright clusters of  2 inches long X 1/8 inch in diameter peppers that mature from green to red approximately 70 days after transplanting. The plant is white flowering and can produce upto 40 pods when started indoors  A must for Asian food fanatics and particularly good for adding a little heat to a bland stir frie.

peppers.name: SAPPORO
peppers.description: A mild tasting 4 to 5 in long Cayenne type pepper which matures from green to red

peppers.name: SCOTCH BONNET
peppers.description: Very closely related to the Habanero chile, the Scotch Bonnet (or Bahamian, Bahama Mama, Jamaican Hot or Martinique Pepper) is just about as hot.  It has a similar apple-cherry tomato flavour. Like the Habanero, it is spherical, although rather more squashed in shape and it is smaller, 3.25-4 cm in diameter. Native to the Caribbean, it is available in the UK in green, yellow, orange, white, brown and red as well as multi-toned.

peppers.name: SBJ7
peppers.description: This is reported to be a cross between a Scotch Bonnet and a 7 Pod Jonah, hence the name SBJ7. This variety is closely linked to the 7 Pot/Pod and Trinidad Scorpion landrace varieties. It may or may not be a different variety.

peppers.name: HABANERO BIG SUN
peppers.description: The Big Sun is an African family member of the Habanero family but with larger fruits. The wrinkled fruits are approximately 6cm long and 5cm wide and have astrong fruity flavour. They grow on a bushy plant and mature from a dark green colour to a fantastic vivid yellow. 300,000 SHU

peppers.name: SCOTCH BONNET BURKINA YELLOW
peppers.description: The Burkina Yellow Chilli is an African strain of the famous Scotch Bonnet hot pepper.  The Plant produces heavy yields of 1 ¾" long by 1 ½" wide wrinkled hot peppers that are an elongated pointed lantern shape with a dented surface. They mature from light green to a beautiful lemon yellow approximately 80-100 days after seedlings emerge. A rare variety and a collectors dream.

peppers.name: SCOTCH BONNET CHOCOLATE
peppers.description: Jamaican pepper with hot, fruity and smoky flavour. Has the smell and taste of a Caribbean Red. Ripens from dark green to a chocolate brown. Thick flesh pod and deeply ribbed. About 120-180 days from germination to ripe fruit, depending on growing conditions. (Capsicum chinense Jacq.).

peppers.name: SCOTCH BONNET RED
peppers.description: This very hot, firey variety produces globular shaped fruits which ripen from pale green to bright red.The plant has a short bushy plant habit and is  late maturing. Approximately 100,000 - 300,000 scoville heat units (SHU)

peppers.name: SCOTCH BONNET SWEET
peppers.description: A rare pepper from Jeff Nekola's collection and one for the serious chile enthusiast. As the name suggests this is a Scotch Bonnet pepper without the heat. Short bushy plants bear little wrinkled orange peppers with an amazing fruity taste. The smell from a single cut pepper will permeate the whole room! The flavour is hard to describe, but is unlike any other pepper, and really nice - makes incredible pasta sauce.

peppers.name: SEAGEM
peppers.description: 11/2 long by 1/2 wide, very hot, great for adding to curry or stews and is ideal for drying for chile powder or for mixing with vinegar for a hot sauce or to use fresh in a salad.

peppers.name: SEÑORITA
peppers.description: A very mild hybridised version of a Jalapeno pepper measuring only 400 or so units on the scoville heat scale (the regular Jalapeno has 5,000 scoville units). Also larger than Jalapeno - this one has peppers about 3 inches long. Very useful for cooking Mexican cuisine when less heat is desired. 60 days.

peppers.name: SENTRY
peppers.description: A new green to yellow blocky sweet pepper hybrid from PETO (75 days)

peppers.name: SERRANO
peppers.description: Serrano translated to English means 'from the mountains', after the mountain ridges of Puebla and Hidalgo in Mexico from where it is thought to have orginated. These bullet shaped chiles grow up to 6cm long, are thick fleshed and mature from lime green to red approximately 85 days after transplanting.  The pods grow on tall 30in plants which have distinctive fuzzy leaves. The pods can be eaten in their green or red form and in general have medium pungency with the various strains measuring anywhere from 2500 to 23000 scoville units.

peppers.name: SERRANO BALIN
peppers.description: A young immature pod shown here. Balin means 'bullet', a more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: SERRANO DEL SOL
peppers.description:
This hybridised serrano variety boasts fruit that is twice the size and two to three weeks earlier than the original. This small bushy plant has the distinctive hairy leaves and is a prolific producer of cylindrical shaped 3-3 1/2" fruits that mature from dark green (55 days) to scarlet red (75 days)
The peppers are fleshy and meaty with the unique Serrano flavor so popular in Mexican cuisine. Measuring about 5,000 Scoville units, they are about the same pungency as a jalapeño, and are quite versatile for sauces, salsas, or flavoring.

peppers.name: SERRANO PURPLE
peppers.description: This is a beautiful purple-fruited version of Serrano. Peppers are a little longer than those of regular Serrano, but the same candle-flame shape. Instead of turning red at maturity, they become deep purple. Plants are tall and branching with the fuzzy foliage typical of Serranos. The plant also produces stunning, large purple flowers with darkpurple/black anthers. Wonderful for salsas as well as eating fresh. 85 days.

peppers.name: SERRANO TAMPIQUEÑO
peppers.description: There is a reason you see so many recipes for Mexican or hot food using Serrano Tampiqueno peppers -- they have a distinctive and unique hot flavor, excellent for many dishes. The plants are big, 2' to 3' wide and tall and the club shaped fruist have a distinctive hot and pungent flavour. 2500 to 4000 SHU (75 days)

peppers.name: SHEEPNOSE PIMIENTO
peppers.description: An Ohio heirloom from the family of Nick Rini.  A multitude of sweet, juicy cheese pimento 3x4" fruits are produced on sturdy 2 foot plants. (70-80 days)

peppers.name: SHEETAL-51
peppers.description: An Indian Cayenne type pepper. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: SHISHITO
peppers.description: These japanese baby sized sweet glossy peppers are approximately 3 to 4in long by 0.5in wide. They ripen from green to red. They are best picked when green and are used in tempura Japanese cuisine.

peppers.name: SHOROKSHARI
peppers.description: Heavy set of 4x3" tapered, erect fruits turning from light yellow to orange to red; 1½x1½' plants with dark purple leaf nodes.

peppers.name: SIGARETTA
peppers.description: Also known as the Cigarette chile, this Calabrian variety from Italy produces 2 inch long, thin, red pods

peppers.name: SILING BILOG
peppers.description: Siling' is the Flipino word for capsicums in general. Siling Bilog is a Bell Pepper type

peppers.name: SILING LABUYO (PI 281421)
peppers.description: Siling' is the Flipino word for capsicums in general. The pods are very small and thin and look like mini tabasco pods. They grow erect on the plant, measure approximately 0.5in long x 0.15in wide and mature from green to red.  It is sometimes though to be a Frutescens

peppers.name: SINDHUR (GRIF 15379)
peppers.description: An Indian Cayenne type pepper. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: SINGAPORE
peppers.description: A 3 to 5in long Cayenne type pepper which is used in Oriental Cuisine. The long slender, thin skinned,  pendant pods mature from green to red.

peppers.name: SINGH 4
peppers.description: An Indian Cayenne type pepper. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: PI 551886
peppers.description: This variety is more accurately part of the sub species Capsicum annuum var. glabriusculum. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: SIZZLER
peppers.description: A hybridised Cayenne type.,The 12-13cm wrinkled bodies fruits mature from green to red

peppers.name: SLADKI FEFERONI
peppers.description: A very rare Slovenian variety, the name Sladki Feferoni literally translates to mean 'Sweet Pepper'. Also known as 'Slovenian Paprika' peppers, these tall vigorous plants produce an abundance of long, slim sweet green peppers that mature to a rich red color. An ideal pepper for pickling.

peppers.name: SLIM JIM
peppers.description: Very heavy set of 7-8"x3" red, meaty, moderately hot fruits. Originally by Burpee.

peppers.name: SONORA
peppers.description: Excellent yields and uniform large fruit characterize this Anaheim-type pepper. Smooth, thick fleshed fruit is 8 inches long and 1-1/2 inches wide, and dark green maturing to red approximately 75 days after transplanting. Mildly pungent (300 to 600 Scoville units) peppers are excellent for drying. Medium-sized plants are tobacco mosaic virus (TMV) resistant.

peppers.name: SOROKSARI
peppers.description: A Balkan heirloom pepper. This is a robust, medium-sized pepper, with large, prism-shaped fruit, clear yellow in color. Will turn red/orange when fully ripe and can be dried for a delightful paprika. Flesh is sweet and quite thick. Early and productive as the harvest will continue until autumn.

peppers.name: SOVERATO
peppers.description:
The full name of this variety is "peperoncino di Soverato" that means "pepper from Soverato", a town in Calabria, southern Italy. The peperoncino di soverato is probably the most famous hot pepper from Italy. Unfortunately it does not exist!  Until a couple of years ago nobody knew this pepper, but these days everyone in Italy knows it. Why?
Franco Neri is a comic that created a funny character from Soverato. This character loved peppers, especially the one from his home town, and he continuously talked about this mythic pepper.
The character was very funny and became famous, making this peperoncino very well known. The town of Soverato took this chance to increase the revenue from tourism, and now you can find all kinds of “peperoncino di Soverato” with different shapes, heat, colors etc.

In conclusion, we cannot say it is a variety yet, but the name “peperoncino di Soverato” has to be intended as a generic name indicating all the peppers grown in the Soverato region.

peppers.name: SPAGNOLIN
peppers.description: A North Italian Heirloom. Plant produces a good yield of small marble sized upright pods which mature from Green to Red. Very Rare.

peppers.name: SPANISH SPICE
peppers.description: A hybridised F1 Anaheim type variety.  These 7 inch long tapered peppers have a spicy Mediterranean flavor that is neither hot nor sweet.  They look something like a wrinkled Anaheim chile and are great for grilling or frying because their thin walls cook quickly. 63 to 68 days.

peppers.name: RED SQUASH (PI 281424)
peppers.description: Also called Cheese or Tomato peppers, the squash type is best known for its flying saucer shaped pods. It is believed to be a Habanero relative and has that sneaky delayed heat although not quite as intense as the Habanero. The Red Squash is an easier to grow pepper than the habaneros and is a quicker more dependable producer. The pods have a nice fruity flavour.

peppers.name: ST HELENA ISLAND-ACORN
peppers.description: Low set of 1" upright, spherical fruits on 5' plant; very attractive. From Southern Atlantic Island of same name.

peppers.name: ST HELENA ISLAND RED
peppers.description: Huge quantities of narrow, sinuous, 2-2.5" bright red fruits on 5' plant. From Southern Atlantic Island of same name.

peppers.name: ST HELENA ISLAND YELLOW
peppers.description: Upright, smooth, 1.5"x.75" bright orange-yellow hot fruits on rather small plant; looks much like a small, yellow Jalapeno; very attractive.

peppers.name: ST LUCIA RED SEASONING
peppers.description: This variety is a mildly pungent and very flavoursome Habanero type variety from the island of St Lucia in the Caribbean. The wrinkled 1.5 to 2.5in long by 1in wide pendant pods  matures from yellow green to orange and finally to red.

peppers.name: ST LUCIA YELLOW SEASONING
peppers.description: This variety is a mildly pungent and very flavoursome Habanero type variety from the island of St Lucia in the Caribbean. The wrinkled 1.5 to 2.5in long by 1in wide pendant pods mature from green to yellow.

peppers.name: STARBURST
peppers.description: A profusion of colorful peppers light up dwarf plants, with 2-inch long fruit so abundant that it nearly obscures the foliage. Pale yellow peppers turn deeper yellow, then orange, and finally red, with all color stages appearing at once on the same plant. This is a very pretty, compact ornamental pepper well suited to garden borders or container growing. 75 days. Very similar to 'Riot' and 'Medusa'

peppers.name: STRIPE
peppers.description: This variety is very similar (if not the same as) the 'fish pepper'. Further information is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: JALAPENO SUCHITO SOLERITO
peppers.description: 1½x3/4' pendent, red Jalapeno fruits with longitudinal fissures across entire surface; plant 1x1'.

peppers.name: SUELIN
peppers.description: The fruit has thickish flesh and grows to 4 to 6 inches in length starting out green and turning red when mature.

peppers.name: SUJATA
peppers.description: Heavy bearing. Yellowish turning to a light red at maturity. 2.5 to 3.0 inches in length.

peppers.name: SUNBRIGHT YELLOW
peppers.description: A yellow sister to the big red. A high-yielder with thick, 5x7 inch diameter fruits start out green before ripening to a cheerful yellow (75 days)

peppers.name: ORANGE SWEET
peppers.description: Pretty rare variety that matures early to a bright yellow/orange (70 days)

peppers.name: SUPER CHILLI
peppers.description: This very productive low spreading habit hybridisaed F1 variety is an excellent choice as an ornamental variety of for the kitchen gardener. One plant can produce upto 300 pods which are very pungent measuring between 30000 to 50000 schoville heat units. The 2 1/2" x 1/2 pods  and similar in shape and size to 'Thai Dragon' but they have a thinner skin. The pods ripens from light green to orange and finally to red approximately 75 days after transplanting. They can be used fresh, dry or pickled

peppers.name: SUPER SHEPHERD
peppers.description: An Italian sweet pepper. The conical shaped pods grow 3-4in in length and  ripen from green to red approximately  65-70 days after transplanting

peppers.name: SURYAMKHI CLUSTER (C05832)
peppers.description: Suryamukhi Cluster (Surya) Small fruits 1/4 inch across and 1 inch long and are bright red and very pungent. From East India.

peppers.name: SWEET CHOCOLATE
peppers.description: A sweet bell pepper type. A delicious, medium sized, tomato shaped fruit. The thick flesh starts out a glossy green, eventually maturing to a wonderful chocolate-brown colour in 56-80 days. The only early brown sweet pepper.

peppers.name: SWEET GIANT F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: A true Hungarian sweet stuffing pepper (65 days)

peppers.name: SWEET HAVANA
peppers.description: A hybridised Cubanella type variety that  matures earlier and  is more abundant, and has a sweeter taste than open-pollinated types. Fruit is either 3 or 4-lobed, about 5 inches long, and thicker-walled than older varieties. 63 days.

peppers.name: SWEET WRINKLED OLD MAN
peppers.description: Also known as Sweet Hot Pepperoncini, plants are approx 2ft tall and covered in 2-4ins thin wrinkled fruits, at their hottest when red.

peppers.name: SZECHWAN
peppers.description: A 3.5 to 4.5in long by 0.25in wide Cayenne type variety used extensively in  oriental cuisine. These long thin walled slender pods mature from green to red.

peppers.name: SZEGEDI CSIPOS (BUDAI CSIPOS)
peppers.description: This pepper had thick flesh, moderate heat with a hint of sweetness. 'Csipos" means hot in Hungarian.

peppers.name: SZENTESI
peppers.description: Originally from Hungary, this wedge-shaped sweet pepper starts out white then deepens to orange and red when fully ripe. The Pendant fruits are about 4-1/2 inches long with thick, sweet flesh, and is produced in great abundance, even when weather is cooler or conditions are less than ideal. 75 days.

peppers.name: SZENTESI SEMI-HOT
peppers.description: he one for producing paprika! A popular early producing variety producing warm lime green stocky tapered peppers. The fruits ripen through yellow to orange and then red. They are spicy without being anywhere near overpowering. A Hungarian Wax type capsicum annum variety. 2000SHU

peppers.name: TABASCO (PI 586675)
peppers.description: Tabasco peppers are the only types of Capsicum frutescens that are well known in North America. These fiery little jewels are the primary ingrediant in tabasco sauce, the famous hot sauce that has been produced in southern Louisiana since 1848 when the peppers were first imported from the State of Tabasco in Mexico. Growers today cannot keep up with demand and tabasco peppers are imported from Columbia and Central America to be mashed in Louisiana. The tabasco plant can grow upto 4-6 feet tall and is just loaded with slender 1.5in upright pods which mature from light green to orange and then to red approximately 75 days after transplanting. Originally from somewhat swampy regions it prefers hot and humid conditions for maximum productivity. 50,000-80,000 SHU.

peppers.name: PI 441687 (BGH 1279)
peppers.description: Fruits 1/2in  x1/4in which mature from green to red. Further information is not available at this time. Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: TABASCO GREENLEAF
peppers.description: The 'Greenleaf' Tabasco developed by Auburn University in Alabama USA is very similar to the regular Tabasco, but has been bred to be resistant to tobacco etch virus (TEV)  The pods are 1 to 1.25 inches long by 0.25 to 0.375 inches wide grow upright and mature from yellow to orange to red. Very prolific producing upto 100 pods per plant.

peppers.name: TABASCO HAWAIIAN
peppers.description: A mature pod shown here. Description currently unavailable.

peppers.name: TABASCO SHORT YELLOW
peppers.description: heavy set of pendent 1x'1/3" smooth, blunt-tipped orange fruits on 1x1' plants with small leaves; looks almost exactly like Orange Pekoe, but has small greenish flowers

peppers.name: TAKANOTSUME
peppers.description: This hot variety meaning 'Claw of the Eagle' is a very popular chile in Japan. The plant grows 18-20 inches tall by 18-20 inches wide and yields 2 to 3 inches long by .25 to .375 inches wide upright clusters of pods which mature from green to red. Often used dry in Japanese cuisine. Very similar - if not the same as Poinsettia.

peppers.name: JALAPENO TAM VERA CRUZ F1
peppers.description: The TAM Jalapeno Chile is a development of Texas A&M University in Texas and was developed with the goal of producing an Jalapeno Chile with a much milder taste. With that goal, they succeeded as the fruits are only 1000 to 3500 on the scoville heat scale. These 2ft plants produce an abundance of dark green, 3 inch long chiles that are every bit identical to a standard Jalapeno and mature from green to red inapproximately 70-80 days.  Called Chipotle when smoked.

peppers.name: TANGERINE
peppers.description: A 1.5 to 2in long by 2.5 to 3.5in wide bell pepper variety which  matures from green to bright orange.

peppers.name: PI 438532
peppers.description: Pods are  pungent, red, 2.5cm wide, 3cm long.

peppers.name: TAURUS
peppers.description: A 3 to 5in long by 3 to 3.5in wide 4 lobed Bellpepper variety which matures from green to red approximately 80 days after transplanting. This  thick-walled , mid-season variety is resistant to TMV and TEV.

peppers.name: TAWNY PORT
peppers.description: A hybridised bell pepper variety which produces beautiful, extra-large bell peppers which ripen to a rich mahogany colour that is just the colour of port wine (hence the name).  While there are a number of chocolate-colored peppers on the market, Tawny Port is one of only a few with this reddish-brown color.  The peppers are four-lobed, about 5 inches long and 4 inches wide with thick walls and a sweet, delicious taste.  75 days.

peppers.name: TEARS OF FIRE HYBRID
peppers.description: This bushy well branched plants produces thick fleshed, teardrop shaped cherry peppers which mature from green to chocolate to red. The peppers can be picked at any stage of maturity. 30,000+ scoville heat ubits

peppers.name: TIEN TSIN (PI 478355)
peppers.description: These chiles are in important ingredient for Sichuan cooking. the plants are said to be virus-free, but have a reputation for being low yielding.The pods are Cayenne like (but smaller and mature from green to red.

peppers.name: TEJAWSWINI
peppers.description: A rare heavy bearing hybrid measuring 3.5 inches long and 1 inch wide. Color is green to red.

peppers.name: TEPIN
peppers.description: This variety is more accurately part of the annuum var. glabriusculum species. These little gems are also called chiletepin, bird's eye or bird peppers. The are one of the hottest peppers available, some say they are hotter than habaneros, but at that level, who cares! They grow wild in Mexico and the southern U.S. (including Florida), but are difficult to get to germinate in the home garden. (The seeds germinate readily after passing through a bird's digestive system, though.) These tall elegent plants produce small marble like peppers less than 1cm in diameter and tend to fruit best in second year and should be brought indoors to overwinter. Traditionally, they are harvested by breaking off whole branches and letting the little balls of fire dry before shaking them off and in Mexico tepins are used to season just about everything on the table. ## HIGHLY RECOMMENDED FOR HEAT LOVERS ##

peppers.name: TEQUILA
peppers.description: A hybridised bell pepper variety. This beautiful amethyst pepper from Holland is the best lavender variety we've seen. Fruit sets early and grows to a blocky 4-1/2 inches deep and 4 inches across. Peppers begin as lavender and stay that color for a long time before fading to a lovely orange, then finally red. All colours are jewel-like and very attractive. Strong plants are tobacco mosaic virus resistant and tolerant to blossom end rot. 72 days.

peppers.name: TEQUILA SUNRISE
peppers.description: An edible ornamental variety. 4in long Carrot shaped fruit are produced on a sturdy 12-16in plant which do not require staking. The flesh is thin, crunchy and has a sweet slightly sharp flavor when ripe. The fruits ripen from deep green to a beautiful golden orange colour (60-78 days).

peppers.name: THAI BIRDSEYE
peppers.description: Very productive and resilient plants produce masses of hot, thin skinned, tapering chillies similar to the often seen Bird Eye chilli. Easy and quick to bear fruit,

peppers.name: THAI DRAGON
peppers.description: Elongated fruits with pointed end, more or less wrinkled, 3 to 5 cm long, 0,8 cm diameter. Fruits are generally pendant. Fruit colour is dark green to vivid red at full maturity. Upright plant habit.

peppers.name: TINY TIM
peppers.description: This wonderful little 1' foot compact bush produces  2+ dozen mildly hot, upright, 2" bell-shaped fruits, turning red on maturity

peppers.name: THAI HOT
peppers.description: These compact, mound-shaped plants have tiny leaves and grow no more than 1 foot tall. They become covered with very hot, 1/2 to 1 inch long red fruit that is held upright on the plant, creating quite a showy display. Used mainly as an ornamental, but fruit is edible although hot. 90 days

peppers.name: THAI GIANT
peppers.description: These 2-3in long conical shaped peppers ripen from from a deep green  to deep red approximately 65 days after transplanting. For the spiciest fruit it should be harvested when the soil is on the dry side. Approximately 6,000 scoville heat units (SHU)

peppers.name: THAI ORANGE
peppers.description: The plants grow to about 2 or 2.5 feet and are prolific producers of bright orange long thin peppers which ripen early and are very pungent.

peppers.name: THAI SUN
peppers.description: This miniature compact, mound shaped plant only grows ten to twelve inches high and about one foot wide. The half to one inch peppers grow facing the sun. One plant has literally hundreds of small edible very hot chiles. The Chiles ripen early and produce all season long.

peppers.name: THAI YELLOW
peppers.description: The golden-yellow version of the Thai pepper. Fruit is also very hot and flavorful. Used less than the red chili, these are still seen in most every market in Thailand.

peppers.name: THE GODFATHER HYBRID
peppers.description: A sweet tasting Cubanelle Italian frying pepper. These pendant shaped chiles are typically 5 to 7in long by 1 to 1.5in wide and ripen from green to red. A beautiful variety for roasting or use in stir-fries.

peppers.name: THOR F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: Thor F1 a hybrid Italian sweet pepper, large fruits ideal for stuffing, roasting  etc delicious sweet flavour. Peppers ripen from green to red.

peppers.name: TIBURHON
peppers.description: A hybridised F1 bell pepper variety. These big sturdy plants bear good yields of heavy fruit well off the ground. The fruits are  large, glossy and initially dark green in colour before ripening to red approximately 85 days after transplanting.

peppers.name: TINNEVELLY
peppers.description: A Casabel type grown in India

peppers.name: TINY SAMOA
peppers.description: This prolific pequin type produces good yields of ¾" long by ¼" very hot peppers which ripen from green to red approximately 90 days after transplanting. This plant has green stems, green leaves, and white flowers. A good choice for a decroative indoor potted plant.

peppers.name: TOBAGO BELL
peppers.description: Good set of 2x3½" upright, tapered, smooth red fruits with fairly blunt end; relatively thin flesh.

peppers.name: TOKYO HOT
peppers.description: This F1 hybridised variety is very prolific producing  pencil thin cayenne typpe peppers which mature from dark green to red fruits. The pods have a sweet and spicy hot flavour. Around 20-30,000 scovilles heat units (SHU).

peppers.name: TOLITO (PI 631137)
peppers.description:
Also known as Torolito. This chiltepin type berry was collected at the foot of a volcano called de Agua in Sacatepequez, Guatemalaand and has most of the chiltepins characteristics.

Accession was received 1998 as a Capsicum annuum and assigned a PI # 2002, reclassified as Capsicum frutescens 2006 and again reclassified as Capsicum annuum   var. glabriusculum.

50,000 - 85,000 SHU

peppers.name: TOLLIES SWEET ITALIAN
peppers.description: A heirloom, Italian type sweet pepper that produces large dependable yields of 4-5in tapered fruits which start out green and ripen to deep red (75-85 days). Plants are very easy to grow, ideal for a beginner.

peppers.name: TOPAZ
peppers.description: This is an F1 hybrid varieity chile. The Aji like pendant shaped pods start off bright greenbefore  ripening to an attractive yellowish/orange. Very pungent.

peppers.name: TOPEPO ROSSO
peppers.description: This Italian heirloom produces tasty, blood red, round pimento-type peppers that are very sweet. The flesh is very thick and crisp. Short, compact plants produce huge yields; great fresh or cooked. A wonderful specialty variety that has many uses.

peppers.name: TOPITO CHEESE
peppers.description: An early Pimiento type. Fruits are ruffled and round (82 days). Also known as Tennessee Cheese

peppers.name: TOTHL
peppers.description: A sweet tasting bell pepper which matures from creamy white to red.

peppers.name: TRINIDAD PERFUME
peppers.description: This habanero type variety produces 1 to 1.5 in long by 1 to 1.25in wide 'turks cap' type pods which matures from green to bright yellow. The pods have a fantastic aroma and good smoky flavour with no heat.

peppers.name: TRINIDAD SEASONING
peppers.description: Also known as Tobago Seasoning, Trinidad Red or Trinidad Yellow. This variety is from the same family as the Habanero but with very low heat (500 SHU). The pods mature from yellow to red in 90 days.

peppers.name: TRUPTI
peppers.description: A 4 to 6 in long indian cayenne type pepper which  matures from green to red. The slender pendant pods are often curved like a fishhook

peppers.name: TSILÉ SAN JUAN
peppers.description: This is a mild Anaheim variety grown in the San Juan pueblo, New Mexico (hence the name). The pods are average 2.5 to 3in long by 1 to 1.25in wide and  mature from green to red.

peppers.name: JALAPENO TULA F1
peppers.description: A jumbo Jalopeno hybrid from PETO. This variety is said to produces good yields of Giant Jalapeno hot peppers. Peppers are hot and turn from green to red when mature. Excellent when used fresh or pickled. Plant has green stems, dark green leaves, and white flowers. 4000 to 6000 SHU

peppers.name: TULIP
peppers.description: These appear virtually the same as 'Balloon'. However further information is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: TURKS CAP
peppers.description: Distinctive looking pepper which matures to an orange-yellow. Looks like a Turkish cap.

peppers.name: TUSTE BLANCO (CAP 1086)
peppers.description: This is one of the Zapotec Indian peppers from Southern Oaxaca, Mexico. The immature peppers are more of an ivory color than pure white, turning yellow, peach, and finally red. The skin is tough so it would probably be best used dried and ground.

peppers.name: TUXTLAS
peppers.description: This is a hybridised Serrano variety from southern Mexico. This plant produces a concentrated set of 3in long by 0.5in wide cyclindrical peppers which mature from green to red approximately 65-70 days after seedlings have emerged. This variety has good disease resistance to PVY and TMV.

peppers.name: EXPLOSIVE IGNITE
peppers.description: Small 1-2in, slender,  thinskinned snakelike pods grow erect on an 8-12in compact plant. These pods are hot and certainly live up to their name.

peppers.name: ULUPICA (PI 573336)
peppers.description: Ulupica is the local name for wild species Eximium and Cardensaii and is found in Bolivia and Peru. It is thought to be the origin progenitor of all  Capsicums. The Ulupica is closely related to the Rocoto but grows to only 1/2 its size. The pods are very small (1/2in x 1/8in) and egg shaped and ripen from green to red. Obtaining fruit sets is difficult as the pods do not readily self pollinate. Like the Rocoto, the Ulupica has purple flowers.

peppers.name: UVILLA GRANDE (PI 439434)
peppers.description: Fruits are typical C. Chinense., very hot, with a strong smoky flavor. They are small (no more than ½" diameter), resembling a miniature scalloped tomato, grow upright on the plant, and are almost always in pairs. This native of Peru is a very unique and very rare chile pepper. Don't let the pretty orange color fool you. This one is hot!

peppers.name: UXMAL
peppers.description: A cultivated variety of habanero found in Mexico

peppers.name: AJI VALENTINE (PI 260549)
peppers.description: Fruit 0.65in long, slender, top-shaped. Mature from green to red.

peppers.name: VALLERO
peppers.description: Originally from Buenaventura, Chihuahua in Mexico, this variety produces 4-6in long pendant shaped pods which mature from green to a rich brownish-black.

peppers.name: VARIEGATA
peppers.description: Also called "Trifetti", this show stopping mini ornamental variety is perfect for container growing. It has white, lavender, purple and green variegation in the leaves for never ending showy color. No two leaves are the same and even the stems and blossoms are purple! The small roundish fruits ripen from deep purple to bright red in approximately 80 days and are very pungent. 50000 scoville units

peppers.name: VELARDE
peppers.description: A native New Mexico chile from Velarde. Mild to mild-medium in heat. 3½-4 inches in length

peppers.name: VERACRUZ S-69
peppers.description: A cultivated variety of Serrano found in Mexico. Pods are about 2.5'' x 1" and are medium-dark green.

peppers.name: VERDENO
peppers.description: A pale green,  cultivated Poblano variety grown in Mexico

peppers.name: VIDI
peppers.description: A hybridised bell pepper variety that offers very early harvests of elongated 6 to 7 inches long dark green,  thick-walled peppers that ripen to an iintense red colour (64 days)  this vigorous plants set fruit well even under stressful conditions and is resistant to tobacco mosaic (TMV) virus.

peppers.name: VIEJO ARRUGA DULCE
peppers.description: The name means 'wrinkled sweet old man'. Common in Mexico, the pods are 3 inches in length and 1 inch in width. Immature pods are green and mature pods are red.

peppers.name: VIETNAMESE
peppers.description: A relatively compact plant that produces hundreds of 3-4 inch long cayenne type chillies which grow erect on the plant. Pods start of a translucent yellow before finally maturing to orange. Very similar to Riot and Medusa.

peppers.name: VIETNAMESE MULTI COLOR
peppers.description: Heavy set of 3/4x½" smooth, tapered erect fruits that turn from purple to lavender to honey to orange to red; plant 2x2', with purple stems, leaves and flowers; very attractive.

peppers.name: VOLCANO F1 HYBRID
peppers.description: A high yielding hot Hungarian Wax type. The plants are approximately 45-50cm in height, stocky and compact producing very heavy yields of 6in long / 1.5in wide fruit that mature from yellow/green (60days) to red approximately 85 days from transplanting. An excellent variety for growing in patio pots and containers.2500-4000 SHU

peppers.name: WENKS YELLOW
peppers.description: A mMedium to hot thick fleshed waxy yellow pepper that ripens to a bright orange and then to red.  From New Mexico.

peppers.name: WEST INDIAN RED
peppers.description: Pendent 1½x1¼" ridges and wrinkled fruits turning from green to orange to red; plants 1½' tall x 2½' wide; fruits very hot with good smokey-tropical fruit flavor.

peppers.name: WHIPPETS TAIL
peppers.description:
This nice variety is one of the longest chile peppers you can grow and is the feature of this years Chileman Competition - 'The Whippets Tail Challenge'.
These cayenne type pods are mild in taste and medium thick skinned making them a good choice for stir fries and salads. They pods have been know to growup  to a 15in in length. Plants can grow up to 3ft tall. This variety is very similar to,  if not the same as Joes Long and Pinocchios Nose.

peppers.name: WILD BOONIE
peppers.description: 1x1/3" upright, smooth tapered fruits turning from green to yellow/orange to red; plant 3' tall; late maturing; very hot with characteristic smokey flavor.

peppers.name: WILD BRAZIL
peppers.description: 1/3" diameter round, yellow, erect fruits on spreading 1' tall x 2½' wide plants with small leaves; fruits hot with tropical fruit aroma; seems identical to Cumari.

peppers.name: X-235
peppers.description: An Indian Cayenne type pepper. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: XCATIC
peppers.description: A fairly mild wax type chile grown in the Yucatan Peninsula, Mexico, it is often used in salsas. Pod length is 4-5 inches by width of 3/4 inches.Sometimes called 'Blonde' it is usually yellow in colour

peppers.name: YANKEE BELL (BELL)
peppers.description: A sweet bell pepper with rather blocky medium sized 3 or 4-lobed peppers which mature from green to a rich deep red.

peppers.name: YATSUFUSA (YATSAFUSA)
peppers.description: This long multi-branched plant grows typically to 24inches tall and bears lots of  tight clusters of 16-25 erect (2.5 X .25 inch) light green pods turning dark red atop of each branch.  Very pungent and often used in Japanese Cuisine.

peppers.name: YELLOW BELLE
peppers.description: Bright yellow peppers are crunchy and sweet (72 days)

peppers.name: YELLOW BOY
peppers.description: 4x3" blocky orange fruits on 1½' tall x 11 wide plants.

peppers.name: YELLOW BUMPY
peppers.description: Pendent 1½x1¼" wrinkled and ridged yellow-orange fruits on 1½' tall x 2' wide plants; very hot with good smokey-tropical fruit flavor.

peppers.name: YELLOW SCORPION CARDI
peppers.description: A very productive chinense variety produced by CARDI.  Not as much heat as the super hot version of the scorpion.  Bright yellow pods with the characteristic sting tail.

peppers.name: YELLOW EMPEROR
peppers.description: From Hainan, China, where it is grown and processed into hot sauces. The pepper matures to yellow and is extremely hot. Length is 2", width 1 1/4".

peppers.name: PI 441715
peppers.description: Fruits small (0.5in), cone-shaped and mature from green to red. Local name pimenta.

peppers.name: YELLOW JELLYBEAN (PI 260501)
peppers.description: This very prolific plant produces hundreds of small marbled sized little 'firebombs' which grow erect on a very compact, but bushy plant. The chiles are  'tepin like' in appearence measuring only 5-7mm or so in diameter. They are blisteringly hot with a very sweet almost lemony flavour. Also known as 'Yellow Fire' and very similar (if not the same as)  'Cumani' and 'Charpita'

peppers.name: YELLOW RAMIRO
peppers.description: Long thick fleshed sweet pepper up to 10 inches long. Matures from green through to yellow.

peppers.name: YELLOW SQUASH (PI 640902)
peppers.description: Habanero type.A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: YELLOW SUN
peppers.description: A very pungent 2 to 2.5in long by 1.5 to 2in wide; Habanero Type which matures from dark green to bright yellow

peppers.name: YOLO WONDER
peppers.description: This Bell pepper variety is larger and a more TMV resistant variety than the California Wonder pepper.  The 2ft plants have dense foilage to help protect against sun scald. The peppers are thick walled and mature from green to a beautiful red colour approximately 75 days after transplanting

peppers.name: YUNG GO
peppers.description: These 5 inches to 6 inches long curved Cayenne type peppers ripen from dark green to red. The name means 'Sheeps Horn'.

peppers.name: TRITON
peppers.description: Very low yield of erect, 2½x2" fruits on tiny 8x8" plants; would make good potted plant. From Thompson & Morgan, last commercially available in 1991.

peppers.name: ZIMBABWE BIRD PEPPER
peppers.description: This delicious and very pungent peppers of this variety are around 1in long by 1/4 in wide when fully mature. The pods grow erect on the plant and ripen from green to a deep ruby red colour approximately 90 days after transplanting. The plant is relatively large, typically growing 2ft high and up to 1-2ft across and is very productive.

peppers.name: C00276
peppers.description: Note: The CO classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at the Asian Vegetable Research and Development Center, Taiwan

peppers.name: CHAMPION (C00774)
peppers.description: Note: The CO classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at the Asian Vegetable Research and Development Center, Taiwan. Fruits mature from translucent yellow to red. Also classified as CAP 334

peppers.name: AJI LIMO
peppers.description: A more detailed description is currently unavailable

peppers.name: ACAPULCO F1
peppers.description: A F1 hybridised Bell pepper variety siad to be tolerant to TMV, PVY and TEV viruses.

peppers.name: AMAZON CHILE ROMA
peppers.description: Mild chinense pepper, but does not have strong chinense flavour like some other varieties.

peppers.name: BACCIO DI SATANA (SATANS KISS)
peppers.description: Satans Kiss' also known as Ciliegia Picante,  is a small round medium-hot, cherry type pepperi, so called by its round shape. It loses about 60% of its heat when cooked. Matures from green to red approximately 90 days after transplanting.

peppers.name: FREDERICK OF AMALFI
peppers.description: Name after Mats Petterssons friend 'Fred' who brought this pepper back from a holiday in Amalfi, Italy.

peppers.name: NAGA JOLOKIA PURPLE
peppers.description: This is a very tall, slender and beautiful plant which grows typically to 4ft tall. The plant is a heavy producer of small, thin 3in long dark puple/black pods, many of which contort into all sorts or weird curly shapes. Foilage is purple/black and the purple flowers are simply stunning. An absolute beauty!!

peppers.name: TETTINAS DE MONK
peppers.description: Also known as 'Yellow Fire' and very similar (if not the same as) 'Cumani' and 'Charpita' and Yellow 'Jellybean'.

peppers.name: 7 POD (7 POT)
peppers.description: This variety is from the Chaguanas area of Trinidad. It has built up an almost myth like quality. In Caribbean regions it is also known as 7 pot as one pod is said to provide enough heat to spice up 7 pots of stew.
