Pods are habenaro like in there shape but have the characteristic 'pimpling' as found on another fearsome variety - the Naga Morich. Unusually the proportion of Placental tissue is very high - a allusion to why this pepper is so outrageously hot.  We now see this pepper in various colours - red, yellow, brown, white and burgundy.  No doubt purple will be along soon, followed by Cappuchino, Dusty Pink...

peppers.name: BEJUCAL
peppers.description: A CARDI recognised landrace variety from  Trinidad.

peppers.name: PI 543208
peppers.description: Fruit subglobose, 1.5cm in diameter, acuminate apex, yellow-green turning orange, piquant. Seeds white.

peppers.name: BELLBOY
peppers.description: A 3.5 to 4.5 inches long by 3 to 4 inches bell pepper variety which matures from green to red. The flesh is thick and sweet tasting.

peppers.name: CORNO VERDE
peppers.description: This is a long, fleshy pepper shaped like a bull's horn, and very similar to Corno di Toro Red. Smooth, thick-walled fruit is 6 to 8 inches long and about 2 inches wide at the shoulder, then tapering to a blunt point. The peppers are sweet when still green, or can be left to ripen fully red (76 days). They are popular for roasting or grilling, but are equally good eaten fresh in salads. This hybrid offers increased yields, better uniformity and resistance to tobacco mosaic virus.

peppers.name: ROUMANIAN RAINBOW
peppers.description: This very early, colourful bell peppers start out as ivory, turn persimmon orange, before finally maturing to red (60 days).The fruit are typically in all 3 colour stages at one time, making for a striking appearance in the garden. Peppers are 4 to 5 inches long and very sweet. Plants are relatively compact.

peppers.name: SUNBELL
peppers.description: This unusual elongated bell pepper starts out ivory, then turns a beautiful golden yellow, before becoming bright red at full maturity (70 days).  These large peppers are  exceptionally sweet at all stages.

peppers.name: SUPER HEAVYWEIGHT
peppers.description: Gardeners who enjoy growing vegetables to brag about will love this pepper that weighs an impressive one-half pound. This is a heavy pepper, and not only is it absolutely huge, it is also deliciously sweet, especially when it fully ripens to golden yellow. Thick walls and a high vitamin C content lend it well to using fresh in salads or for cooking or stuffing. 77 days.

peppers.name: CABALLO (PI 593635)
peppers.description: ANother name for Manzano and comes in three forms - green, yellow or red. The shape is globose to oblate and often apple to pear-like. Caballo/Manzano measures about 3 inches long and 2 to 2 1/4 inches in diameter. Thin fleshed; soft and meaty in texture, with fruilike flavors. Used in table sauces, salsas, ceviche, vegetable and meat dishes; as a seasoning, or stuffed (rellenos).

peppers.name: DUTCH
peppers.description: A hydridised Cayenne variety. It is fatter than a cayenne and not as hot, the Dutch or Holland Green has been professionally cultivated from Indonesian cayenne's to create a sweeter, less pungent, more marketable product. This has resulted in a pithy seedy inside (which needs discarding before use), and a medium-hot which makes them suitable for use in salads and cooked dishes.  At 12.5 cm long by 4 cm wide, it can be stuffed.

peppers.name: CRIOLLO
peppers.description: This plant produces 3 to 3.5 inches long by 1 to 1.25 inches wide thin fleshed pods which mature from green to a deep red They are nest used in their dry form.

peppers.name: CAPASTRANO SWEET
peppers.description: Sweet/bell hybridLarge block variety to compare with Jupiter (75 days)

peppers.name: TUSCAN ARIZONA
peppers.description: This very unusual variety is actually part of the species Capsicum annuum var. aviculare. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: LINGUA DI FUOCO
peppers.description: A decrorative ornamental variety from Italy which is very similar to , if not the same as 'Riot' and 'Medusa'

peppers.name: TUSTE VERDE
peppers.description: This very tall variety (up to 6ft) originates from the Zapotec indians of Mexico.

peppers.name: CAP 487
peppers.description:
Mature pod shown on the left & immature on the right. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

Note: The CAP classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at a research institution in Germany.

peppers.name: JAMAICAN GOLD
peppers.description: This prolific Jamaican variety produces pungent, squash type 1 to 1.5 in long by 1.25 to 1.75 in wide pods which ripen from green to a golden yellow.

peppers.name: TUPUMA
peppers.description: This varieties is actually part of the species Capsicum annuum var. glabriusculum. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: HABANERO MANZANO
peppers.description: This is a hybridised variety (Chinese xPubescens cross) developed by crossing a Habanero with a Manzano. A more detailed description and further information on the parents is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: PILI PILI
peppers.description: Note: This is a variety sold by Cross Country Nurseries. The  true Pili Pili is believed to be a Frutescens and looks more like a Tabasco.

peppers.name: CLUSTER ROD (CGN 19202)
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note: The CGN classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Wageningen, The Netherlands
Similar to CGN 22208. Plants are quite pubescent. The pods are pea sized.

peppers.name: CGN 23205
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note: The CGN classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Wageningen, The Netherlands

peppers.name: CAP 1493
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note: The CAP classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at a research institution in Germany.

peppers.name: CAP 16982
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note: The CGN classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Wageningen, The Netherlands

peppers.name: CAP 17021
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note: The CGN classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Wageningen, The Netherlands

peppers.name: CGN 17028
peppers.description: More accuartely, this variety is part of the species Baccatum var. Pendulum.This is a tall plant that produces elongated pods (8-10 cm) that ripen from light green to red. The leaves are light green too. It produces branches that are not very strong and very long.  Note: The CGN classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Wageningen, The Netherlands

peppers.name: CITRINA (CGN 17198)
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note: The CGN classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Wageningen, The Netherlands

peppers.name: CGN 21553
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note: The CGN classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Wageningen, The Netherlands

peppers.name: CGN 22190
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note: The CGN classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Wageningen, The Netherlands

peppers.name: CGN 22782
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note: The CGN classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Wageningen, The Netherlands

peppers.name: CGN 22862
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note: The CGN classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Wageningen, The Netherlands

peppers.name: BGH 323 (PI 441522)
peppers.description: This variety produces 6cm long x 1.5cm wide, elongated fruits which mature to red. Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: BGH 341 (PI 441524)
peppers.description: This variety yields 2 x 6cm which ripen to red. Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: BGH 366 (PI 441525)
peppers.description: This variety produces 6cm x 1cm long, thin fruits which mature to red. Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: BGH 412 (PI 441526)
peppers.description: This variety yields 5cm long, narrow fruits. Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: BGH 631 (PI 441529)
peppers.description: This variety produces small heart shaped fruits which mature to red. No further information is known at this time. Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: BGH 682 (PI 441530)
peppers.description: This variety produces round, flattened fruits which mature to orange. No further information is known at this time. Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.name: CHIFRE DE VIADO (PI 441533)
peppers.description: This variety produced long, narrowfruits (10cm x 1cm) which mature to red.

peppers.name: PIMENTA  COMUM (PI 441534)
peppers.description: This variety produces Fruits 5ch x 2cm wedge-shaped fruits. No further information is available at this time.

peppers.name: PI 599423
peppers.description: Fruit bell pepper shape but smaller, 3-4cm diameter, 6-8cm long. Flesh white. Used for stuffing with rice and meat.

peppers.name: PI 599425
peppers.description: Bright red, sweet when ripe. Shape somewhat like a squashed bell pepper, short, approx. 4cm long x 12cm wide, prominent sections.

peppers.name: FYUCO (GRIF 15524)
peppers.description: A bell pepper type. More detailed information is not available at this time.

peppers.name: VYUCO (GRIF 15526)
peppers.description: A bell pepper type from Argentina. More detailed information is not available at this time.

peppers.name: GRIF 15337
peppers.description: A piquin type from Australia. No further information is available at this time.

peppers.name: PI 159260
peppers.description: This variety is actually part of the species Capsicum baccatum var. pendulum. A more detailed description is currently unavailable at this time.

peppers.name: PI 260472
peppers.description: Fruit 1in wide by 0.75in long, flattened; yellow

peppers.name: PI 260475
peppers.description: Fruit 3 by 1in long, pointed; matures to red

peppers.name: PI 355822
peppers.description: Plant 1m tall, no flowers, fruit heart shaped, typical red color.

peppers.name: PI 438648
peppers.description: Fruit ovate, pointed, pungent, yellow, 3cm diam., 4.5cm long.

peppers.name: BHUT JOLOKIA (BIH JOLOKIA)
peppers.description:
This landrace chile originates from the northeast of India, particularly Assam, Nagaland and Manipur. It belongs to Capsicum chinense family and is known by many names in the different Indian provinces. The most common names include Bhut jolokia, Bih jolokia,  Nagahari,  Raja Mircha, Raja chilli or Borbih jolokia.
For example  Bih jolokia translates to  'poison chilli' in Assamese.   Bhut Jolokia translates to 'Ghost chilli' probably due to its ghostly bite.  Raja Mircha means 'King of Chillies'. 

Reports from Assam growers indicate the typical height of Bih Jolokia to be in the range of 45 to120 cm.  Like other varieties of the Chinense species, the leaf surface has the characteristic crinkle look and the flowers are pendant, with creamy white corollas, often with a touch of light green. Fruits are 5 to 8.5 cm in length, 2.5 to 3 cm in diameter (at shoulder), with an undulating surface.

However it doenst matter what its called, under the right growing conditions these chiles are blisteringly hot with recent tests indicating a heat level of 1,041,427 Scoville Heat Units.

Only a few of its closely related Bangladeshi cousin can lay claim such outrageous heat levels.

peppers.name: PI 543182
peppers.description: Shrub to 1.5m tall. Fruits dark red, strongly ribbed, longitudinally flattened spheres to 3cm in diameter. Flowers light yellow with green anthers.

peppers.name: PI 543189
peppers.description: Fruits oblong, pointed, 10cm long, smooth, shiny, dark red when mature, not piquant. Seeds light yellow. Thick, firm flesh.

peppers.name: PI 560936
peppers.description: Plants semi-perennial, many-branched, to 1m tall. Flowers light yellow. Fruits usually strawberry shaped, 5cm long, 3.5cm diam., sometimes 8-9cm long. Fruit color bright red-orange, glossy. Seeds light yellow. Not piquant. Commonly cultivated variety, in the floodplains of chaco., Bolivia.

peppers.name: PI 593923
peppers.description: To 1.6m tall. Leaves dark green, crinkled. Fruits globose with broad ribs, 1.5 cm long, 2 cm diameter, dark red when ripe. Flowers yellowish white, anthers white.

peppers.name: PI 593926
peppers.description: 1.6m tall. Wrinkled leaves. Flowers yellow-white, anthers purple. Fruits 1 per node, pendant, dark purple turning red when ripe, boxy conical, 3-4 cm long, triangular in x-section. Piquant.

peppers.name: PI 595908
peppers.description: Plant height 2m. Leaves crinkly. Flowers greenish, anthers purple, 1-2 per node. Fruits pendant, 3-4cm. long, 2cm. wide, triangular, truncate at pedicel, slight neck, blossom end pointed, orange at intermed. stage, red at maturity. Piquant.

peppers.name: AJI COCHABAMBA
peppers.description: The cultivar, 'Cochabamba' produces pods that are pointed, measuring 4 inches by .75 inch. They mature from green to red and have a medium pungency. The plant is tall and can reach over five feet in height with dark green foliage and leaves that measure seven inches in length. These species tend to have a spicy and fruity flavor that goes well with fish. An average plant will produce forty small and oval pods.

peppers.name: PI 543196
peppers.description: Fruits oblong, wrinkled, sometimes contorted, 5cm long, red, not pungent. Seeds light yellow. Perennial woody shrub to 1.5m.

peppers.name: BGH 460
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note: The BGH classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Banco de Germoplasma de Hortaliças, Brazil

peppers.description: 1.2m tall. Leaves wrinkled, dark green. Flowers yellowish white with purple anthers. Fruits wrinkled, ribbed, oblong conical to 6 cm long, purple-green turning bright red when ripe

peppers.name: PI 551887
peppers.description: This variety is more accurately part of the sub species Capsicum annuum var. glabriusculum. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: PI 632921 (GRIF 14083)

peppers.name: CARMEN
peppers.description: A new pepper of the Italian "bulls horn" (corno di toro) type developed by Johnny's seeds.on. The long tapered pods grow to  6" long x 2 1/2" wide  and ripen from green to deep "carmine" red. Maturity is early on an upright, medium-size plant.

peppers.name: VENTURA F1
peppers.description: An F1 hybridised brown-ripening Mulato variety from Johnny's Seed. These heart-shaped fruits change from dark green (68 days) to brown (95 Days) at full maturity. Can be used at the green or brown stage. Tall plants.

peppers.name: JALAPENO CONCHOS F1
peppers.description:
Conchos is a jalapeno type widely grown in the U.S. and Mexico.
The pods are cylindrical, dark green with moderate heat. Big, 1 3/4" x 3-4" long, and very smooth. Tall plant yields heavily.  Fruits hold well on the plant and during transport. Some resistance to bacterial speck

peppers.name: ROCOTO LARGO SAN ISIDRO
peppers.description: This variety obtained its name as it is said that it was grown by a priest in is church grounds in San Isidro, in the  town of La Palma (Canary Islands).  This variety is very unusual for a variety of the Pubescens species as the flowers are almost white with only the slightest tinge of purple.

peppers.name: TUBA
peppers.description: Pods mature from  light green to red

peppers.name: NEUSIEDER IDEAL
peppers.description: Pods mature from green to red. A more detailed description is currently unavailable

peppers.name: HABANERO WHITE GIANT
peppers.description: This variety can grow quite large (up to 80in) in well manured soil. The  pods are slightly larger than the conventional habanero averaging  7cm in length x 5cm wide.  The colour of the fruits varies from the green to the yellow and the white.  Like other habaneros, the pods have an  intense flavour.

peppers.name: BRUINSMA WONDER (CGN 19226)
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note: The CGN classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at Wageningen, The Netherlands

peppers.name: TRINIDAD SCORPION
peppers.description: This variety is reputed to be a very scary pepper!!! The plants are tall, upright and reasonably productive bearing 2 to 3in long pendant pods which taper to a sharp pointed 'tail'. The pods mature from green to orange and finally red approximately 90-120 days after transplanting (similar to some of the other long season chinese species).  The variety is also found in versions maturing to yellow and to brown.  In terms of pungency, the pods of this much sort after variety are outrageously hot.

peppers.name: FOGO F1
peppers.description: This F1 hybridised Plant produces good yields of 5" long medium hot peppers that mature from green, to yellow and finally to orange.. Plant has green stems, green leaves, and white flowers. Peppers have thick walls.

peppers.name: GEMSTONE
peppers.description: A hybridised variety (from Aboretum purple) developed by Craig Houllier. Very similar to explosive ember.

peppers.name: NAGA MORICH (DORSET NAGA)
peppers.description:
Naga Morich meaning 'snake or serpent Chile’ is an apt name for this ferociously hot variety as eating even the smallest slither of one of these pods is described by some as like drinking cobra venom!!. It is believed to be very closely related to its Indian cousin, the Bhut jolokia (Bih jolokia) and extreme care should be taken when handling these firebombs.  In recent tests, one Naga Morich pod registered 1,598,227 SHU.  The thin walled wrinkled pods have a high degree of variability in shape although they are generally wedge shaped with three locules and average about 2 inches long by 1 inch wide. They ripen from a rich green through to yellow/orange and finally to a rich red approximately 120 days after transplanting. The extremely long, curved and annular constriction of the Calyx at junction with the peduncle is also a notable feature of this variety.
Plants are large and bushy, with ours growing almost 3ft tall. Leaves are ovate in shape and pale green in colour. Plants also display multiple pods and flowers per node (often 5-6 pods per node) and corollas possess the characteristic greenish tinge of other varieties in the chinense species.
It is used sparingly (and with great care!) in Bengali cookery and is thought to originate from Northern Bangladesh.

peppers.name: MOROUGA YELLOW
peppers.description: A very hot variety from Trinidad recognised as a landrace variety by CARDI.

peppers.name: HOOD
peppers.description: A CARDI recognised landrace variety from  Trinidad.

peppers.name: GREYGO
peppers.description: A large 15cm wide red cheese type pepper from Stokes. These thick fleshed pods smooth, flattened pods mature from green to red approximately 70 days after transplanting. Also said to be TMV tolerant.

peppers.name: BLACK PEARL
peppers.description: This is a very nice compact, bushy ornamental variety developed by arboretum Floral and Nursery Plants Research Unit scientists Rob Griesbach and John Stommel of the Agricultural Research Service’s Vegetable Laboratory. The plant grows about 14 to 18 inches tall and 12 to 16 inches wide and sets masses of 3/4-inch small rond 'pearl shaped' pods which ripens from black to a rich, deep red.  An All-America Selections® (AAS) Flower Award winner for 2006.

peppers.name: SIAM
peppers.description: The pods  starts out a straw colour with mauve tinges, changing through a range of orange finishing up red. The plant is very prolific with the a mass of colours erupting on the plant at once. The pods are up to 2 inches long, and the plant itself can grow to 1m in height, although it gets very bushy.

peppers.name: AMPUIS (AMIEN) PEPPER
peppers.description: A rare French variety with small, rounded, lantern-shaped peppers, crisp and mild. Apparently a good variety for frying

peppers.name: PIMIENTO MORRONES
peppers.description: Pimientos morrones are so called because their shape makes them look as though they have morros [snouts].

peppers.name: SENISE PEPPER
peppers.description: The peperone di Senise, or Senise pepper, is traditionally used for flavoring peasant dishes and is a specialty in the provinces of Matera and Potenza in Italy. Brick red in colour, it  has a slightly elongated form and thin flesh, and contains very little water, making it particularly well suited to being dried and turned into powder. In powdered form, the Senise pepper is often used for making local cheeses and cured meats, and for flavoring soups.

peppers.name: PIMENT BAKLOUTI
peppers.description: This variety produces  large fruited rectangular (10cm x 20cm) fruits which mature from dark green to red. The weigh approximately 150-200 grams

peppers.name: PUMPKIN
peppers.description: A unusual ornamental variety.  Each plant is said to produce about 35 fruits, 3.5 x 2 cm in size. The fruits mature to orange at the end of the season, then their shell hardens, once dried, and takes the shape of a pumpkin.

peppers.name: MADAME JEANETTE (SURINAM YELLOW)
peppers.description: Apparently named after a famed Brazilian prostitute, this Habanero variant is grown on the Islands of Surinam and Aruba. The pods are shaped like small Bell peppers but with blistering Habanero heat. Said to be very prolific. This variety is very similar to Surinam Red although the pods mature to Yellow not red..

peppers.name: PIMENT DE LA BRESSE
peppers.description:
This is a rare French variety named after the town of 'la bresse'  in burgundy near Lyon. The pods are 6 to 9 cm long and are used
traditionnally in powder and put in  a cheese called  "fromage
fort"  (a very strong french cheese). More detailed information is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: VERALDE
peppers.description: A native New Mexico chile from Velarde, New Mexico Mild to mild-medium in heat. 3½-4 long at maturity

peppers.name: CAP 477
peppers.description: Capsicum Microcarpum is a wild version of the species Capsicum Annuum. More detailed information is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: CAP 220
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note the CAP classification system for chile varieties orginates from a research institution in Germany

peppers.name: CAP 1474
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note the CAP classification system for chile varieties orginates from a research institution in Germany

peppers.name: CAP 927
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note the CAP classification system for chile varieties orginates from a research institution in Germany

peppers.name: CAP 1492
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note the CAP classification system for chile varieties orginates from a research institution in Germany

peppers.name: CAP 1473
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note the CAP classification system for chile varieties orginates from a research institution in Germany

peppers.name: CAPSICUM MICROCARPUM
peppers.description: Capsicum Microcarpum is a wild version of the species Capsicum Annuum. More detailed information is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: PURPLE CAYENNE
peppers.description: This exceptionally edible ornamental pepper is probably the most beautiful of the many Cayenne varieties. The plants grow 2 to 3 feet tall and are are covered with dozens of delicate white/purple flowers which turn into dark violet coloured thin peppers about 3" long, a bit smaller that a regular cayenne

peppers.name: CRI MAKO NTOOS,
peppers.description: CRI-Mako-Ntoos is a mildly pungent variety developed by the AVRDC. It is often used as  a substitute for tomato when tomato is not available at the market (the name "Mako-Ntoos" literally means "pepper-tomato". The mild pungency of this variety may also encourage greater consumption of pepper, which is noted for its high contents of vitamin C and other micronutrients. Micronutrient-malnutrition is rampant in Ghana, as vegetable consumption is only 31.6 kg/capita/year, less than half of what is recommended for a healthy diet.

peppers.name: GUINDILLA ROJA
peppers.description: This is one of the most common peppers used in Spanish Cuisine to add heat to dishes. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: PIMIENTO PICONA
peppers.description: Picón = hot, this thin walled Spanish variety is used in the making of salsas in Spain.  Unlike most varieties, the flowers grow and open vertically.

peppers.name: RICA RED
peppers.description: Developed from cross-breeding Costa Rican red habaneros. Measuring about 2.5 inches long and 1.5 inches in diameter. Rica red is grown commercially in Costa Rica and is used to make pepper mash for hot sauces. Rica red can also be used in the same manner as regular habanero.

peppers.name: C01286
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note:The CO classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at the Asian Vegetable Research and Development Center, Taiwan

peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note:The CO classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at the Asian Vegetable Research and Development Center, Taiwan

peppers.name: CAP 346
peppers.description: Description currently unavailable. Note: The CAP classification system for chile varieties indicates an accession from the genebank at a research institution in Germany.

peppers.name: YELLOW TOSCANA
peppers.description: A mature pod is shown here. A more detailed description is currently unavailable

peppers.name: GOLD TOPAS (CAP 1641)
peppers.description: Nonpungent pods of size 6-8 cm long. A more detailed description is currently unavailable.

peppers.name: BIRD PEPPER
peppers.description: There are dozens of varieties of Bird Peppers throughout the world. The two best known varieties in North America are Tepin and Pequin. Bird peppers are commonly reported to be the hottest chile pepper known to man. In fact, one ounce of the Tepin variety will yield enough heat for 300 gallons of salsa!

peppers.name: MALACATE
peppers.description: 4x½" pendent, tapered red fruits with concentric bumps; plant 1½'x1½'.

peppers.name: NAVUA
peppers.description: 5" upright fruits changing from green to orange to red. From a market in Navua Town, Viti Levu Island, Fiji

peppers.name: THAI TIERSCH
peppers.description: 4x¼" erect, red fruits on 3' tall x 2½' wide plants with white-hairy stems.

peppers.name: TSETSKA
peppers.description: Heavy set of pendent, 4½x2/3" tapered red fruits on 1½x1½' plants; good drier. Named after Tsetska Iranova who still  lives in Bulgaria.

peppers.name: TOBAGO SEASONING PEPPER
peppers.description: Pendent 2x1¼" wrinkled fruits turning from light green to orange to red; plants 2' tall x 2½' wide; fruits with strong smokey-tropical fruit flavor but no heat

peppers.name: TOBAGO ORANGE SCOTCH BONNET
peppers.description: Very heavy setter of 1½x2½" prune-shaped fruits which turn from red-orange to dark red at maturity; very hot, smokey flavor with strong fruit overtones.

peppers.name: TOBAGO SWEET SCOTCH BONNET
peppers.description: C. chinense; heavy set of 2x2½" prune-shaped deep red fruits; strong smokey flavor with fruit overtones but no heat

peppers.name: WEISSE PEPERONI
peppers.description: Tapered, wrinkled 6x2" sweet fruits turning from white to yellow-orange to red; plant 1½' tall.

peppers.name: JALAPENONA
peppers.description: Larger and more elongate selection of Yellow Jalapeno with pendent 3x1" yellow-orange fruits on 1½' tall x 1' wide plants

peppers.name: YELLOW TRINIDAD
peppers.description: C. chinense; heavy set of 1½x2" wrinkled deep orange-yellow fruits with very hot and strong smokey flavor; excellent production.

peppers.name: TINELVELI (TIRINEVELLY)
peppers.description:
A small cherry type chile, also called Tirinevelly, from the deep 
south of India. About 8 mm in diameter, it is conical in shape.

peppers.name: BLUE JAY
peppers.description: Very productive and novel - ripens green/lilac/grape/pale orange/dark red. Fruit are quite blocky 4 1/2 in. x 4 in./11 cm x 10 cm.

peppers.name: SCARLET KING
peppers.description: Economical Stokes hybrid for Bedding Plant Growers, matures in about 72 days.

peppers.name: ETHAM
peppers.description: 70 days. Long straight 8 in./20 cm tapered jumbo banana fruit has excellent yields, no disease tolerances. Ripens lime yellow, yellow, red.

peppers.name: KIM CHI
peppers.description: Kim-Chi is an early maturing hybrid hot pepper, developed by a leading seed breeder in Korea. This variety produces fruits with 14-15 cm long and 1.7-1.9 cm in diameter, 14-15 cm in length and 14-15 grams in weight. Fruits in pendent habit are dark green in skin color when immature and turn into red when matured. Dark green peppers in nearly maturing stage are very pungent and can be picked for fresh cooking and pickling uses. Matured red fruits are excellent for making dry peppers. The plant grows vigorously. First fruit picking can be obtained 65 days after transplanting.

peppers.name: ETNA
peppers.description: Etna is a large type hybrid hot pepper, 15-18 cm long and 2-2.5 cm in diameter. Fruits have smooth thick wall, green skin in early stage and turning into red when fully matured. Long and large fruits are very pungent and have long shelf life. Plants are very vigorous and very productive. Very popular for commercial production and home gardening in Thailand and Southern Asia.

peppers.name: JALAPENO JALEPE MILD F1
peppers.description: A mild Jalapeno hybrid that is said to have 3" frui. Very little further information is know at the presnt time.

peppers.name: EGYPTIAN CAYENNE
peppers.description: This is a glorious, tall sprawling yet delicate plant which produces up to 100 three inch long Cayenne peppers. One of the chilemans favorite plants.

peppers.name: BOMBILLA AMARILLA
peppers.description:
Bombilla Amarilla is a rare heirloom variety from the south of Spain. The pods are round and small (cherry tomato size) and mature to a
bright yellow. They're so bright in the summer sun that they appear to
look like light bulbs which is what they're named after (bombilla).
They're used in southern spanish cusine and have a strong following particularly from the South American communities of Madrid and Barcelona.

peppers.name: CILI PUTIH KELANTAN
peppers.description: Kelantan white chili.  Matures from light green to white to orange.

peppers.name: POMODORO
peppers.description: Pomodoro is a pepper that looks exactly like a beefsteak tomato.  It is wonderful eaten fresh and perfect for "surprise" stuffers. The peppers are  about 4" across and have a sweet taste.

peppers.name: CAP 221
peppers.description: This plant is quite compact & bushy for a baccatum and grows about 80 cm tall and about as wide. Pods are about 4cm long and 1 cm wide. Pods ripened in 50 days and have a comfortable heat.

peppers.name: PC-1
peppers.description: This pepper is also known Tezpur and sometimes markeed in the US as Naga Jolokia. This native of India grows into a large plant, nearly 3' tall, and bears huge harvests of pencil thick 3' orange/redfruits that are very hot. A recent issue of Chile Pepper magazine had an article, with the authors' thinking this to be hottest pepper ever measured. The credibility of this statement, however, has been highly argued by pepper experts and remains very much in doubt.  The heat is similar to most Thai pepper varieties.

peppers.name: JALABANERO
peppers.description: An Annuum x Chinense hybrid. A more detailed description is currently unavailable

peppers.name: NIOI
peppers.description: .5 inch rocket shaped pods may equal habanero in  heat. Was brought to the Northern Marianas by the Spanish in the 1500s and now grows wild on the islands. These were collected from the Island of Tinian and offered by the Heirloom Seed Saving Project of Medomak Valley High School in Maine. Very long germination period.
peppers.1st image credit: © John Fiedler - may not be reproduced

peppers.description: This is a pepper developed by Dr. Mario Dadomo, Italy.

peppers.name: JARANDA
peppers.description: Spanish variety used in the making of pimentón de la Vera.

peppers.name: JARIZA
peppers.description: Spanish variety used in the making of pimentón de la Vera.

peppers.name: JEROMIN
peppers.description: Spanish variety used in the making of pimentón de la Vera.

peppers.name: SHENDURNI
peppers.description: The Shendurni chili is believed to orginate from India and is rumoured to be so hot that people do not use it for preparing food & dishes. The farmers do not cultivate since it has no market due to its hotness. No further information is available at this time.

peppers.name: MALAGUETA DO VALONGO
peppers.description:
This huge Malagueta (C. frutescens) was founding growing on a ranch on the
locality of Valongo in the city of Porto Bello, Brazil. The flowers are typical of the C. frutescens species, with a light green corolla.  The pods are usually erect, but also sometimes horizontal or semi-pendant. This plant is very productive and keeps bearing pods continuously.

peppers.name: VENUS OF WILLENDORF
peppers.description: Also known as the Woman of Willendorf, this variety takes its name after  an 11.1 cm (4 3/8 inches) high statuette of a female figure. It was discovered in 1908 by archaeologist Josef Szombathy at a paleolithic site near Willendorf, a village in Lower Austria near the city of Krems.

peppers.name: BOTINECKA ZUTA
peppers.description: A terrific heirloom from the Balkans, a Hungarian cheese-type. Medium-late heavy producer of yellow fruit, upward-pointing. Round-flattened shape, very sweet, perfect for stuffing, or ripen to a glorious red/orange and dry for paprika

peppers.name: HABANERO SUCUTUBA
peppers.description: Plant produces good yields of smooth skinned fruits are almost round, good flavour, ripening to red.

peppers.name: AJI TAMARINDO
peppers.description: This unusual variety grows in the Ocu region of Panama. The pods are tear drop in shape and grow to approximately 5.5 cm long by almost 2 cm thick. They ripen to aa pale-creamy orange color.  These pods have a distinctive Habanero like smell and therefore the variety is belived to be a Chinense.

peppers.name: VESENA
peppers.description:
Name translates to “stitched”, also often named Elephant – so named because of its extreme corking on the fruits, which are up to 18 cm’s long, red and hot. They have thick flesh but dry easily because pods have a high dry matter. 
Originally found at a market in Skopje, Macedonia. Later on available from Arche Noah – a seed saving organization in Austria.

peppers.name: PALOMA
peppers.description: This medium/tall plant  bears clustersof pods which grow upright, they mature from pale yellow to orange to red, sometimes.

peppers.name: PAPRIKA RANA ORANZOVA VLASTA
peppers.description: An oblong to bell-shaped, very sweet pepper with good taste. Nice yellow-orange colour and early ripening.

peppers.name: ARRIVIVI ORANGE
peppers.description: A small brilliantly shiny orange chile with a heady aroma and taste

peppers.name: SARIT GAT
peppers.description: Hot, bright yellow pods grow upright on a compact plant, around 60 cm.

peppers.name: PIMENTA MORANGO
peppers.description: Name is Portuguese, meaning ”Strawberry Pepper”. The 2-3cm triangluar pods grow pendant and in clusters on tall plant (1metre) and mature from dark purple to light purple and finally to red . Foliage is  dark green with purple hue. Flowers set in clusters of 2-6 like other Chinense varieties. Pods are said to be very pungent, tasty and: extremely aromatic

peppers.name: CHAABANI
peppers.description: Chaabani is a 14 cm sweet pepper from Tunisia.

peppers.name: AJI LITTLE FINGER
peppers.description: Tall plant, typical of baccatum species.  Small 2 inch fruits ripening to red in 80 days.  Heat level up to 5,000 Scoville Units.

peppers.name: PIMENTA BALAOZINHO
peppers.description: A Chilli from Tocantins State, North Brazil.

peppers.name: PINGO DE OURO
peppers.description: Variety from Rio Grande do Norte region of Brazil.  Very prolific, small fruits ripe after 120 days.  200,000 SHU.

peppers.name: WHITE ROCOTO
peppers.description: Despite the name, the pods are pale yellow rather than white.

peppers.name: MOROUGA RED
peppers.description: This native of Trinidad is not the infamous "Morouga Red" that many people refer to when talking about the variety that may or may not be linked to the Trinidad Scorpion.  This is a very different pepper.  Smooth surface, looks like a habanero in shape.  Hot, but not super hot.

peppers.name: CAIAMARCA
peppers.description: Hot habanero flavour on these pretty shaped pods that mature from green to violet to red.  This variety is promoted by the NMSU Chile Pepper Institute.

peppers.name: JALMUNDO NUMEX
peppers.description: New Mexico State University variety. The name Jalmundo is said to be a combination of jalapeño and the Spanish word for world (mundo).

peppers.name: LUMBRE
peppers.description: One of the hottest NuMex varieties available.  Pods can grow to about 5 inches in length.  Up to 30,000 SHU.  Developed by Faron Lytle.

peppers.name: NUMEX LAS CRUCES CAYENNE
peppers.description: An early, high yield Cayenne from the Chile Pepper Institute.  Thick flesh for a cayenne and about 15,000 SHU.

peppers.name: NUMEX HERITAGE
peppers.description: Bred by the Chile Pepper Institute to have 20 per cent increase in flavour compounds compared to the original New Mexico variety and a 10 per cent yield improvement.

peppers.name: NUMEX HERITAGE BIG JIM
peppers.description: Bred by the Chile Pepper Institute to be an improvement on the original Big Jim variety.  This one has 20 per cent more flavour compounds and a 10 per cent better yield.

peppers.name: RHOMBOIDEUM (PI 645680)
peppers.description: A very unusual and scarce wild Capsicum species initially believed to be a sister to Capsicum Tovarii  although after further study by Eshbaugh in 1988, it has since been omitted from Capsicum species list. Native to Southern Mexico & South America, this species  has pubescent stems and leaves and yellow flowers. The tiny red fruits have no heat. Now a synonym for Witheringia ciliata although more recently it has been reclassified (yet again) as Capsicum rhomboideum.

peppers.name: CAATINGAE
peppers.description: Species found in Caatinga region of north east Brazil.  Small spherical berries, white and purple flowers which cluster heavily on each node.

peppers.name: LONGIDENTATUM
peppers.description: Species found in Caatinga region of north east Brazil.  Small spherical berries with pale brown seeds.

peppers.name: TRINIDAD DOUGLAH (BROWN 7 POD)
peppers.description: This variety is closely linked to the 7 Pot/Pod and Trinidad Scorpion landrace varieties. It may or may not be a different variety. This pepper is a relatively new variation on the original Trinidad superhots. Ripe pods are brown in colour, with the white internal membrane covering much of the inside of the pepper. There is still debate as to whether the brown or chocolate 7 Pod is the same variety as the Douglah.

peppers.name: BLONDIE
peppers.description: An unusual baccatum that ripens to white.  Pods look quite a bit like Aji Crystal in shape, with good flavour.

peppers.name: CAJAMARCA
peppers.description: Long growing season, with pods that change from green to purple to orange to red.

peppers.name: TRINIDAD MOROVAS
peppers.description: This variety is closely linked to the 7 Pot/Pod and Trinidad Scorpion landrace varieties. It may or may not be a different variety. Sometimes the spelling is Morovars. Appears in red and yellow versions.

peppers.name: 7 POD BARRACKPORE
peppers.description: This variety is closely linked to the 7 Pot/Pod and Trinidad Scorpion landrace varieties. It may or may not be a different variety.

peppers.name: 7 POD JONAH
peppers.description: This variety is closely linked to the 7 Pot/Pod and Trinidad Scorpion landrace varieties. It may or may not be a different variety.

peppers.name: 7 POD PRIMO
peppers.description: This variety is closely linked to the 7 Pot/Pod and Trinidad Scorpion landrace varieties. It may or may not be a different variety.

peppers.name: 7 POD BRAIN STRAIN
peppers.description: This variety is closely linked to the 7 Pot/Pod and Trinidad Scorpion landrace varieties. It may or may not be a different variety.

peppers.name: TRINIDAD SCORPION MOROUGA BLEND
peppers.description: This variety is closely linked to the 7 Pot/Pod and Trinidad Scorpion landrace varieties. It may or may not be a different variety.

peppers.name: TRINIDAD SCORPION BUTCH T
peppers.description: This variety is closely linked to the 7 Pot/Pod and Trinidad Scorpion landrace varieties. It may or may not be a different variety.

peppers.name: PUYA
peppers.description: Popular in Mexican cuisine, this variety has pods that grow to about four inches in length, ripen from green to red and measure between 5000 - 8000 Scovilles.  Similar to the Guajillo, but smaller and hotter.  Fruity flavor.

peppers.name: CARDI GREEN
peppers.description: CARDI released an improved variety called CARDI Green in 2003.

peppers.name: PEBRE VERMELL DE TAP DE CORTI
peppers.description: A small paprika pepper native to Mallorca.  This variety is being grown by Slow Food Illes Baleres.  Used to colour the Balearic Sobrassada sausage.

peppers.name: HP22B (CAROLINA REAPER)
peppers.description: New variety created by Ed Currie. Also known as Carolina Reeper. There has been much debate as to exactly how hot this pepper is, but stupidly hot will suffice. This variety is closely linked to the 7 Pot/Pod and Trinidad Scorpion landrace varieties. It may or may not be a different variety.

peppers.name: 7 POT RENNIE
peppers.description: This variety is closely linked to the 7 Pot/Pod and Trinidad Scorpion landrace varieties. It may or may not be a different variety.

peppers.name: NAGA VIPER
peppers.description: This variety is closely linked to the Naga Morich landrace variety. It may or may not be a different variety.

peppers.name: SEPIA SERPENT
peppers.description: This variety is closely linked to the 7 Pot/Pod and Trinidad Scorpion landrace varieties. It may or may not be a different variety.

peppers.name: JAYS GHOST SCORPION
peppers.description: This variety is closely linked to the 7 Pot/Pod and Trinidad Scorpion landrace varieties. It may or may not be a different variety.

peppers.name: YELLOW BRAIN STRAIN
peppers.description: This variety is closely linked to the 7 Pot/Pod and Trinidad Scorpion landrace varieties. It may or may not be a different variety.

peppers.name: FATALII GOURMET JIGSAW
peppers.description: This variety is closely linked to the 7 Pot/Pod and Trinidad Scorpion landrace varieties. It may or may not be a different variety.

peppers.name: DEVILS TONGUE RED
peppers.description: A red variation of the Devils Tongue pepper.

peppers.name: ACIBURUN
peppers.description: Popular F1 Turkish annuum variety with a decent level of heat.

peppers.name: AJI ANGELO
peppers.description: This thin walled variety turns from green to orange to red, with pods about four inches in length.

peppers.name: AJI CALATENANGO (CAP 343)
peppers.description: Fruit red when ripe medium Heat. It is also known as CAP 343.

peppers.name: HOLY MOLE
peppers.description: Popular variety for Mexican recipes, it is an F1 hybrid of the more widely known Pasilla.

peppers.name: CHARDONNAY
peppers.description: A popular sweet bell pepper that ripens relatively quickly.  Good for short growing seasons.  Reported to be resistant to Tobacco Mosaic Virus and Bacterial Leaf Spot.

peppers.name: MAULE
peppers.description: An heirloom cayenne offered by Peppermania.  Said to originate from the US.

peppers.name: QUEEN LAURIE PI1281405
peppers.description: Capsicum Baccatum. Originates from Peru. USDA variety PI 281405. Pods can reach 4 inches and ripen from green to orange.

peppers.name: WHITE BHUT JOLOKIA
peppers.description: This variety has been suggested by a member and has not yet been verified. It may be a different name for an existing variety, or one of the many new names being used for unstable variations on the main superhot varieties.

peppers.name: CAP 1491
peppers.description: We do not currently have any information about this variety.

peppers.name: CHOCOLATE MORUGA SCORPION
peppers.description: This variety has been suggested by a member and has not yet been verified. It may be a different name for an existing variety, or one of the many new names being used for unstable variations on the main superhot varieties.

peppers.name: PINK TIGER CHILI
peppers.description: This variety has been suggested by a member and has not yet been verified. It may be an unstable variety or it may be here to stay, time will tell.
